loans.name: Kandahar Traders Association, Lugazi Group

texts.en:
Buluhani K., the leader of the lending group Kandahar traders association, is a married father of two school-going children and sells cows and goats in Kandahar. He is able to get 100,000/= as weekly profits and is happy that he also grows crops for both sale and home consumption.

Buluhani has been in business for 10 years, having started with a retail shop. He plans to buy more goats for resale and dreams of purchasing a motorcycle for hire and educating his children to the highest level.

loans.use: to buy goats for resale

loans.name: Claire

texts.en:
Claire is a thirty-four-year-old single mother with three children living in her own semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is solely charged with the responsibility of looking after the children and her family dream is to educate them and also build a permanent house for residence.

Six years ago, Claire separated from her husband and she realised that she could not raise children without a stable income, so she decided to trade in used shoes. The venture has facilitated her in providing the basics to her family. Her initial capital was 400,000 but she has now accumulated up to 3,400,000 shillings in working capital. She has challenges of irregular sales and delayed payment of her debtors and her dream is to own a boutique. Claire needs the loan facility to buy shoes for resale.

loans.use: To buy shoes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To open another outlet in Kitengela.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is a thirty-three-year-old married woman with two children living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda.She takes care of the family with the help of her husband who is a businessman and their dream is to build a permanent house for residence.

She has been selling shoes for seven years starting with 620,000 but her current working capital is two million shillings. Sylvia has a challenge of bad debts and her desire is to own a boutique. Sylvia needs the loan to buy used shoes for resale.

loans.use: To buy used shoes for resale.

loans.name: Najjembe Women's Group A, Lugazi

texts.en:
K. Paul is the leader of Najjembe Women’s Group 1 in Lugazi. He is 38 years old and married with five children of whom three are in school. Paul has had a business selling cold water at Najjembe market to travelers for a period of eight years and he is happy that he makes 160,000/= as weekly profits. He hires four people that do the selling to the various cars that stop over for the refreshment.

 It is after Paul dropped out of school that he joined the business that has expanded over the years. He also sells "matooke" (plantains) some of which he grows himself and this boosts his income. He is very hard-working and reliable and he needs a loan to be able to buy more water for resale as well as buying seeds for planting during this rainy season.

loans.use: To buy more water for resale and seeds for planting during this rainy season.

loans.name: Oeurm

texts.en:
Oeurm S., 39, is a local rice farmer who has been working in this sector since 2007. She and her husband grow rice on their own farmland. They also harvest and sell their mature produce around three months after they began planting, and they always use their plowing machine to help support them in the farm field. 

From this business, they can generate an income of around 2.50 USD per day. This humble couple has four single children. Recently, their machine broke down while plowing, and their rice growing business will be affected. Therefore, Oeurn S. is taking out her loan to repair her plowing machine.

loans.use: to repair her plowing machine.

loans.name: Khishigjargal

texts.en:
Khishigjargal is 31 years old, lives with his wife and one son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live together in a 'ger', the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His son Ochirbat, 5, attends a local kindergarten and his wife Munkhuul, 40, works at fast food cafe as a chef. 

Khishigjargal has operated a taxi service in city since 2002 and has gained a lot of experience over the years. He was renting a taxi before and lately he purchased a second-hand car that he is using in his business. He enjoys transporting people and is very hard-working person. He has gained a lot of experience over the years and is a trusted driver for his many clients. He is planning to build a wooden house on his land and to give a proper education to his only son. He is requesting a loan to increase his working capital by buying some spare parts for his car.

loans.use: to purchase some spare parts for his taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more livestock for trade.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, flour, cooking oil, sugar, tea leaves and margarine for her shop.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan Y. is a 52-year-old farmer and mother blessed with five children, four of whom are attending public school, and one of whom is married. Her husband, Ban Phan, 49, earns an income by playing Khmer music in and around Kompong Cham Province. Recently, the family's living conditions have not been comfortable because their house is in the process of being built, so Chan is requesting a loan to purchase needed housing materials.

loans.use: to purchase housing equipment in order to build her new house.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 30-year-old married man who lives with his wife and three children in Chtoura. He owns a small restaurant (known as a snack in his region) where he serves fast food and sandwiches. Mohammad opened his own restaurant in 2005 but has 15 years of experience in this field. He started working in restaurants when he was 15 to help meet his family’s household expenses as their financiA. situation was not good. 

Mohammad works to improve himself by expanding his business. He used his first loan to make some necessary changes to his house. Mohammad is requesting his second loan from A. Majmoua to buy an additionA. grill to meet his customer’s needs. He is anxious to receive his loan which he will use to increase his income and help provide the best childhood for his children, unlike the one he had.

loans.use: to buy a restaurant grill

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, sweets, flour and food to sell

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao S. is a 32-year-old married woman and mother. She lives in Kompong Cham and she and her husband have three children who live with them. Mao is a local rice farmer who has been working in this sector since her children were young. Currently, she earns a living by cultivating different kinds of crops on a plot of land that she owns. Her husband helps her in the farming business. 

Mao is requesting a loan to add to her personal savings to buy a plot of her neighbor’s farmland near her house. This is a good location for farming and she will rent out the land to farmers for a fee. Her loan will provide her with an additional new asset.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland

loans.name: Zainab's Group

texts.en:
Zainab is a resident of Chichawatni which is a small agricultural city of Punjab, Pakistan. She lives there in the area of Al-Fateh town with her family in a 3-room brick house. She came here five years ago with her family. 

She is a 23-year-old caring lady, who carries out her responsibilities as a housewife by staying at home. She performs her daily tasks very well and makes the utmost effort to give comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs. She is the mother of a 5-year-old son and a 3-year-old daughter. She is still unable to send her children to school due to poor financial conditions. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her husband’s construction supplies business. Her husband whose name is M. Y., has been operating this business for the past five years. He provides construction supplies on order to customers who require them. Zainab is hopeful that an investment will help her husband in fulfilling the orders on time and increase his profits. 

She is a new loan user and this is her first experience with getting loans from Asasah. She hopes that it will be a profitable experience for her husband and family.

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Zainab.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies for construction supplies sales business.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 46-year-old married man with five children. He lives with his family in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His wife is a farmer. For the past 25 years, Charles has operated a butcher shop and with the income he has generated has been able to pay the school fees for two of his children who are at the university. Charles faces the challenge of high taxes and is requesting a loan to buy cows for slaughter.

With his wife’s support, Charles dreams of educating all of his children through university. He also would like to own a ranch.

loans.use: to buy cows for slaughter

loans.name: Dos

texts.en:
Dos S. O. is 32 years of age and a married woman. 

In order to meet the needs of the family, Dos S. O. sells a little grocery inventory in her village. She has been in this sector for many years and is earning approximately $3 per day. 

To help contribute for the family, her husband works as a construction foreman in Phnom Penh city. This couple has been married for years, but they don’t have a baby yet. 

Dos S. O. hopes to enlarge her business and is applying for a US $400 loan to be used to accumulate a larger number of necessary grocery items to sell. This will allow her to increase her income and help her entire family to attain a good standard of living.

loans.use: to accumulate a larger number of necessary grocery items to sell

loans.name: Merline Nadege

texts.fr:
Merline est une cliente de Hope Congo âgée de 35 ans; célibataire avec un enfant a sa charge.

Il ya bientôt 7 ans qu'elle s'est lancée dans le commerce de poisson sale a l'arrêt de ses études 

Ayant déjà bénéficie de deux cycles de prêts a Hope, elle a rembourse sans difficultés et a des énormes épargnes 
Avec le troisième prêt elle veut élargir son activité en achetant des cartons de poissons sales comme la morue, le thon , la sole , capitaine, et ses intentions c'est commencer déjà a faire la vente en demi gros et détails.

A la longue , elle veut ouvrir un dépôt de poisson sale pour être grossiste et avec ses bénéfices elle compte améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et aussi amener son enfant a faire des études universitaires .
texts.en:
Merline is 35 years old, has a child in her care and is a client of Congo Hope.
Almost seven years ago she got into the salted fish business, after completing her education.
She already received two loans from Hope Congo, that she was able to fully repay and could also make some saving. 
With this third loan she wants to expand her business by buying cartons of salted fish like cod, tuna, sole, captain and her intention is to get into whole sale as well as retail.
In the long term, she would like to start a wholesale business of salted fish and with her profits she expects to improve the life condition of her family and also to be able to pay for college education for her child.

loans.use: to purchase boxes of salted fish, such as cod, tuna, sole, captain

loans.name: Najjembe Women's Group B, Lugazi

texts.en:
Faraziah K. is the leader of Najjembe Women’s Group B in Lugazi. She is 40 years old and married with six children, five of whom are still in school. For the past 13 years, Faraziah has run a hotel catering service in Najjembe. Because she is so hardworking and reliable with good customer service, Faraziah is able to make 240,000 UGX in monthly profit. She started her business after dropping out of school. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying raw ingredients to prepare a variety of dishes for her customers.

In the future, Faraziah hopes to better educate her children and buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare a variety of dishes

loans.name: Sinai Group

texts.fr: Mwavita K.  est entrepreneur, leader du groupe d’affaire Sinaï, âgée de 45 ans, mariée, mère de 8 enfants qui étudient  tous. Son mari est chômeur, sans emploi. La  cliente Mwavita K.  fait le petit commerce des articles divers. Elle installe ses marchandises à son domicile. Vers 1998, elle démarra son activité avec un fonds propre reçu de son mari. En 2006, elle bénéficia de premier crédit de l’IMF Hekima pour  renforcer  son capital. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  des nouvelles marchandises entre autres 1 sac de riz, 1 sac de sucres, 10 paires des souliers, etc.  En plus, elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise, construire une maison  confortable.  La cliente Mwavita K.  remercie l’IMF Hekima pour  ses actions dédiées aux pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Le groupe Sinaï est constitué de 15 membres.
texts.en:
Mwavita K. is an entrepreneur, and leader of the Sinaï business group, which consists of 15 members. She is 45 years old, married, and the mother of eight children who all go to school. Her husband is unemployed. 

Mwavita K. runs a small business selling sundries from her home. She started this activity in 1998 with her own funds received from her husband. In 2006, she obtained her first loan from the Hekima MFI to strengthen her capital. 

This new loan will allow her to stock up on new merchandise including I bag of rice, 1 bag of sugar, 10 pairs of shoes, etc. She also plans to expand her business, and build a comfortable home. 

Mwavita K. wishes to thank the Hekima MFI for their actions in support of impoverished women who do not have access to traditional banks.

loans.use: to buy 1 bag of rice, 1 bag of sugar, 10 pairs of shoes, etc.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs,sheeps and goats to rear and sell later at a profit

loans.name: Ramza

texts.en:
Ramza is 35 years old. She is married and the mother of two children. She lives with her precious family in Chtoura. Ramza used to work as a hairdresser, but she did not like her work very much. Since childhood, she has had a dream of working with wedding dresses and therefore she changed her business. Since 2007, Ramza has run a business renting wedding and special occasion dresses from her house. She is very good at her business because it is what she loves.

Ramza has relied on her husband’s support to begin and maintain her business. He helped her financially in the beginning and after that Ramza had the moral courage and hard work to invest in expanding her business. Her business depends on good public relations, since it requires her to present herself to society.  Ramza has a strong personality and has been able to overcome all of her difficulties. She is proud to help her husband raise secure, healthy and educated children and she hopes to provide them with good society until they are on their own. 

Ramza has been an Al Majmoua borrower for the past five years. She believes that it is her lucky charm. She has used her previous loans to help start and expand her business through adding new collections. She is requesting a new loan to expand her dress collection and provide heating for her house. Ramza’s future dream is to open a big shop and reach a wider number of customers.

loans.use: to buy a new wedding and engagement dress collection

loans.name: Shamshad's Group

texts.en:
Shamshad is a resident of Chichawatni which is a small city of Punjab province, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. Her home consists of two rooms and she has been living in the housing colony known as Al-Fateh town for the past 30 years. 

She is married to L. A. who operates a donkey cart. With his cart, he offers loading/unloading services to his clients. He is very much experienced in his work and has been operating this business for the past 10 years. Due to the good quality of his services, his clients trust him and give him regular orders. 

Shamshad is the mother of three sons. All of them are illiterate because Shamshad couldn’t afford their education. Her eldest son operates a Punjabi food selling business. With his cart, he sells a traditional food called "Golgappy" (which is made of flour and served with spicy sauces). Her second son operates a tea stall, and the youngest one has a barber shop. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband whose donkey cart has gone rough and needs a replacement. With a new cart, he will be able to carry heavier loads and serve his clients better. Shamshad is very hopeful that an investment will bring positive changes to her husband’s business and improve his income. 

She is a new loan applicant and this is her 1st loan application with Asasah. She hopes it will be a good experience. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shamshad.

loans.use: To buy a new cart for loading/unloading business.

loans.name: Muok

texts.en:
The woman in the photograph is Muok S. who earns a living by raising pigs.

Muok S. is a mother who earns her daily revenue by working as a local farmer in the village, raising pigs. In addition, she also assists her husband to cultivate a rice crop. 

Muok S. has given birth to five children. Two are married and live separately and the other three are still single. 

Muok S. has always been successful in her pig-raising investment because she has knowledge of this sector from years ago. 

To earn additional income, Muok S. is applying for a loan to buy piglets for breeding.

loans.use: to buy piglets for breeding

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new boat

loans.name: Aean

texts.en:
Mrs. Aean, age 54, is a white wine maker and a farmer. She owns a 10-hectare plot of land where she grows rice. She sells part of the rice she harvests and with the rest of the rice she supports her family. She is a widow with six children, two of whom are farmers and one of whom is employed in an organization. The youngest are studying in the local public school. 
  
She is currently encountering problems because her field contains infertile soil and it has a lot of insects. To improve her production of rice, Mrs. Aean is applying for a loan in order to buy fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide for use in her rice field

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase chicks to raise and sell

loans.name: Phun

texts.en:
Mrs. Phun is a widow with two children. One is a construction worker and the other is a seamstress in a garment factory. 

She is a pig breeder who can earn some profit to support her family. Although she trys to work hard, she can earn only a little income. 

Recently, she decided to buy two cows to be bred to start a new business, but her money is not enough to buy them. So reach her goal, Mrs. Phun is applying for a loan to add to her savings to buy two cows to be bred.

loans.use: To buy two cows

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Srey S. is 58 years old and has been living in Kompong Thom. She married Mr. Sour, age 61, many years ago and both of them earn their daily income by planting rice crops. This old couple has 5 single children, all of whom work at different occupations. With this loan, Srey S. will purchase a plot of farmland from a villager in order to grow various kinds of crops. This will enable the family to accrue extra profit to meet their daily expenses. In addition, she will use some of the loan to buy some zinc to cover the roof of her old house.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of farmland and buy some zinc to cover the roof of her old house

loans.name: Nav

texts.en:
Mrs. Nav is a married woman who has 5 children, one of whom is a laborer, while the others are attending local public school. The children also help with the family business. She and her husband, Mr. Sre, are farmers who own a 1-hectare plot of land where they can grow both rice and vegetables. They sell part of the crops and with the rest they support their family. Mrs. Nav has some problems because the soil in her field is infertile and it is far away from an irrigation system. So to improve production, Mrs. Nav is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline, and with the rest of the loan she wants to dig a well. 

Mrs. Nav is shown in the photo with her husband.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and gasoline

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new boat

loans.name: Nary

texts.en: Mrs. Nary is married to Mr. Tang Oun, who is a soldier. Together, they have 3 children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, one is a construction worker, and another is studying in local public school. Mrs. Nary owns a general store in a local village where she earns some profit to support her family. She is also a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she grows rice to sell. Part of the rice crop is used to support her family. Since her business is getting on well, she wants to expand. So to improve this purpose, Mrs. Nary is seeking a loan to buy more groceries for the store. With the rest of the loan, she is going to buy some piglets for breeding and pig food to start a new business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries for her store

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph O. is 31 years old, married to Zilpa, and they have one child who is six years old. They live in Kisumu county.

Joseph has a butcher shop that he has been running  for the past 10 years. He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a friend who is a client. Joseph intends to use the money to buy more pork to sell in his butcher shop.

He hopes to see his butchery expand in the future and also expand his little restaurant business.

loans.use: To buy more pork to sell.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mrs. Mom is a farmer who owns a .5-hectare plot of land where she grows rice. She sells part of the rice and with the rest of the rice she feeds her family. Her husband, Mr. Vanna, is a construction worker and he also sells traditional medicine. Although they try to work hard, they earn only a small income. 

To improve this situation, Mrs. Mom is applying for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business. She is the mother of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while the others are studying in a local public school.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Sarah Akinyi

texts.en:
Sarah Akinyi O. is 25 years old, comes from Kisumu and is married to Heston Ogola. They have two children who are both in school.

Sarah has a shoe business consisting of both second-hand shoes and new ones. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to add more shoes to her stock. Sarah is optimistic that her business will do better after the loan. 

The profits made will be used to pay school fees for her children. She hopes to have a shoe boutique in the future.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to add to her stock.

loans.name: Chroeb

texts.en: Mrs. Chroeb is the mother of four children, two of whom are laborers while the others are studying in a local public school. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she can grow rice. She sells part of the rice, and with the rest of the rice she feeds her family. Her husband, Mr. Sorn, is a construction worker. Now she has a problem because her husband’s workplace is far away from her home. So to improve this condition, Mrs. Chroeb is seeking a loan to buy a new motorcycle for transportation.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle for transportation

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn A. works hard to support her four children. She is married and has a livestock business in the Philippines.

Analyn requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy an Envirofit cookstove.

She is getting the Envirofit cookstove because she wants to save money by using the dried wood she can pick from her surroundings.

Analyn is aware that by using the Envirofit cookstove, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a Envirofit cookstove

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua W. is 26 years old, comes from Kisumu county and is married to Ruth Achieng who is a nursery school teacher. They have one child who has not started school yet.

Joshua has a tree nursery business and he has been in it for the past nine years. He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy seeds, polythene bags, manure and pesticides to enable him to run his business well. Joshua is hoping that his business will grow after he gets the loan and is able to achieve his purpose with it. 

The profits made will be used to cater for the family's needs. He hopes to open tree gardens in different places and also to buy a plot of land in the future.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for his tree nursery.

loans.name: Mrs. Phalla Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of eight people who will each use their portion of the loan for a different purpose that can improve their famiL.'s standard of living. Phalla is the village bank president who has been selected by the other members. She was born in 1967. She is a noodle seller in the local village where she can earn some money to support her famiL.. She also owns a general store in the village. Since her business is getting on well, she wants to expand. 

So to improve her business, Phalla is seeking a loan to buy more groceries to sell. She is a widow with five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while another one is helping her with her business, and the others are studying in a local public school.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: San

texts.en: San Y. earns a living by raising pigs in a pigpen behind her house. She raises them both for their offspring and for slaughter. In addition, she also cultivates rice crops on her own farmland.  She has another financial earner in her husband who goes to buy animals from the villagers, fattens them for a while and then sells them for a profit. In the past, San Y. has always hired a plowing machine from her neighbor in order to alleviate the chore of plowing the farmland. Right now, she hopes to buy two cows to add to her farming business and that is why she is applying for a loan from Kiva. This will provide her with an additional fixed asset.

loans.use: to buy two cows to add to her farming business.

loans.name: Mrs. Roeurn Village Bank Group

texts.en: The twelve people who make up this village bank loan will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes, so that it can improve their family's standard of living. Mrs. Roeurn is the village bank president who has been selected by the other members. She was born in 1960. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she can grow rice and vegetables to sell to support her family. Now she has a problem because her house is in a puddle. So to improve this condition, Mrs. Roeurn is seeking a loan to buy soil for filling in around her house. She is a widow with a child who is employed in the garment factory. All the members are shown in the picture except for one at the right who is blocked.

loans.use: to buy soil to fill in around her house

loans.name: Bassima

texts.en:
Bassima is a 41-year-old married woman, living in Saida with her husband and three children. Bassima owns a shop where she has sold gifts and souvenirs in addition to decorating lamps, since 2009. 

Bassima is a hard worker. She used to be a tutor, but her courage and strong will to improve herself led her to start her own business. She started saving a small capital to open her shop, and in fact she made it. 

Bassima is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to add new products to increase her income and expand her collections of products such as silver and crystals and starting to sell bed sheets and blankets.

Bassima wants to expand her shop and to introduce new products continuously to her customers. She helps her husband in raising their children and providing them secure and healthy living with the necessary education they must get. She hopes to see her kids reach high levels.

loans.use: To increase her collection through adding silver, crystals and blankets.

loans.name: Mrs. Sem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of eight people who will use their portion of the loan for different purposes so that it can improve their family's standard of living. Mrs. Sem is the village bank president who has been selected by the other members. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she can grow rice. She sells part of the rice and with the rest she feeds her family. She is the mother of three children, two of whom are studying in a local public school. The youngest one is a 2-year-old.

She is a duck and chicken breeder, while her husband, Mr. Saren, is a teacher in a local school and he also owns a mill. Since her business is getting on well, she wants to expand. To make this happen, Mrs. Sem is seeking a loan to buy more chickens.

loans.use: to buy more chickens

loans.name: Gankhuyag

texts.en:
Gankhuyag is 41 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live together in small wooden house on his land. His two children, Bayarchimeg and Ganzorig, are high school and secondary school students. His wife works at “Mongol Goyol LLC” as a salesperson. 

Gankhuyag runs a taxi business in a city using his own car which he bought on a leasing contract from his taxi company where he used to work as a taxi driver. Gankhuyag is very hard-working person and is known for his good character. He has gained a lot of experience over the years and is a trusted driver for his many clients. He is requesting a loan to buy a second-hand car in better condition.

loans.use: to buy a second-hand car in better condition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a deep freezer and a warmer for storage of food.

loans.name: Yem

texts.en:
The woman in the picture is Yem L. who currently lives in Kompong Thom Province. Yem L. earns a living by raising pigs in a pigpen behind her house. She raises them both for their offspring and for slaughter. In addition, she also cultivates a rice crop, while her husband is a firewood seller. 

They have five children, all of whom are single; they also work with her in pig raising. Because the pig-raising business is a very profitable one for Yem L. and her family, she has requested a loan in order to buy piglets to raise for sale.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise for sale.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a hard-working married man with five children, living in his own semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has the responsibility of taking care of the family with the help of his wife who is a businesswoman and their desire is to educate their children to attain degrees since they themselves did not go to school.

Charles distills alcohol and also trades in coffee and has been in business for ten years, still reaping tangible benefits. He has a challenge of fluctuation of coffee prices, and his aspiration is owning a coffee store and exporting to other East African countries. Charles needs the loan facility to buy coffee for resale.

loans.use: To buy coffee for resale.

loans.name: Marceline

texts.en:
Marceline is 53 year old and is married with three children between the ages of 20 and 23 years old. She has owned a small business for  eight year's of experience. She sells a variety of products like books, soft drinks, and cooking oil. This business is well-organized. She starts from 6 am until 8 pm daily and she employs one person to help her.

Marceline has now requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to expand her business by purchasing more goods such as books, soft drinks, and cooking oil to sell. With this profit, She will reinvest  in her business and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To purchase more goods such as books, soft drinks, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel O. is 26 years old, married, and has two children.  He is from the Manyatta area. Daniel has a retail shop, which he has been running for the past three years. He is requesting his first loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase sweets, detergents, cooking oil, wheat flour, etc. to add to his stock.  He hopes to use the profits to expand his business into a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To purchase sweets, detergents, cooking oil, etc. to sell

loans.name: Soeurn

texts.en: Soeurn S. is a woman who earns a living by growing rice crops and different kinds of vegetables on her own farmland in Kompong Cham province. In addition to her farming business, she also sells a few fish to the neighbors for a daily profit. Her husband works in the field with her, and he is also a district policeman. They are blessed with six children. Five are single and one is married and lives independently in their own house. Soeurn S. is seeking a loan to dig a well for irrigating her rice and vegetable crops.

loans.use: to dig a well for irrigating her rice and vegetables crops

loans.name: Hadidja

texts.en: Hadidja M. is 27 years old and is married with two children between the ages 2 and 5 years old.  Hadidja sells shoes in the market and she has five year's of experience.  Her business is well-organized. She employs two person to help her.  She starts from 6:30 am until 6:30 pm every day.  Hadidja has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more shoes to sell. With this profits, Hadidja will reinvest in her business, satisfy her customers and to build her own house.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is 37 years old, married, and has five children.  They live in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda.He is solely charged with the responsibility of looking after his family and educating his children since he did not get the chance for an education. In order to provide basics to his family, he decided to start a motorcycle transport business and has been doing so for three years.  He has the hardships of high fuel charges and the desire is to own at least two motorcycles.  Patrick is requesting a loan to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for transport business

loans.name: Thoi

texts.en: Thoi T. T. is 37 years old. She lives with her family in Ly nhan village. She grows rice and raises pigs for meat. Her business has lasted for long time but it is not successful. To earn more money, she made wine to sell at retail in 2008. Every day, she can make 70,000 Vietnamese dong in profits. Ms Thoi  was a client of our credit program in 2006. During that time, she was always a good re-payer and used her loans effectively. Currently, she wants to borrow 6,322,000 Vietnamese dong to buy material to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy material to make wine

loans.name: Nancy Achieng

texts.en:
Nancy O. is 32 years old and is married as a third wife to Richard Owino who is a policeman. They have two children, one in class eight and the other one in class five.

Nancy has a business of selling cereals and has been in this business for the past 13 years. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy wheat, cassava, rice, beans and groundnuts to add to the stock. 

The profits made from her business will be used to cater for the family's upkeep and pay her children's school fees. She hopes to own a big cereals shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy wheat, cassava, rice, beans and groundnuts

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha T. is 55 years old and married with six children.

Editha works hard to provide for her family. She runs a ready-to-wear clothing store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy more clothes for her store to sell.

Editha has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the ready-to-wear clothing store for 10 years and also earns an income from retailing gasoline and running a general store.

Editha aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional clothes to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nouhad

texts.en:
Nouhad is a 46 year old divorced woman, mother of one girl, and owner of a bags shop since 2008. She has 22 years of experience in this field. Nouhad used to work as a teacher, but she felt that she had to prove herself in her own business where she can invest her talent and effort in an efficient way. Nouhad struggled a lot to keep her daughter satisfied and happy, to avoid the feeling of kids who suffer from divorced parents' struggles. Nouhad had her mother and daughter's support to start this business, and she also took the strength from her friends.

Her business is improving, and it's all through the previous loan she got from Al Majmoua, which helped in improving her social life too. This time Nouhad is requesting a loan in order to introduce new products to her customers such as cosmetics and accessories. She wants her customers to  need such products the moment they step into her shop. She's respected by all of her customers, neighbors and friends. Nouhad hopes to expand through adding new products in the future.

loans.use: to add new products to her business such as cosmetics and accessories

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en: Fredrick is a thirty-three year old married man with two children living in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is an artist and has been in business for six years. After realising the high operational costs of his previous business, he decided to use his skills and set up an art gallery and he is very proud of his decision. He has challenges of limited capital to meet the increasing demand of his customers and his desire is to become a famous artist in the region. Fredrick needs the loan to buy raw materials.

loans.use: to buy raw materials

loans.name: Everline Angango

texts.en:
Everline  is 32 years old from the Mamboleo area and is a single mother to three children aged between 13 and six years old.

Everline has a retail shop that she has been operating for the past 13 years. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a friend. Everline will use the money to buy sugar, cooking oil, flour, etc. to add to her stock. The profits made from this business will be used to pay school fees for her children and also expand her business.

She hopes to own a wholesale shop in the future. Everline also wants to buy land and be able to build a family house.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking oil, and cooking flour.

loans.name: Damira's Group

texts.en:
Damira S. is the leader of this group.  She is a resident of Kochkor – a small village in Isykul region. She is 53 and married. Together with her husband she has raised two sons; the first son works as a taxi driver and the second is a farmer.

Four years ago, with the initial investment of 7000 soms, Damira started to breed cattle and then resell it at a higher price after fattening. In this way she earns 5000 soms per month. That profit made it possible for her to save some money and purchase a fridge. With money received from the loan she wants to increase the number of cattle. In the near future Damira plans to purchase a vehicle for her younger son, to make him able to work as a taxi driver. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Chhuon

texts.en:
Chhuon M. presently resides in the Dongkor commune of Phnom Penh city. He makes an income by working in the garment industry as a sewing-machine repairer and earns a formal salary monthly. His wife also works as a sewing worker in the garment factory. The couple usually generates a daily profit of around $5 each day to use for the family. 

Chhuon M. would like to request a loan to build a new kitchen for his whole family to use to cook tasty meals. Chhuon M. is blessed with two children who still study in the public school.

loans.use: to build a new kitchen for his family

loans.name: Ninchele

texts.en:
Ninchele R. is married to Mboudjeko Jean, and has four children. She has been very hard working from the day she joined GHAPE. Her desire is to work for her children’s education and pay for their school fees so that they can be educated. She decided to become a member of GHAPE due to her inability to get investment capital, which could give her a higher income to meet her children’s needs and family's needs.

With this loan, she plans to buy seedlings, fertilizer and manure. This will enable her to farm vegetables, corn, tomatoes, and other spices. This investment will help people in her community to have enough spices, tomatoes and other greens at a reduced rate. She is planning on using the profits generated to sponsor her children in school. She will plough back her profit into her business and use part to care for her family. She also will use the proceeds to pay her children's school fees, and save some for rainy days. She prefers GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives and the low cost in obtaining and paying back the loan.

About GHAPE:
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and manure

loans.name: Nalukenge

texts.en:
Nalukenge M. is an individual client from the Mpigi Branch of Pearl Microfinance. She is 20 years old and married with 1 child aged 2. She has a business of buying, smoking and selling dry/smoked fish from Bukalunga, Ggolo. She sells her fish to fish buyers that come to her stall at the lake shore and her home. She is able to make an income of 1,200,000UGX in a month from a business that she has been operating for 3 years. She is hard working and devoted and she needs a loan to be able to buy more fish for smoking. Her future plan is to be able to build a house for her family.

In the photo, Nalukenge stands next to her smoked fish with the Loan officer on the left.

loans.use: to buy more fish for smoking and selling.

loans.name: Willis Otieno

texts.en:
Willis Otieno is 37 years old from Corner Mbuta in Kisumu county. He is married to Rehema and they have four children who are all boys.

Willis has a retail shop that he has been running for the past seven years and is in need of new stock. He has therefore applied for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy cooking oil, flour, sugar and detergents to add to his stock. 

He will use the profits made from his business to cater for his family's needs and also pay school fees for his children. He hopes to be able to expand his shop to become wholesale in the future.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, flour, sugar, soap etc. to add to stock.

loans.name: Lien

texts.en:
Lien T. T., 27 years old with one small child, lives in Ly nhan village. Being a farmer,she grows rice and vegetables, and also raises pigs for meat. A part of the agricultural products is used to support her family, and the rest is sold for money to provide her daily income.

In order to create savings, she bought a rice making machine - a machine that turns raw rice into a product for daily food. Every day, she gets 100,000 Vietnamese dong profit. Ms. Lien has been a client of our program since 2007, and she has used loans effectively in expanding her business. For this new loan cycle, she wants to borrow money to maintain the machine.

loans.use: to maintain the machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair her house which is broken down

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en: Teddy is a thirty-four year old married woman with four children, who lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. She owns a permanent house and her family dream is to educate her children to attain a degree as a minimum qualification. She has been in the agricultural sector for fifteen years and she is able to sell 100 bunches of bananas per month. She faces the challenge of limited manpower, and she would like to buy her own vehicle to transport her produce and diversify into growing tomatoes. Teddy needs the loan to grow tomatoes.

loans.use: to grow tomatoes

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen J. M. is 24 years old, married to Victor, and they are both farmers, which is a big boost for the family. They have two children aged three years and three weeks old respectively. They live in Eldoret, Kenya. She is a farmer and has been in this business for the past three years with a monthly profit of KES. 20,000. 

She learned about KADET LTD through marketing awareness done in the area and she is applying for her second loan of KES. 60,000 from KADET LTD, which she intends to use to buy 10 bags of fertilizer and 75kg of maize seeds. The anticipated profits she plans to use to purchase her own land to farm.

In future, Hellen wishes to expand her business and also have a dairy farm. Her deepest desire is to see her children realize their goals in life through better education.

loans.use: to buy 10 bags of fertilizer and 75 kg of maize seeds

loans.name: Ange

texts.fr:
Ange est un client de Hope, célibataire et père de trois  enfants. n'ayant pas de moyens pour faire des longues études , après son Bac , il apprend la couture, a la fin de son apprentissage en 1996, il ouvre un atelier de couture .
Ayant déjà bénéficie de deux prêts de Hope Congo, il a eu a faire des épargnes considérables et a rembourse sans difficulté.
A l'octroi de son troisième prêt il va renforcer le stock des pagnes de différents qualités , des tissus,de lots de fils a coudre, de la doublure, après il confectionne des chemises, des camisoles, des robes prêt a porter qu'il vend a des prix abordables. 
Pour l'avenir , il veut agrandir son activité , continuer a former les jeunes filles mères et ouvrir une école d'apprentissage de coupe et couture des jeunes filles mères.
texts.en:
Ange is single and the father of three children. Lacking the necessary financial means, he couldn't pursue his studies and, after his high school diploma, he learned sewing. After completing his training in 1996, he opened a sewing workshop.

He already benefited from two loans from Kiva's partner, Hope Congo. He managed to put away a lot of money, and repaid the loan without problems. He will use his third loan to bolster his stock of pagnes (colorful African cloth) in various qualities, and buy fabric, sewing thread, and lining. He then makes shirts, camisoles, and ready-to-wear dresses that he sells at an affordable price.

In the future, he would like to expand his business, continue training teenage mothers and open a school for them, to train them in tailoring and sewing.

loans.use: to buy pagnes (colorful African cloth) in various qualities, fabric, sewing thread, and lining

loans.name: Samira

texts.en:
Samira is a 45 year old married woman, who lives with her husband in Chtoura. Since 2008, Samira has owned a small shop that sells home products, such as plastic bowls and tupperware. She has tried to improve her business more through adding gifts, accessories and cosmetics, but her business still needs more products to develop.

Samira has no children, and she had hoped to have children, so that's why she spends most of her time working in order not to feel lonely. Samira is a kind person, and she is loved by all of her customers who insist on passing by to check on her even though they don't want to buy anything. This is her third cycle with Al Majmoua, and each time she requested a loan to add new products to her small business. This time it is for the same reason, as she wants to support her cosmetics and accessories trade.

loans.use: to increase stock of cosmetics and accessories

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a thirty-seven year old married woman who lives in her own semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has been farming for five years and with the proceeds she has been able to educate her children with the help of her husband, who is a driver.

In a season, Margret used to harvest a sack of beans, but she now has increased her capacity and she harvests seven sacks in a season of three months. She has a challenge of limited labour and her dream is to farm extensively. Margret needs the loan facility to grow maize and beans.

loans.use: to grow maize and beans.

loans.name: Didaikan's Group

texts.en:
Didaikan M. is the leader of this group. She is 54 and married. Together with her husband she has raised two daughters and two sons.  The first son and the first daughter are married and live separately with their families. The second daughter went to work in Russia and the second son is handicapped. All her life, Didaikan has been breeding cattle, and she earns 3000 soms per month by reselling farm animals at a higher price after fattening. With money received from the loan, Didaikan wants to increase the number of cattle. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Sorn N. is a 38-year-old married woman who earns a daily income cultivating rice crops. She owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents, and she uses this land to grow different kinds of crops. Her husband works in the farm fields frequently alongside her. They have five unmarried children. One of their children is employed as a sewing worker on a fixed salary. Sorn N. currently generates an income of approximately $1.5 per day from her rice-growing business. 

To make additional income, Sorn N. is applying for a loan to purchase many ducklings for feeding, and she will sell them out when they are big enough.

loans.use: to purchase ducklings to raise and sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary was born in 1956; she is married to Paul Fumbui and a mother of eight children who are all above the age of 15. They live in Foncha Street, an area in Nkwen Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon.

Mary has faced major challenges in her life ranging from sickness to poverty. The most difficult have been the problems of raising capital for her business and paying for her children’s education. She plans to invest this loan in selling firewood. She will be able to raise a lot of profit from the business because it is in high demand in her community. She believes the business will succeed because she has been in the business for a long time. She has successfully borrowed and repaid loans eight times in GHAPE and all the loans were invested in her firewood business. She also thinks her approach to her customers will be captivating and hence lead to the success of her business. The loan will help her community because they will be able to afford firewood at a very low cost, which will be used as fuel for cooking.
 
She will plough back her profit into her business and use part to care for her family. She also will use the proceeds to pay her children's school fees, and save some for rainy days. She prefers GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives and the low cost in obtaining and paying back the loan.

About GHAPE:
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to purchase firewood

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey is a thirty-nine year old married man with three children who lives in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. For five years he has been trading in cattle and he is also an employee of a non-government organisation. He faces the challenge of price flactuation and he dreams of owning a ranch. Godfrey needs the loan facility to buy a heifer to raise.

loans.use: to buy a heifer to raise

loans.name: Ramadhan

texts.en:
Ramadhan is 38 years old and is married with two children between the ages of 6 and 9 years old. Ramadhan has been a motorbike taxi driver for three years. His business is well-organized.  

Ramadhan has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to buy essential materials for his motorbike. With this profits, he will pay school fees for his two children and save for his future.

loans.use: To buy essential materials for his motorbike.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice N. was born in 1966; she is married to Vincent Tih Forsuh and is blessed with five children. She shares three rooms with her five children in Ayaba Street, a quarter in the Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon.

Alice has faced difficulties in her life ranging from the inability to meet her daily needs, the inability of her husband to get a job for himself nor carry out any activity that could raise income due to an accident, the inability of her first son to continue his education due to poverty, and the increasing demands of her children. Amongst other challenges, she also has had difficulties of inadequate capital to expand her business.

With this loan, she plans to buy more food stuff like rice, beans, and cocoa yams to cook to sell in her restaurant. She also plans to piglets and feed to open up a pig farm. She thinks her business will succeed, because her business site is close to the road and she is friendly, thus has many clients. Her activity will help her community in reducing the cost of transportation to buy foods in the market and their cordial relationship will give room for negotiation to pay later.

She will use a fraction of her profit to assist her husband, provide for the children’s school needs, meet her personal needs and that of her family. She prefers a loan from GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives, the follow up and moral support given her by the GHAPE office, and the low cost in obtaining and paying back a loan.

About GHAPE:
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to buy rice beans, piglets and feed

loans.name: Yisa

texts.en:
K. M. is married to K. David and she is a mother of two children who are both below the age of 15.  She shares four rooms with her children, and lives in mile three Nkwen, one of the areas found in the North West Region of Cameroon.

M. has encountered a lot of difficulties in life, such as getting three square meals a day, ill health, and not being able to get good medical treatment. These difficulties are all because she has no money. She joined GHAPE because she had heard and seen a lot of people testify about GHAPE, and she believes her life will not be the same if the loan is given to her. She plans to buy mesh and products with the loan. She is going to use the profits from the loan to increase her capital. Her community and family will benefit from the salon because she will make them very neat. Her activity will help reduce the distance to be travelled by members of her community, and it will be available at all times. M. says “her children will all be well-educated”. She prefers GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives, the follow-up, that GHAPE does not ask for collateral securities, the low cost in obtaining and paying back a loan, and that GHAPE takes care of the poor and payment is gradual. 

About GHAPE:
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to buy hair oil and mesh

loans.name: Muhamadi

texts.en:
Muhamadi is a forty-three year old married man with six children, who lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. The responsibility of caring for seven household members solely rests on him, and his desire is to build a permanent house in place of the current semi-permanent one.

For seven years he has been running a spare parts shop and the business has been very profitable, despite challenges in limited funds. His desire is to set up a garage. Muhamadi needs the credit facility to buy motor vehicle spare parts to sell.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to sell

loans.name: Theogene

texts.en:
Theogene is 30 years old and is married.  He and his wife have two children between the ages 2 and 5 years old. Theogene is transporting people from their workplace.

Theogene has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to buy motorbike.  with this profits, he will build a house for his family and save money for his future.

loans.use: To buy a motorcyle.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is a 52 year old married woman who is a mother to 3 children.  Zainab lives in Nabatieh,  She started her own business a year ago and sells clotheing that she exports from Turkey and Syria. 

Zainab is a hard worker and she has 25 years of experience in this field and she had the her courage was to start her own business.  Zainab is ambitious and her husband, children and friends are very proud of her.  She is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to increase the capital she has to travel to Turkey and buy new clothing collections.  She is a borrower in good standing and all of her payments are on time.  She is looking to open a new branch very soon to reach a wider customers target.

loans.use: To Travel to Turkey and buy a new clothes collection

loans.name: Denyse

texts.en:
Denyse is 36 years old and is still married with three children between the ages 5 and 11 year old. She is the only one in her family who works. She owns a small business selling various products such as body lotion, cooking oil, sugar and so on. Her business is clear and well-organized.

Denyse has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more goods like soap, biscuits, cooking oil and body lotion to sell. Denyse hopes to earn more profits, which will allow her to save money for her future and she will build a owns house for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more goods like body lotion, cooking oil, sugar etc.

loans.name: Benijean Donal

texts.fr:
Benijean est un client de Hope Congo age de 28 ans , marie et père de 2 enfants dont l'age varie entre 4 et 8 ans.
Prenant conscience de sa charge, il ouvre un stand d'alimentation ou il vend des produits de première nécessité comme le lait, bougie , savons, pains et  conserves.
Ayant déjà bénéficié de deux cycle de prêts ,il a rembourse sans trop de difficultés et a fait des épargnes considérables.
Pour ce troisième prêt, il compte élargir son stand en achetant des cartons de lait en poudre et écrémé, des cartons de bougies, de conserves, des bidons d'huile et tous les produits de première nécessité.
Pour le futur il pense ouvrir une boutique d'alimentation et avec ses bénéfices il pense améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et prendre en charge la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Benijean is a client of Hope Congo. He is 28 years old, married, and the father of two children, 4 and 8 years of age.

Aware of his responsibilities, he opened a food stand where he sells staples such as milk, candles, soap, bread, and canned goods. 

He received two previous loans. He repaid them without difficulty and boosted his savings considerably. With this third loan, he plans to expand his business by purchasing cartons of powdered milk and skimmed milk, boxes of candles, canned goods, cans of oil, and all other essential goods.

His goal for the future is to open a food store and use the profits to improve the living conditions for his family, and to support his children’s education.

loans.use: to buy boxes of canned goods, cartons of powdered milk, boxes of candles

loans.name: Asombang

texts.en:
Born in 1957, Asombang P. is married to Asombang Emmanule and is a mother of four children. She occupies four rooms with her four children in Ntambessi, a quarter in Nkwen Bamenda, Cameroon.

As an ambitious woman, she decided to put all her effort into seeing her children established in good vocations in life. Because of the untimely death of her father, she was unable to complete her education and thus lacked the capital to set up a good business for herself. She sought help from GHAPE for her business and to be able to support her husband in paying for their children's school fees.

Given this loan, she plans to cultivate crops and sell some foodstuff like crayfish, beans, and ground nuts. She will also use the loan to buy and rear piglets and buy feed for them. She will use the profit to pay school fees and buy medications.

About GHAPE:
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, crayfish, beans, groundnuts, and piglets and feed

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther N. was born in 1960, is married, and is blessed with six children. She shares ten rooms with her six children in Nabesi, a quarter in the Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon. Taking care of these children in a polygamous home is a very big and challenging task for Esther.

Esther has faced difficulties in her life ranging from ill health (operation), an accident, and theft which has crumbled her business. With this loan, she plans to buy food stuff like beans, rice, tomatoes, onions, garlic, maggi, corn, groundnuts, sugar, and cassava flakes commonly known as garri, and retail them. She also intends to buy firewood in large quantity and begin retailing it. She thinks her business will succeed because her business site is close to the road and she is friendly, thus has many clients. She has minimized risk by diversifying her business. Her activity will help her community in reducing their cost of transportation to buy foodstuffs and firewood, which will be used as fuel, and their cordial relationship will give room for negotiation to pay later in times of hardship.

She will use a fraction of her profit to buy a piece of land, assist her husband in providing for the children’s school needs, meet her personal needs, and those of her six children. She prefers a loan from GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives, the follow up and moral support given her by the GHAPE office, and the low interest rate, investment period, and the installmental method in paying back a loan.

About GHAPE:
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to buy firewood, garri, sugar, groundnuts, rice, beans, tomatoes, onions, and garlic

loans.name: Faten

texts.en:
Faten is a 25 year old single woman, living and working in Tayouneh. She owns a cosmetics sales shop, and is willing to add new products such as for babies and infants. She opened her business 2 years ago, and is working hard on improving it. Faten is a woman with a good reputation of being honest and a hard worker.

She is requesting a loan for the first time from A. Majmoua, in order to add Disney cosmetics that attract children while visiting her shop with their moms. Faten hopes to expand her business through adding new products, and wants to succeed in this new small step in order to make a wider step soon in the future. Most of her customers are friends and neighbors, and she dreams of opening a bigger shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy children's and infants' cosmetics.

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en:
Yvonne is 35 years old and is married with five children between the aged 3 and 16 years old. Yvonne is sewing different styles of clothes. This is her third successful years in this business. Her business is well-organized.

Yvonne has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy more clothes for sewing. with this profits, she will save for her future and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sewing.

loans.name: Zokir

texts.en:
Zokir is a very experienced taxi driver who supports his family by driving his taxi around the city of Dushanbe, Tajikistan. He has been providing transportation services for over 12 years and is still going strong. His monthly income is typically around $200-$300. Zokir would like to continue providing reliable transportation and has requested a loan of 7500 Somoni to have some work done on his car. We are happy for this opportunity to help Zokir as he works hard to make a living.  
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchas spare parts for his car

loans.name: Yunusjon

texts.en:
Yunusjon A. is 35 years old. He has a successful business selling flour at the local market in the Zafarabad region. Yunusjon sells an assortment of good quality flour of different sorts. Because he buys his goods at wholesale, the prices are cheaper than the prices of his competitors. Thus he even has many customers who  make a purchase of his products straight from his house. 

Now he has a great demand for his goods and that is why he would like an individual loan of $2000 USD to add to his working capital and allow him to purchase more inventory.  He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase flour to increase his stock

loans.name: C4819 Abizera Group

texts.en:
Syliver is 30 years old and single. He is the president of a group called “Abizera”.  Syliver sells eggs, and others in the group have businesses selling beans and sorghum, at the local market. Syliver employs one person in his business and has been working for three year's of experience.
Syliver is the first person on the left side .            Syliver and his group have requested a loan from kiva lenders in order  to buy a large quantity of eggs to sell.  with this profits, syliver and his team would like to use the profits to start saving and to satisfy the basic needs of his family.

loans.use: To purchase more eggs to sell.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is a 28 year-old single mother of twins. She shares two rooms with her children in Ntasen, a quarter in Bamenda, Northwest Region of Cameroon.

Stella has faced difficulties in her life, ranging from inability to meet her daily needs, increasing demands of her children, and the operation she had before their birth. Among other challenges, she also has had the difficulty of inadequate capital to expand her business. With this loan, she plans to buy more materials, buttons, thread and other materials for sewing dresses. She thinks her business will succeed because her business site is close to the road and she is friendly.  Thus she has many clients. Her activity will help her community by providing clothing close to home so that they won't have transportation costs and won't have to sew their own dresses.  Their cordial relationship will allow room for negotiations.

She will use a fraction of her profit to provide for the children’s school needs and meet her personal needs. She prefers a loan from GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives, the follow up and moral support given her by the GHAPE office, and the low interest rate and the installment method of paying back a loan.
ABOUT GHAPE
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to purchase materials, thread, and buttons

loans.name: Vali

texts.en:
Vali Azimovis 49 years old and lives in Istaravshan with his wife and his son. He has a small farm which he has managed to cultivate after much effort. Vali spends the majority of his time on his farm because he watches out for unusual happenings. His son supports him in their household. Vali plans on improving his family’s living conditions so that he can offer them a better future. Vali has been working in agriculture for 23 years. With this loan, he will purchase fertilizers to use on his crops so that he can sell more produce at a higher cost.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Zarif

texts.en:
I. Zarif is 58 years old. He is married with 3 children of school age. Zarif has been in the business of selling cows for almost 30 years. He buys them from villagers and from the nearby province, then fattens them for reselling to abattoirs and farmers. His wife has been a fruit seller for two years. Zarif is requesting a loan of 10,000 Somoni to purchase additional cows to raise for resale. This loan will allow him to better provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.ar: محمد في عمر 36 سنة يعمل في نقل وشراء الخردوات والبضائع من حديد وغيره متزوج وله 3 اولاد يحب عائلته وهي كل اهتمامه  ويسعى الى تأمين عيش جيد لهم وتعليمهم بأفضل المدارس. يهدف دائما إلى التطور وتحسين وضعه المادي والاجتماعي له في عمله سنتين. يتمنى ان  يتمكن من امتلاك محل كبير لبيع الخردة فهو طموح ومكب على العمل. تقدم محمد بطلب قرض من المجموعة لشراء كمية حديد جديدة وذلك لزيادة رأسماله في هذا المجال للمتاجرة فيهم بأسعار مغرية. يمتلك سمعة جيدة في عمله ومحيطه وله زبائن يحبونه ويقصدونه
texts.en: Mouhamad is 36 years old and married with three children. His work is purchasing and transporting hardware and iron goods. He loves his family and they are his sole priority. He aspires to secure a comfortable life for them, and give his children the best education possible. He is always seeking to develop and improve his financial and social situation. He has two years experience with his business, and hopes to develop it to the point that he can own a bigger store as he is ambitious and dedicated to his work. With this loan he wants to purchase new goods, and store goods to sell later on. His business has a good reputation and he has many loyal customers who love him.

loans.use: To increase his stock of iron

loans.name: Murodboy

texts.en:
J. Murodboy has been selling cattle for more than 12 years. This has helped him move on in his business. He is the father of 5 children who he  needs to both feed and provide with an education. One of his main needs is to purchase cattle in order to improve his business. For this reason Murodboy came to IMON International and requested a loan of 10,000 Somoni. Not only will his business will benefit from it, so will his family.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane A. is 51 years old. She is from the Sijeh area in Kisumu and is a widow. She has two children aged 20 and 26 years old.

Jane has a welding business and has employed people to help her run it. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her buy more steel to add to her stock. Jane will use the profits made for this business to cater for her family's needs and also pay her workers.

She hopes to see her business grow to great heights in the near future.

loans.use: to buy steel to add to her stock

loans.name: Abdukarim

texts.en:
S. Abdukarim was previously a security guard. Now, he is a farmer. He grows potatoes and watermelons to feed his family and to provide all his children with an education. Abdukarim has already been tilling the farm for 10 years. His business has helped him to buy the things they need like electricity, food, water, and to pay school fees. 

Abdukarim is asking for a loan of 10,000 Somoni. He will use the loan to purchase seed, fertilizer, and insecticide. The loan will really help him increase his yield.
