loans.use: to purchase seed, fertilizer, and insecticide

loans.name: Haiyotjon

texts.en:
Haiyotjon, 35, lives with his wife and 4 children. He has been a farmer since he was a young. He comes from a family of farmers, who taught him everything about this business. He mostly plants potatoes and onions. 

Throughout all these years of work, Haiyotjon was able to succeed in his business. In the future Haiyotjon is planning to have a bigger stable. He will extend the fields he cultivates. 

Now he has asked for a loan of 10,100 Somoni that he will spend for the purchase of seeds and fertilizer. He promises to work responsibly and sincerely thanks all lenders who have decided to support him.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Ali

texts.ar: علي في عمر 36 سنة متزوج وله3 اولاد يعمل في بلاط المنازل والمحلات له في عمله 20سنة يحب دائما التطور يريد له ولعائلته العيش الجيد والتطور يسعى من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء مواد أولية ضرورية لتطوير عمله، بالإضافة إلى تحسين وصيانة المنزل و السيارة فهو يريد ان يمكن عائلته من العيش بشكل جيد في منزل يخلو بعض الشيء من الاساسيات فهو يعيش في منزل متواضع بسيط وبحاجة ماسة الى تطويره حتى يصبح آمن لعيش اطفال فيه علي نشيط محب لعائلته ويحب عمله ايضا ويحلم بتعليم اولاده بشكل متميز وجيد
texts.en: Ali is 36 years old and married with three children. He works laying tile for houses and shops and has been doing this for 20 years. He wants to secure a comfortable life for himself and his family. With this loan he hopes to improve and renovate his home and car as he wants his family to live in a house without lacking basic necessities. At the moment he lives in a simple house which is in dire need of basic work in order to be suitable and safe for children. Ali loves his family as well as his business and he dreams of being able to provide his children with a good and distinguished education.

loans.use: To buy necessary raw materials.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy C. has been in the transport business with a Public Service Vehicle (PSV) for six years in the town of Eldoret. She is 41 years old, married to Jackson, and has four children aged 19, 15, 12, and 8 years old. Her spouse is also a businessman. Out of the transport business Nancy earns a profit of 18,500 Kenyan shillings (KES) per month.

She is applying for her fourth loan of 60,000 KES from KADET Ltd after successfully paying back the third loan. She plans to buy four tyres and to service her PSV to be in better condition. With the anticipated profits from the expanded business she plans to grow the business to the next level.  
 
Nancy hopes to own a bus with a capacity of 80 seats, which will enable her to provide for her family's basic needs, and also see to her children get  enlightened through education and become successful in life.

loans.use: to pay for four tyres and to service the vehicle

loans.name: Marufjon

texts.en:
A. Marufjon is a very loving father devoted to the needs of his children, whom he adores. He works raising livestock and every morning leaves home to take his animals to pasture in the surrounding area. 

His desire is to improve the quality of his animals, but in order to do this he would need to purchase livestock of better breeds. Those animals are very costly; he needs 5000 Somoni and at the moment he does not have that much money, so he is requesting this loan. Marufjon hopes that you trust in his hard work and honesty.

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. loans.use: to purchase cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Mbisbis

texts.en:
Mbisbis O. has been a farmer for the last three years. He is 34 years old married and supports four people.

He learned about KADET LTD from the marketing done by the KADET staff in his area of habitat. Being this is his second loan, he has planned to spend it all in farming. He intends to use the returns from the loan to re-invest in farming and to buy a bigger farm.

His dream is to be the best and well-known farmer in the area. He is an industrious man who can do well if funded.

loans.use: to spend towards farming.

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
Ruzanna M. was born in 1957 and lives with her family in Bargushat village, Kapan area. She has six children: four daughters and two sons; five of them are already married and live separately from their parents.

Ruzanna works in her village as a club manager. At the same time she and her husband, along with her elder son who lives with them, engage in farming. Ruzanna’s family raises cows, sheep and goats; they are mainly busy in dairy produce and meat production, which they distribute to Kapan city’s shops. 

This is Ruzanna’s second loan from Kiva and now she is asking for a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy a truck to deliver her products to Kapan city. This will allow her to decrease her travel expenses.

loans.use: To buy a truck to deliver her production to Kapan city.

loans.name: Patita  Ole

texts.en:
Patita O. O., 45-years old, is married. He is a father of two children. He has been a farmer for the past twelve years with a monthly income of KES6,500. 

Patita O. O. paid his previous loan well and in good time. He has applied for his fourth loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to buy farm supplies. With the profits generated, he plans to pay school fees for his children. He dreams to be prominent farmer. He is an assiduous man who works with effort to attain his set goals.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Tamemsu Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Tamemsu” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek for a loan of SLL 500,000.00 for each member to invest in their own businesses. 

Fatmata K. is the leader of this group. Fatmata is a 29-year-old, single woman with no children. Fatmata sells dried fish. She buys her fish from the villages of Tombo and Mama Beach near Freetown and sells in Kabala town. Fatmata will use her share of the loan to buy dried fish in large quantities to resell in Kabala town.

loans.use: To buy dried fish in large quantities, to resell in Kabala town.

loans.name: Kick Poor Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Kick Poor United” group from Kabala, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently to improve on their living conditions. 

Mariatu K. is the leader of this group. The 32-year-old is married to a tailor and they have 3 children. Mariatu has been a businesswoman for 10 years now. She sells gari (fast food made out of cassava roots), palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil) and soap. With her share of this loan, she will buy gari, palm-oil and soaps in bulk to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy gari, palm-oil and soaps in bulk to add to her business.

loans.name: Marek Ole

texts.en:
Marek Ole D., 40-year-old married father of three children aged nine, six, and two, has been a mixed farmer for the past eight years, earning a monthly income of KES 2000. 

This is his third loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase certified wheat seeds from kenya seed, fertilizers and land preparation. also to use part of the loan to buy a cow for fattening which he will sell later at a profit. 

With the profits generated he plans to re-invest and pay school fees for his children.  An assiduous man who works hard to attain more despite limited resources, Marek dreams of becoming a prominent farmer.

loans.use: to buy wheat seeds, fertilizers, and prepare the land for planting, and also to buy a cow

loans.name: Nizam

texts.ar: نظام في عمر 65 سنة متزوج يعمل في محل لبيع المواد الغذائية له في عمله 30 سنة له زبائن من محيطه وجيرانه يقصدونه فهو محبوب في عمله ويتميز بالنظافة والثقة في العمل دائم التطور ويريد ان يحسن من وضع محله وان يؤمن لنفسه العيش الجيد ومستقبل جيد من خلال توفير بعض المال حتى لا يكون بحاجة الى المال عند المرض يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة للمحل حتى يزيد من الكمية الموجودة لديه ليتمكن من زيادة المدخولالذي بدوره يؤمن له الإستمرارية والراحة
texts.en: Nizam is 65 years old and married. He works in a grocery store and has 30 years of experience of working in such stores. He has customers from his community and from among his neighbors, and this is due to the fact that he is well-liked in his line of work. He stands out in his field by virtue of his establishment's cleanliness and by virtue of his own trustworthiness. He is always trying to develop his business, and currently, he would like to improve the condition of his store. By doing this, he can procure a good life and future for himself, and he will have money to take care of himself if he becomes ill. With a loan from al-Majmoua, he plans to buy goods for his store and increase his store's inventory. By doing this, he should be able to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy goods for his grocery store in order to increase the store's inventory.

loans.name: United Stars Group

texts.en:
Meet members of the “United Stars” group from Kabala, a town in northern Sierra Leone. These local entrepreneurs have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL 1,600,000.00. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions.

Babar B.. the 50-year-old leader of this group, is married to a housewife and they have two children. Babar has been a businessman for six years now; he sells iron rods, cements, paints, and soft drinks. For his portion of the loan, Babar has requested SLL 1,000,000 in order to buy the above-mentioned items in large quantity to add to his business inventory.

loans.use: to buy iron rods, cement, paints, and soft drinks in large quantity to add to his business inventory

loans.name: Saado

texts.ar: سعدو عمره 36 سنة متزوج وله 3 اولاد يعمل في بيع الالبسة والأحذية له في عمله 5 سنوات يريد التطور لعائلته ولعمله يحب اولاده ويسعى الى تأمين العيش الكريم لهم وتأمين كافة مستلزماتهم وتعليمهم بشكل جيد يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة البسة واحذية موسمية للصيف له زبائن من محيطه وجيرانه وقد كان للقرض السابق الاثر الجيد على عمله وتحسين وضع عمله لا يحب ان يكون بحاجة الى احد والاعتماد على نفسه وان يعمل على تأمين مستقبله ومستقبل جيد لأولاده وتعليمهم
texts.en: Saado is 36 years old and married with three children. He works selling clothes and shoes, and he has five years of experience in this line of work. He wants to improve his family's life and his business. He loves his children and is trying to to secure a respectable life for them by ensuring that they have everything they need, including a good education. With a loan from A.-Majmoua, he would like to buy seasonA. clothing and shoes for his store so that his business will be ready for the summer. He has customers from his community and from among his neighbors, and his last loan had a positive effect on his business as it helped him improve the condition of his store. He likes to be self-sufficient and to rely on himself, and he would like to secure a good future and a good education for his children by securing a good future for himself.

loans.use: to buy seasonal shoes and clothes for his store so that his business will be ready for the summer.

loans.name: Bonface

texts.en: Bonface is 27 years old, married and father of one. For three years, he has been selling household goods such as cooking pots, basins, buckets, cups and plates.  He also sells clothes for extra income.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has witnessed a lot of growth in his business.  He hopes to open three outlets of his business in the future.  He has requested 20,000 Kes to buy more cooking pots, basins, buckets, cups and plates.

loans.use: To buy cooking pots, basins, buckets, cups and plates.

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en:
Harrison is 38 years old and married with three children.  He runs a boutique so as to earn a living.  It's five years since he started the business.  He has employed one person in his business.  He also does dairy farming so as to supplement his family’s income.  

Harrison hopes to succeed in his business in the future.  He has requested 20,000 Kes to buy a cow.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en: Evans is a member of Faulu Kenya.  He has a transport business and provides photocopy services.  He runs his business with three employees.  He has six years of experience in running his business.  Besides this, he does farming for extra income.  He hopes to move his business to the town centre in the future.  He has requested 20,000 Kes to buy a photocopy machine.

loans.use: To buy a photocopy machine.

loans.name: C4818 Zamuka Group

texts.en:
Charles is 28 years old and is married with one child who is two years old. He is the president of a group which is called "Zamuka" in the local language. The group is composed of six people: three men and three women. Charles is the first person on the left side. He sells rice, bread, beans, cooking oil and so on. This business is well-organized. He works from 6am until 9pm every day and he has three years of experience.

Charles and his team have requested a loan from Kiva lenders. Charles wants to purchase additional rice, bread, beans, and cooking oil to sell. With the resulting profit, Charles and his team will be able to save in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional rice, bread, beans, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Tayo Enole

texts.en:
Tayo Enole N., aged 33, is a married woman having four children who are schooling. She has been in the agriculture industry for the last seven years. She has good credit history with KADET. 


This will be her third loan with KADET. She plans to use the loan to purchase farm inputs. She hopes to generate an income from the loan which would be used to educate her children.


She hopes in future she will live a better life and hopes to see her children prosper.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en: Carmen came to Grameen America several years ago with the dream of starting her own business selling jewelry and other beauty supplies.  Born and raised in Ecuador, she had no prior experience running a business in the United States and, before joining our program, she could not find access to the start-up capital needed to make her dreams a reality.  Carmen is now on her fourth Grameen America loan, having used her first three to purchase beauty products that she sold to a growing list of customers out of her home.  With this latest loan, Carmen is ready to take a major professional step by moving her business to the local flea market.  She will use the proceeds from her Grameen America loan to stock up on inventory (jewelry and beauty products) and to pay the fees associated with operating a table at the market.  Carmen believes that selling her merchandise at the flea market will increase her profits dramatically and introduce her to many new customers, which in turn will bring her even closer to her ultimate goal of opening a storefront.  Carmen is dedicated to achieving her goal and creating a more comfortable life for her three children.

loans.use: To purchase inventory and rent a table at the flea market

loans.name: C4813 Abadahigwa Group

texts.en:
Immaculee is the president of a group called “Abadahigwa”, which has a total of seven members. Immaculee is the first person on the right in the photo. She owns a small business selling sugar, rice, bananas, sorghum, etc. She is 58 years old and is married with five children and three additional dependents who are relatives. Her business is open from 7am until 8pm every day. This is her fifth successful year in her business.

Immaculee will use this loan to purchase more products to sell such as salt, beans, soft drinks, bread, etc. With any profit, Immaculee would like to provide food for her family, pay school fees for her dependents, renovate her house, save money for the future and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell, such as salt, beans, soft drinks, bread, etc.

loans.name: C4816 Abadahemuka Group

texts.en:
Vedaste is 29 years old and married with one child who is one year old.  He owns a business selling foodstuffs such as sugar, rice, and salt. Vedaste is the leader of the group which is called "Abadahemuka" in the local language. This group contains five men:  Vedaste is the first person on the left.

Vedaste and his group have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand their businesses through purchasing more products. Vedaste wants to buy more sugar, bananas, rice and salt. Through this expansion, Vedaste will be able to earn more profit which will be used to pay school fees for his child, save for his future and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase more products such as sugar, bananas, rice and salt.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy handbags, schoolbags and bedsheets

loans.name: July

texts.es: La señora July es comerciante y tiene un puesto de venta ubicado en la zona 16 de julio de la ciudad de El Alto, donde vende todo tipo de productos y su esposo es chofer; el crédito lo requiere para la compra de peluches ya que la señora distribuye en mayor cantidad a otros comerciantes.  De esta manera, con estas actividades cubren los gastos de su familia. Vive en casa de sus suegros ubicada en la zona Ballivián en la ciudad de El Alto;  es casada y tiene dos hijos.
texts.en: July is a retailer: she owns a small stall, located in the 16 de julio neighborhood of the town of El Alto, where she sells every kind of products. Her husband is a driver. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy stuffed animals, a product she is a wholesaler for and which she distributes to other retailers. Thanks to these activities, she is able to pay for her household expense. She lives in the house of her parents-in-laws, located in the Ballivián neighborhood of the town of El Altro. She is married and she has two children.

loans.use: To buy stuffed animals to distribute them to other retailers as well as to sell them to her customers.

loans.name: Phillip

texts.en:
Philip O. is 24 years old and a single man. He lives in Kisumu county where he runs his business.

Philip has a shoe sales business and has been in it for a number of years. He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy more shoes to add to his stock. 

His profits will be used to expand his business. He hopes to own a big shoe shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.es:
La señora Pamela es comerciante ella tiene un puesto de venta en la zona 16 de Julio de la ciudad de El Alto, vende los días jueves y domingos; el crédito lo requiere para la  compra  de peluches y juguetes, así podrá tener mayor variedad de modelos y tamaños de los mismos para ofrecer a sus clientes. Con los ingresos que obtiene logra cubrir las necesidades de su familia. Vive en casa de sus suegros en la ciudad de El Alto y no tiene hijos.
Esta es la primera vez que Pamela solicita un crédito de IMPRO, pero el análisis socio-económico la califica como sujeto de crédito.
texts.en: Pamela is a trader. She has a stall in the zone of 16th of July in the city of El Alto. She sells on Thursdays and Sundays. She requires the loan to buy stuffed animals and toys so she may be able to have a greater variety of models and sizes to offer to her customers. With the income she obtains, she will be able to cover her family's necessities. She lives in a house with her in-laws in the city of El Alto and does not have children. This is the first time that Pamela is requesting a loan from IMPRO but the socio-economic analysis qualifies her to be a loan recipient.

loans.use: To purchase stuffed animals and toys to offer a greater variety to her customers.

loans.name: C4815 Twiyungura Group

texts.en:
Solange is 25 years old and is single with three dependent children who are relatives.  She is the president of a group which is called "Twiyungure" in the local language. The group is composed of five people: five women. Solange is the first person on the right side. She sells cloth for sewing. This business is well-organized. She works from 6am until 9pm every day and she has three years of experience. She employs one person in her business.  

Solange has requested a loan from Kiva lenders to purchase more cloth for sewing to sell. With the resulting profit, Solange and her team will be able to save in the future and to reinvest in their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase more cloth for sewing.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es: El señor Jaime es Criador Porcino (cria cerdos)  y su esposa de comerciante de carne de cerdo; el crédito lo requiere para adquirir mas cerdos, prepararlos para su venta y así aumentar sus ventas y por consiguiente sus ingresos familiares, con los  que  cubren los gastos de su familia. Vive en la casa de sus suegros ubicada en la zona de Rió Seco de la ciudad de El Alto. Es casado y no tiene hijos. Es la primera vez que  obtiene un crédito  con IMPRO.
texts.en: Jaime is a pigs breeder, and his wife is a pork meat retailer. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy more pigs: he will breed them and sell them in order to increase his sales and consequently his family earnings, with which they pay for the household expenses. He lives in the house of his parents-in-law, located in the Rió Seco neighborhood of the town of El Alto. He is married and has no children. This is the first time he has been granted a loan by IMPRO.

loans.use: To bjuy pigs to breed them and sell their meat.

loans.name: Nterere Ole

texts.en:
Nterere Ole N. is 23 years old and single. He has been farming in his place of abode for the past three years.

He was introduced to KADET by the KADET staff in his dwelling place. He has a good credit history with KADET LTD, and  he has applied for  a third loan, which he has planned to spend to prepare land for farming and purchase fertilizers. 


He intends to use the return from the loan to expand his business. His imaginings are to become a famous farmer in the area and to educate his future kids to a high level of education.

loans.use: to prepare land for farming and purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: C4811 Amizeroyacu Group

texts.en:
Isaie is the president of a group called “Amizeroyacu”, which has a total of five members - three men and two women. He is 21 years old and married, with a 1-year-old child. Isaie owns a small business selling items such as rice, sugar, tomato sauce, soap, cooking oil, etc. He has had three successful years in this business and employs one person to help him. He works from 7 a.m. until 9 p.m. every day.

Isaie and his group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders to purchase more bananas, rice, sugar, cooking oil and soap to sell. With any profits from the proceeds of this loan, Isaie and his group would like to provide food for their families, pay school fees for their children and save for the future.

loans.use: to purchase more products

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: La señora Margarita es comerciante de frutas y tiene un puesto de venta en la zona de la Ceja de el Alto; el crédito lo requiere para la compra de fruta de esta temporada como ser: Paltas, Maracuya, Pomelo, etc., para ofrecer a sus clientes. De esta manera ayuda con los gastos de su familia. Vive en casa propia la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Huayna Potosí (El Alto), es casada y tiene cinco  hijos. Esta es la segunda vez que solicita un préstamo de IMPRO y la primera vez que aplica para un préstamo a través de los financiadores de Kiva.
texts.en: Margarita is a fruit retailer, and she owns a stall in La Ceja, a neighborhood the town of El Alto. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy seasonal fruit such as avocados, passion fruits, grapefruits and so on, in order to sell it to her customers. Through this activity she helps paying for her household expenses. She owns the house she lives in, located in Huayna Potosí, a neighborhood of the town of El Alto; she is married and she has five children. This is the second time she is asking IMPRO for a loan, and the first time she is doing so through Kiva’s lenders.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruit (avocados, passion fruits, grapefruits and so on) to sell it to her customers.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 37 years old and married, with two children 3 and 13 years old. Joy has owned her business for six years. It is a large and clean shop where she sells items such as toilet paper, water, tomato sauce, body lotion, etc. Joy is a hard worker who employs one other person to help her. Her store is open from 8 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day.

Joy has requested a loan in order to purchase more tomato sauce, toilet paper and toothpaste to sell. She will reinvest the profits in her business and save for her future.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell

loans.name: Ruvuma Group

texts.en:
Joyce A. is in her early thirties. She is married with twin boys who attend school. She has two businesses, selling charcoal and fruits and vegetables. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Joyce's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase her fruits and vegetables and to start the charcoal business. She has successfully repaid the loan.  She hopes for a new loan to increase her charcoal business by buying more sacks of charcoal. Her dream is to one day enroll her twins in good schools and to build her own house.

Joyce will share this loan with her loan group "Ruvuma" which has a total of 19 members, who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Joyce is in front, second from left in a white blouse.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Barbara

texts.en:
Barbara is 36 years old and married, with two children, 13 and 11 years old. She sells a variety of men's clothing. Barbara has been in this business for five years and her shop is open from 8 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day.  Her business is well-organized.

Barbara has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more clothing to sell. With the profit from the proceeds of this loan, Barbara will be able to save for her future and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Jose tiene 31 años de edad es conviviente tiene una hija de 6 años, vive en casa de sus padres, cuenta con acumulación de bienes , Jose tiene la meta de adquirir otra unidad de transporte,cuenta con una mototaxi Bajaj, se dedica al servicio de transporte hace mas de 1 año lo cual le permite solventar sus gastos de su hogar cuenta con buenas referencias personales, Jose Invertira el dinero en comprar accesorios como llantas entre otros para  mejoramiento de su mototaxi.
texts.en:
Jose is 31 years old, he lives with his life partner and they have a 6-year-old daughter. They live in his parents’ house, and he has some savings. Jose wishes to buy a second vehicle, as he now owns a “moto taxi*” Bajaj. He has been offering transportation services for more than 1 year, and this allows him to pay for his household expenses. He has good professional references. Jose will invest the loan amount in the purchase of accessories such as tires to improve his moto taxi.

<cite>*A “moto taxi” is a motorcycle with a tricycle-like attachment.</cite>

loans.use: To buy accessories to improve his moto taxi.

loans.name: Evariste

texts.en: Evariste is 26 years old, single and has two adopted orphans. He has been a motorbike taxi driver for one year, transporting people all day from 7 a.m. until 10 p.m. Evariste currently has to rent a motorbike and would like to use this loan to purchase his own motorbike. Evariste will use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to help his family and build a house for them.

loans.use: to purchase his own motorbike.

loans.name: Henriette

texts.en:
Henriette is 29 years old and single. She owns a small business selling various styles of clothes from home. She employs one person from her community as a helper and her hours of business are from 7 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day. This is her tenth successful year of business.

Henriette has requested a first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by purchasing bales of clothes. This loan will allow her to attract more customers, which will help her earn more profit. Henriette plans to use the profit to reinvest in her business and to save money for her future.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is married with grown children. She is a clothing sales entrepreneur from Kahovka. Yelena sells women’s clothing inventory in small marketplaces of the Kahovka region. During the week, she travels to neighboring towns to sell her merchandise in the local markets. Yelena has been working in this sphere of business for 12 years. Her turnover capital amounts to 60,000 Grivnyas. Her income amounts to 12,000 Grivnyas a month.  

Yelena’s consistency, perseverance, work ethic and commitment to her business have ensured the growth and success of her venture. She always treats people with respect, which is one of the most effective methods of providing her business with a solid foundation. She also has a unique ability to reach and maintain the right customers. Moreover, Yelena is always willing to help her clients with some tips, which oftentimes is something much needed. Yelena is seeking a 20,000 Grivnya loan to purchase 50 shirts, 30 sweaters, 100 pairs of pants, 50 pairs of jeans and 40 jackets for further retail sale.

loans.use: to purchase 50 shirts, 30 sweaters, 100 pairs of pants, 50 pairs of jeans and 40 jackets

loans.name: Llapanchis Tticarisunchis Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LLAPANCHIS TTICARISUNCHIS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marina; ella es conviviente y tiene 45 años y 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de verduras, ella vende tomates, zanahorias, pepinos, cebollas entre otras verduras, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m en el mercado de Huancaro, ella trae de lugares como Quillabamba las verduras como limones y pepinos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de verduras. La socia solicita el préstamo para verduras al por mayor.


Los otros socios  se dedican la venta de ropa, venta de estructuras metálicas, tienda de abarrotes, técnico en farmacia y servicio de llamadas. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Introducing the members of the “LLAPANCHIS TTICARISUNCHIS” Communal Bank, which is located in the department, province and district of Cusco.

Marina lives with her life partner, she is 45 years old and has 3 children. She runs a vegetable shop, where she sells tomatoes, carrots, cucumbers, onions and other vegetables. She works in the Huancaro market for 6 am to 5 pm. She buys vegetables such as lemons and cucumbers in towns like Quillabamba. She wishes to improve her vegetables sale activity, and she is requesting a loan to buy vegetables at a wholesale price.

The other members’ activities are: clothes sale, metallic structures sale, grocery store, pharmaceuticals technician and telephone services.

Marina is thankful to those who will help her achieve her dreams through this loan, and she commits to complying with the repayments of her dues at the set deadlines.

loans.use: To buy vegetables at a wholese sale price.

loans.name: Santos Genaro

texts.es: El señor Santos Genaro tiene 28 años es soltero no tiene hijos vive en casa de unos familiares ,trabajaba en una empresa iqueña de espárragos, el era obrero de campo y el dinero que ganaba lo ahorraba hasta que logro comprarse una moto taxi el cual ahora es su herramienta de trabajo, también es aficionado a la música toca el arpa en una orquesta el precisa seguir trabajando en su moto taxi y una de sus metas es estudiar una carrera técnica que le permita generar otro tipo de ingresos, también desea adquirir una vivienda para luego formar una familia. El señor Santos esta muy agradecido por la confianza que le están brindando.
texts.en: Santos Genaro is 28 years old, he is single and has no children. He lives in the house of a relative and he used to work for an asparagus factory in Ica. He used to be a farm laborer, and he saved the money he earned until he was able to buy a moto taxi which is now his working tool. He also likes music and plays the harp in an orchestra. He needs to keep on working with his moto taxi, and one of his desires is to get a technical career education that will allow him earning het another income. He also wishes to buy a house and to have a family one day. Santos is really thankful for the trust you will put in him.

loans.use: To pay for the maintenance of his moto taxi.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 37 years old and is married with four children between the ages 1 and 7 years old. Florence earns a living by sewing different styles of clothes. This is her third successful year in this business. Her business is well-organized. She operates her business from 8 a.m. until 5 p.m. every day and she employs one person to help her.

Florence needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to buy more cloth for sewing. By expanding her business and adding more equipment and workers, Florence hopes to earn more profits, and she will save for her future.

loans.use: to buy more cloth for sewing

loans.name: Igor

texts.en:
Igor is single. He is the owner of a small farming business in Novomoskovsk. Igor sells vegetable seeds in the central marketplace of his hometown. He changes his merchandise according to the seasonal market. Igor has several vending stalls at different locations of the market. He has been running this business for over 10 years. Currently, his income amounts to 8,000 Grivnyas a month.  

Igor is planning to use the loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to purchase a variety of seeds, fertilizers and farming chemicals to meet seasonal demand. He has inherited this business from his parents, who started it a long time ago. Presently, Igor is supporting his elderly parents, making money and meeting the needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional types of seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Diane

texts.en:
Diane is 29 years old and is married with two children aged 2 and 6 years old. Diane sells various merchandise in her business such as cooking oil, body lotion, breads and so on. Diane has had her business for one year. Her business is open from 8 a.m. until 7 p.m. every day. This business is well-organized. 

Diane has requested a loan from Kiva via Vision Finance company in order to expand her business by purchasing more foodstuffs like sugar, rice, cooking oil and so on. With this profit, she will be able to build her own house and save money for her future.

loans.use: to purchase more products like sugar, rice and cooking oil

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei is married with a 4-year-old daughter, Darya. Sergei offers transportation services in his hometown of Berdichev. He owns two Daewoo Lanos vehicles and a VAZ 2107. His vehicles are always in good condition, looking neat and clean. Sergei is punctual, accurate and polite, which has helped him gain a loyal clientele. Currently, his net profit amounts to 4,400 Grivnyas a month. 

Sergei is requesting a loan of 12,000 Grivnyas to do major repairs on his car, the VAZ 2107. Sergei is planning to repair the running gear, engine and steering gear. His business is the main source of income for the family. Sergei has always loved automobiles and technology. He believes this sphere of business is his niche. One of Sergei’s further plans is to purchase one more vehicle and expand his service range in the future.

loans.use: to repair his automobile

loans.name: Pamba Group

texts.en:
Romana J. is in her early 30's and is married with 3 children. She has two businesses, a pool table (hall) and a cow for milk. She has had these businesses for 2 years. She works from 10:00am to 10:00pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Romana's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to go and collect her cow outside Dar es Salam. She also made some repairs on her pool table and has paid back her loans successfully. She hopes for a loan to make some repairs on her house. Her dream is to one day buy more cows and sell a lot of milk.

Romana will share this loan with her loan group "Pamba", which has a total of 17 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Romana is in the second row, second from left in an orange dress.

loans.use: to make repairs to her house

loans.name: Reyna Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “REYNA DEL CARMEN”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sonia; ella es casada y tiene 29 años y 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio D. venta D. gaseosas y cervezas y también venD. cds D. información, ella tiene una pequeña tienda donD. venD. estos cds, la socia trabaja desD. las 9:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m en el negocio D. depósito D. cerveza, la socia quiere mejorar los negocios D. venta D. cerveza y gaseosa y venta D. cds. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cerveza y gaseosa y también cds nuevos.

Los otros socios  se dedican la venta D. zapatos, venta D. artesanía, tienda D. abarrotes, venta D. pollos y servicio D. taxi.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Reyna Del Carmen community bank. This bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province and department of Cusco.

The member is Sonia. She is married and is 29 years old and has two children. The member works in her business selling soda and beer and also informational CDs. She has a small store where she sells these CDs. She works from 9AM until 5PM in the beverage business. She wants to improve the business selling beer and soda and CDs. She is requesting a loan to buy beer, soda and also new CDs.

The other members are dedicated to selling shoes, crafts, a grocery store, selling chicken and a taxi service.

The member is thankful to those who form part of this dream through this medium and she promises to make her payments at the established deadlines.

loans.use: To buy beer and soda and also new CDs.

loans.name: Madame

texts.es: Madame tiene 21 años, vive con sus hijos pequeños en casa de sus padres. El trabajo que realiza es la elaboración de prendas tejidas a base de crochet o palillos, desde entonces durante todo el día se dedica a tejer a mano, ella muy tranquila lo realiza en su casa. En este medio año de experiencia ha demostrado talento para tejer, y se ven reflejada en las bellas prendas que elabora, eso le da mucha ventaja ya que sus clientes solicitan de dichas prendas  y el precio varia de acuerdo al esfuerzo que le dedico cada tejido, así como de los diseños y colores con que están hechos. Se siente muy satisfecha con la actividad que realiza, por ello desea tener un taller de tejidos ya sea de manera artesanal o industrial, y para conseguirlo seguirá trabajando en este rubro con la misma dedicación que siempre pone en su labor. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de pertenecer su pequeño banco comunal que sabe que le servirá bastante para el desarrollo de su negocio, se animó a formar parte de su grupo por recomendación de sus familiares que tiene una experiencia de crédito grupal y agradece a las personas que serán gestoras de su crédito. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de lana al por mayor.
texts.en:
Madame is 21 years old and lives with her young children in her parents' home.  Her business is crocheting and knitting clothes.  She spends all day knitting by hand and is very relaxed carrying out her work at home.  In the six months she has been in this line of work she has shown a talent for knitting which is reflected in the beautiful clothes that she makes.  This is of benefit to her as customers request her clothes and the price varies in accordance with the effort that she puts into each item as well as the designs and colors of the items.

Madame feels very satisfied with the work that she does and would like to own a knitting workshop where she can either hand knit or machine knit.  In order to achieve this, she will continue working with the same commitment that she always puts into her work.

This is Madame's first loan from MFP and she is very happy to belong to her small community bank because she knows that it will be useful to her in making progress in her business.  She joined her group on the recommendation of some family members who have experience with group loans.  She is grateful to the people who will help to fund her loan.  She will use the loan that she is requesting to buy yarn wholesale.

loans.use: to buy yarn wholesale

loans.name: Maria Eduarda

texts.es:
La señora Maria Eduarda tiene 52 años, su actividad crianza de cerdos.
Tiene más de 10 años en su negocio,  inicio este medio de vida por la facilidad que vive en una finca, pues siempre su familia ha trabajado con este tipo de negocio ya que vio que es un trabajo bueno donde se obtiene buenas ganancias de las que se puede apoyar y a la misma vez estar pendiente de su familia, que es la que le da ánimo de luchar por la vida. Comenta que lo que más desea es lograr tener ahorros para agrandar su negocio. Este crédito es para la compra de cerdos y al mismo tiempo poder comprarle comida y alimentar bien a sus cerdos.
texts.en: Maria Eduarda is 52 years old and her business is raising pigs.  She has been in this business for more than 10 years.  She started out in this line of work because she lives on a farm and her family has always worked in this type of business.  She saw that it is good work that makes good profits which she could use to support herself and help her family.  It is her family that provides her with the encouragement she needs to keep fighting.  Maria  tells us that what she would most like is to have enough savings to expand her business.  This loan will be used to buy pigs and also animal feed with which she can feed them well.

loans.use: to buy pigs and pig feed

loans.name: Gloria Roxana

texts.es:
La señora Gloria Roxana es socia del banco comunal Nuevas Amigas del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 45 años de edad. Su esposo es trabajador independiente y tiene 4 hijos.
Lleva 3 años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos. Gloria se dedica a la venta de alimentos, golosinas diversas y snacks en una escuela conocida de la cuidad, ha alquilado un kiosko para poder ofrecer sus productos, aprovechando la época escolar trabajará de lunes a viernes todo el día.  Debido a la gran demanda tiene dos personas que le ayudan.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 2,500.00 nuevos soles comprará: 2 cajas de galletas, 3 bolsas de caramelos, 5 tiras de chupetines, 2 cajitas de chocolate, 1 bolsa de chiche, 1 caja de fruna,2 bolsas de tofe, 3 tiras de chizitos, 3 tiras de chis tris, 3 tiras de papitas ley, 2 paquetes de gaseosas, 2 paquetes de agua. 1 caja de néctar,platos descartables, cucharas descartables,servilletas.
Este es un nuevo reto que se puso en su vida, quiere seguir trabajando para ayudar a su esposo y prepararse para su vejez, con Manuela Ramos tiene oportunidades para poder crecer más en su negocio y por eso está muy agradecida.
texts.en:
Gloria Roxana is a member of the "Nuevas Amigas" ["New Friends"] communal bank, of the District of Calleria, Department of Ucayali. She is 45 years old. Her husband is an independent worker, and she has 4 children. 

She has worked with loans from Manuela Ramos for 3 years. Gloria's business is selling food and various sweets and snacks at a well-known school in the city. She has rented a kiosk so that she can sell her products; during the school year she works from Monday to Friday, all day. Due to the great demand, she has two people who help her. 

With her new loan of 2,500 Peruvian new soles, she will buy: 2 cases of cookies, 3 bags of candies, 5 strips of lollipops, 2 wholesale boxes of chocolate, 1 bag of chick pea snacks, 1 case of Fruna [fruit candies], 2 bags of toffee, 3 units of Chizitos cheese puffs, 3 units of Cheese Tris cheese puffs, 3 units of Lays potato chips, 2 cases of soft drinks, 2 cases of water, 1 case of juice, and disposable plates, spoons and napkins. 

This is a new challenge she has set for herself in life; she wants to keep working so she can help her husband and prepare for her old age. With Manuela Ramos, she has opportunities so that she can grow more with her business, and she is very grateful for this.

loans.use: to buy various snacks, disposable serving items, etc.

loans.name: Fuh

texts.en:
Fuh I., age 44, plans to buy medicinal plants. He knows this business will succeed because he is located at a good business site, the city of Bamenda. He plans to use the profits generated to sponsor his children in school and to cater to the basic needs of his family. 

He and his wife, Ndum Mispa, have six children. His wife joined GHAPE in 2010 because she found that she could not take care of the family singlehandedly (a situation exacerbated by problems with her in-laws) and the children lacked basic care. These problems are saddening to Fuh I., but he is grateful to be alive and is driven to give his children the love and education they need. He states that "he feels better each time he provides something small to his children." 

He needs investment capital that can constantly generate income for him to meet his children’s needs, and his inability to obtain such capital is what motivated him to obtain a loan from GHAPE.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerrment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to purchase medicinal plants in order to start a new business

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 57 años, vive con el menor de sus 7 hijos, tiene 19 años y juntos viven en su casa que es propia. Desde hace 21 años ella se dedica a las tareas agrícolas y a la venta de animales menores como cuyes y pollos, con lo que ha logrado capitalizar ha comprado reses, en especial vacas, a las aprovecha para vender la leche que extrae diariamente. Es así que su trabajo consiste en vender animales a las distintas ferias comerciales de los pueblos aledaños a su localidad; y los fines de semana se dirigen a las ferias ganaderas. Por ello procura siempre abastecerse de animales y comprarlos de los ganaderos que hay en su localidad, su hijo es quien más lo ayuda en este trabajo. Ella considera que esta actividad es importante por que le ha generado bueno dividendo y con eso ha logrado cubrir los gastos educativos de sus hijos y los gastos de su hogar. Sin embargo hay momentos en que no hay mucha venta de animales, pero su gran habilidad para vender le ha ayudado a sobrevivir.  Su deseo es aumentar su capital de trabajo. es su crédito número 12 con MFP, se siente muy contenta de ser parte de su banco comunal ya que en todo este tiempo ha tenido buenas experiencias y ejemplos de solidaridad de la cual esta muy agradecida. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de materiales de construcción para mejorar el techo de su granja de gallinas.
texts.en:
María is 57 years old and lives in her own home with the youngest of her seven children.  He is 19 years old.  Since she was 21 she has worked in agriculture and has been selling small livestock, such as Guinea pigs and chickens.  She has gotten some cattle with some of the earnings and sells the milk daily.  Her work involves selling animals at various commercial fairs in the surrounding towns.  On the weekends she goes to the livestock fairs.  It's here where she gets her animals.  Her son helps her mostly and she considers this activity to be important because it brings in a good income and it has allowed her to cover her children's educational expenses and the household expenses.

Never the less, there are moments when she does not make good sales, but her great ability to sell has helped her survive.  She wants to increase her working capital.  This will be her 12th loan through MFP and she feels very happy to be part of a communal bank and has had good experience all this time which she appreciates.  She will use the money from this loan to buy building materials to repair the roof on her chicken coop.

loans.use: to repair the roof on her chicken coop

loans.name: Thanyaroh Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Thanyaroh” group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Kabala, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is John B. S.. John is 25. He was born in northern Sierra Leone. John has 3 children. He sells mobile phones and mobile phone accessories, CDs, etc.. He has been running this business for 5 years now. With the help of this loan, he will expand his business by buying more mobile phones, mobile phone accessories, CDs, etc. to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy more mobile phones, mobile phone accessories, and CDs to add to his business

loans.name: Sara

texts.es: Sara tiene 41 años, vive en compañía de sus 4 hijos en su casa que es propia. Desde hace medio años decidió emprender un negocio, y dese ahí vende gaseosas y comida rápida, en un pequeño local que arrendó, asimismo habilitó un espacio para vender productos básicos como arroz, azúcar, fideos y menestras, es así que  todo el día esta en su lugar de ventas para generarse los ingresos diarios que le permiten sostener a su familia. Con el tiempo ha logrado conseguir una estabilidad económica, por ello espera en adelante tener un negocio más amplio, y que este abastecido de productos de primera necesidad, para que tenga más dinamismo en la ventas y generarse más ganancias.  Es su crédito número 2  que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de tener un crédito que beneficiará  el crecimiento de su negocio y de compartir un ciclo mas de experiencia en crédito grupal junto a otra persona que considera es de su confianza. Con el crédito que solicita, lo  invertirá en la compra de productos para implementar su tienda.
texts.en: Sara is 41 years old and lives with her four children in their own home.  She decided to start her own business six months ago, selling fast food and soft drinks from a small rented stall.  She has also set aside a small area to sell basic products, such as rice, sugar, noodles, and vegetable stew.  She is there all day in order to generate a daily income so she can support her family.  She has managed to create financial stability and hopes to have a larger business in the future, and stock it with basic needs products so that she can increase her sales.  This will be her second loan through MFP and she is very happy to have financial backing to support her business’ growth and to enter another loan cycle with another person whom she trusts.  She will use the money from this loan to buy products to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy products to stock her store

loans.name: New Site I Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “New Site I” group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Kabala, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This is not the first loan these entrepreneurs have accessed from SMT/Kiva lenders. However, with the help of this new loan, they will be able to further expand their businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Yenku S., a double amputee. Yenku S. is age 38. He was born in a place called Kondabaya, near Kabala town. Yenku is married to a businesswoman and they have 4 children. For 10 years now, Yenku has been selling ready-to-wear-clothes, toothpaste, soaps, chains, slippers, shoes, etc.. With his share of this loan, Yenku is going to further expand his business by buying the above-mentioned items in large quantity to stock to his business. 

You can read more about Yenku S.’s story on a blog posted by a Kiva Fellow in 2008 through this link: http://www.huffingtonpost.com/nicholas-sabin/from-machete-to-microfina_b_124727.html

loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear-clothes, toothpaste, soaps, chains, slippers, shoes, etc. in large quantities to stock his business

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is Fatmata S., age 43. Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you this small-scale entrepreneur who has come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 2,500,000.00 in order to invest more fully in her business. 

Fatmata S. sells foodstuffs like rice, groundnuts, and palm oil. She has been engaged in this business for many years now in the township of Kabala, located in northern Sierra Leone. She and her husband have one child, whis is enrolled in secondary school. Fatmata was born in Makeni city but now lives and works in Kabala town. 

Fatmata has requested this loan in order to buy 15 bags of rice, 20 bags of groundnuts, and 100 gallons of palm oil to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy 15 bags of rice, 20 bags of groundnuts, and 100 gallons of palm oil to add to her business

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es: Amelia tiene 60 años, vive con su  esposo y su hijo cuya edad es D. 16 años, en su casa que es  propia. Casi toda su vida ha estado dedicada a las tareas agrícolas y ganaderas, pero con el paso D. los años ya su estado físico no le permite tener el mismo dinamismo, por ello ha optado vender productos D. primera necesidad, en un mercado que se encuentra ubicada dentro D. su zona. Es así que todos los días, trabaja en esta actividad, ofreciendo diversos productos que tiene mayor demanda D. consumo a sus clientes asimismo venD. papa recién cosechada y otros productos como el maíz, trigo, quinua, habas que cultiva con frecuencia. Pues su labor D. campo no lo ha dejado, ya que permanece más tiempo en su negocio, por ello contrata peones para que siembren y cosechen los productos que tiene. Por ahora su mayor prioridad es la D. implementar su tienda con diversos productos. Es su crédito número 10 con MFP, esta muy contenta D. ser parte integrante D. su banco comunal, pues con el  tiempo ha logrado aprender el significado del ahorro. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra D. más mercadería y aumentar su capital D. trabajo.
texts.en:
Amelia is 60 years old and lives with her husband and 16 year old son in her own home.  She's been involved in agricultural and livestock work almost her whole life, but over time her physical state has affected her abilities, so she decided to sell basic needs products in the market within her zone.  She works daily selling the products that are in high demand from her customers.  She also sells freshly harvested potatoes and other products like corn, wheat, quinoa, and peas which she harvests often.  She has not given up her fields, but she has hired field hands to do the work now that she spends more time in her other business.  At the moment her store is her priority.

This will be her 10th loan through MFP and she is glad to be part of her communal bank because she has learned the significance of saving.  She will use the money from this loan to invest in more merchandise and increase her working capital.

loans.use: to stock her store

loans.name: Saidu

texts.en:
This is Saidu C., age 45. Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you this small-scale entrepreneur, who has come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 3,000,000.00 in order to invest in his businesses. 

Saidu C. sells used clothes such as shirts, trousers, and skirts. He has been engaged in his business for the past 24 years in the township of Kabala, located in northern Sierra Leone. He and his wife have two children. He was born in Kambia town but now lives and works in Kabala. 

Saidu has requested this loan in order to buy bales of used clothes to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothes to add to his business

loans.name: Maria Gloria

texts.es:
Maria tiene 47 años de edad. Es madre soltera con 2 hijos. Vive en casa propia, que está ubicada en el caserío Peñarol en el distrito de Tambogrande, un distrito agrícola que se encuentra situado en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. Maria vive en la parte rural de este distrito y no cuentan con los servicios básicos como agua o luz.

Se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral como pavos y gallinas contando con 10 pavos y 18 gallinas. Ella los engorda para luego comercializarlos en el mercado local. Lleva más de 3 años realizando esta actividad en la parte posterior de su casa. Desea comprar alimentos balanceado para el engorde de sus pavos y gallinas para que logren un tamaño y peso ideal. De esta manera, ella podrá venderlos a un mejor precio y seguir creciendo en su negocio. Por ello, María ha solicitado su primer préstamo de 500 nuevos soles del Kiva Field Partner, Edpyme Alternativa. Maria es una mujer bastante trabajadora y de muy buen carácter, las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño. Su mayor anhelo es aumentar sus ingresos para poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria is 47 years old. She is a single mother with 2 children. She lives in her own house, which is located in the settlement of Peñarol in the district of Tambogrande, an agricultural district located in the Piura region, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. Maria lives in the rural part of this district and does not have basic services such as water and electricity connections. 

Her work is raising domestic birds such as turkeys and hens. She currently has 10 turkeys and 18 hens. She fattens them up and later sells them in the local market. She has done this work for more than 3 years in the area behind her home. She would like to buy balanced feed to fatten her turkeys and hens, so that they can reach an ideal size and weight. Thus, she will be able to sell them for a better price and continue to expand her business. For this reason, María has applied for her first loan, for 500 Peruvian new soles, from the Kiva field partner Edpyme Alternativa. Maria is a very hard-working woman, with an excellent character; people who know her have much esteem and affection for her. Her greatest desire is to increase her income so that she can provide a better quality of life to her children.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her domestic birds

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 29 años, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo pequeño que tiene apenas 5 años de edad,  juntos viven en casa de un familiar. Hace más de 3 años que sola se genera sus propios ingresos, por medio de la venta de productos de primera necesidad, dulces y demás artículos para el hogar. Este negocio lo realiza en el mercado zonal de su barrio, por otro lado, ella tiene una profesión que es técnica de mecánica dental, en donde realiza prótesis dentales. Sin embargo el comercio le genera ganancias diarias, por lo que le resulta rentable, es la manera más segura de cubrir sus necesidades y la de su hijo. Por ahora ella continuará en esta actividad, con planes de extender sus terrenos de cultivo para aumentar su productividad y asegurar sus ganancias. Es su crédito número 5 con MFP, le agrada trabajar en su banco comunal porque conoce a personas que considera que son de su confianza y además de aprender el valor del ahorro para seguir progresando. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería en abarrotes, asimismo desea comprar materiales para seguir elaborando prótesis dentales.
texts.en: Rosa is 29-years-old. She's a single mother of a 5-year-old son. They live together in a relative's house. For over three year's she's earned her own income by selling necessary products, sweets, and household items. She runs her business from the neighborhood market. She also works as a dental hygienist, making dental prosthesis. Her business generates daily income and is profitable. It's the most secure way to afford her son's necessities. For now she will continue this activity with plans to extend her territory in order to increase productivity and ensure income. This is her 5th loan with MFP. She's happy to work with her communal bank because she knows that they're trustworthy people and she's learning to value of saving in order to keep progressing. She'll invest this loan in the purchase of more grocery merchandise. She also wants to buy materials to keep making dental prosthesis.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store and materials to make dental prosthesis

loans.name: Luna Turquesa Group

texts.es:
Luna Turquesa

Es un grupo solidario de Credituyo que se encuentra en su primer ciclo y está formado por 8 mujeres, escogieron ese nombre de grupo porque “luna” es el significado del nombre de la presidenta del grupo y turquesa es un color de gusto común entre ellas.

Margarita es una de las integrantes del grupo, ella tiene 3 hijos de 7, 5 y 1 año 2 meses. Margarita es dueña de un negocio en su hogar de productos nutricionales el cual inició hace 2 años y 3 meses. Con su negocio ayuda a cubrir parte de los gastos del hogar  para sacar adelante a sus niños. El motivo del préstamo es para poder tener más variedad en su negocio e incrementar sus ventas. El sueño de Margarita es poder rentar un local establecido para ofrecer sus productos, con lo que espera ayudar a su marido para que no se preocupe tanto por la falta de dinero y así sacar adelante  a su familia.
texts.en: Luna Turquesa is a lending association of Credituyo formed by 8 women.  They chose the name, which means "turquoise moon,"  as it has special meaning for them.  Margarita is a member who has 3 children, aged 7, 5 and 1 year, two months. Margarita runs a business out of her home selling nutritional products, which she started over two years ago. Her business allows her to cover some of the basic expenses of the household to benefit her children. With this loan she plans to buy inventory to increase product variety and sales for her business. Margarita dreams of opening her own shop one day, in order to help her husband and assure her family a secure future.

loans.use: to buy inventory to increase sales

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Juan Carlos se dedica a la elaboración de salteñas  y venta de comida.  El crédito lo necesita para adquirir más insumos, como fideo, arroz, verduras y condimentos para elaborar  mayor cantidad de platos a la carta. 

Vende las salteñas y la comida en un ambiente que se encuentra en alquiler. Vive  en el domicilio de sus padres  ubicada en la zona Norte de la ciudad de La Paz. Es soltero y  no tiene hijos. Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO.
texts.en: Juan Carlos prepares and sells food and popular dishes.  He seeks this loan to buy ingredients (such as rice, pasta and vegetables) to prepare and increase the number of menu options in his restaurant, which is located in a rented space.  Juan Carlos lives with his parents in the northern area of La Paz. He is single, has no children, and this is his first loan with IMPRO.

loans.use: To buy ingredients (rice, pasta, vegetables) to prepare food

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: Félix tiene 19 años, vive con sus padres y sus hermanos en casa que es de su propiedad. El trabajo al que se dedica es la venta de animales, actividad que lo realiza desde hace 4 año, y en todo estos años su labor consistía en comprar los animales, en su mayoría vacas y toros, en estado delgados y jóvenes, luego los alimenta hasta que llega un tiempo y peso determinados para luego venderlos a un mayor precio en las ferias ganaderas de sus comunidad. Por otro lado también siembra en los terrenos de sus padres, así asegura un ingreso extra. Durante este tiempo de trabajo vio que le era muy rentable, además le agrada ser independiente y poder retribuir a sus padres económicamente. En adelante desea incrementar su capital de trabajo y poder comprarse un carro. Es su primer crédito con MFP, considera que su banco comunal desarrollará un buen trabajo en este ciclo de cuotas que viene a futuro para devolver su crédito, además se compromete a ser responsable en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita,  lo invertirá en la compra de toros para venderlos a un mayor precio.
texts.en: Félix is 19 and lives with his parents and siblings in their family home. He works raising and selling farm animals, which he has done for the past 4 years.  He buys the animals, mostly cattle and bulls, when they are young, and feeds them until they are of marketable weight and can be sold at local livestock fairs. He also tends crops on his parents' land in order to supplement his income. He has profited from these activities, and is pleased to contribute to his family's finances. In the future, he hopes to build his working capital and purchase a vehicle. This is his first credit with MFP, and he is committed to prompt repayment. This loan will be used to buy and raise bulls for resale.

loans.use: to buy bulls

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: El señor Pedro trabaja como chofer en el sindicato Eduardo Avaroa y además es socio propietario. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de un motor nuevo. Lo ayudara a realizar con mayor seguridad para el y los pasajeros. Vive en casa propia. Es viudo y tiene dos hijos. El cliente esta muy satisfecho con los créditos que se le otorgaron y le ayudó a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Pedro works as a driver in the Eduardo Avaroa syndicate and he is also a partner in the syndicate.  He needs this loan to buy a new motor.  This will allow him to have a safer vehicle for his passengers.  He lives in his own home, and is a widower with 2 children.  Pedro is very pleased with the loans that he has obtained, which have helped him to improve the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to provide maintenance for his vehicle

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es: Fredy tiene 30 años, vive  con su esposa y sus 2 hijos en su casa, que lo heredó por parte de sus padres. El trabajo al que se dedica es la compra  y venta de animales, entre ellos los vacunos y ovinos, actividad que ha estado practicando durante 5 años, y en este tiempo, su trabajo consistía en comprar los animales tiernos y a bajo costo, para luego engordarlos y cuando llegue el tiempo indicado son vendidos en la feria ganadera de su zona. Asimismo su esposa la ayuda en este negocio, y más durante los meses de agosto y septiembre, en el que hay más demanda de estos animales. Ahora su prioridad es aumentar su capital de trabajo, por ello va a requerir el préstamo para poder comprar más animales. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy entusiasmado de su primera oportunidad de crédito grupal en su banco comunal ya que tiene buenas referencias de esta forma de trabajo. Con crédito que solicita, comprará animales como toros principalmente ya que tiene más demanda en el mercado ganadero.
texts.en: Fredy is 30 years old and lives with his wife and their 2 children in a home that he inherited from his parents.  He has had a business buying and selling livestock, including cows and sheep, for 5 years.  Over this time, he has been buying young animals at a low cost to later fatten.  When the time arrives, he can sell them in the livestock market in his area.  His wife also helps him with this business, especially during the months of August and September when there is a lot of demand for these animals.  Now his priority is to increase his working capital, and to do this he is requesting a loan so that he can purchase more animals.  This is the first loan that he has taken from MFP, and he is very enthusiastic about his first opportunity to participate in a group loan with his communal bank, since he has good references for his work.  With the loan he requests he will buy animals, mainly bulls, since there is a lot of demand for these in the livestock market.

loans.use: to buy bulls

loans.name: Pyapy Mbarete Group

texts.es:
El comité Pyapy Mbarete nace mediante la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando la misma región.
Este comité es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo, fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas, en total son 14 mujeres.
La Sra. Anatolia M., presidenta del grupo tiene 55 años, ella esta domiciliada en la ciudad de Capiatá, una ciudad cercana a San Lorenzo, es una mujer emprendedora e innovadora. Se la caracteriza por su buena predisposición y activación dentro del comité.
Ella es una señora muy humilde pero luchadora, cada día se esfuerza por obtener ingresos que puedan mantener a su familia, se dedica a realizar bordados artesanales, únicos en diseños y texturas.
Su clientela es numerosa pero desea poder aumentarla para así generar mayores ingresos que la ayuden a pasar una vejez tranquila y sin preocupaciones el día de mañana.
Solicita el préstamo para comprar telas, hilos, bastidores y agujas, espera contar con el apoyo de los inversionistas de Kiva y Fundación Paraguaya.
Todas las miembros de este comité son luchadoras y merecen ser ayudadas por su dedicación y deseo de superar la pobreza en la que viven.
texts.en:
The Pyapy Mbarete committee developed from the effort and help of another committee that worked in the same region.  The present committee is from the City of San Lorenzo, and its principal object is the growth of each of its 14 women.

Anatolia, the group's president, is 55 years old and lives in the City of Capiata, near San Lorenzo. She is an enterprising and innovative woman, with a good predisposition and is very active within the committee.

Anatolia is a very humble but determined person. Each day she attempts to obtain income to maintain her family.  She does artisan embroidery that is unique in design and texture.  Anatolia's customers are numerous but she wants to increase the number to expand her income and give her a tranquil old age without future preoccupations.

Anatolia is requesting a loan to buy cloth, thread, stretchers, and needles. She hopes she can count on the help of investors from Kiva and the Fundacion Paraguaya.

All the committee members are striving and deserving of help for their dedication and desire to overcome the poverty in which they live.

loans.use: TO BUY CLOTH, THREAD, STRETCHERS, AND NEEDLES FOR EMBROIDERY

loans.name: Jhony

texts.es: Jhony tiene 21 años, vive con su esposa, ella se encuentra en estado de gestación y juntos viven en una casa que le fue heredada por parte de sus padres. El trabajo al que se dedica es la venta de animales como vacas, ovejas y caballos, actividad que lo realiza durante hace 3 años. Para ella este trabajo es muy importante por que gracias a ello pudo generarse los ingresos suficientes para cubrir las necesidades de su familia. Es así que comprar los animales tiernos y a un bajo costo, para luego engordarlos y cuando lleguen a un tiempo desarrollado los vende en la feria ganadera a un mayor precio, así recupera lo invertido adicional a sus ganancias. Por otro lado posee terrenos que son para cultivo, ubicado en la selva central, ahí siembra café, que es un producto muy rentable y de mucha demanda en el mercado. Sus planes es el de seguir creciendo en capital y extender la siembra de café. Es su primer crédito que solicita de manera grupal con MFP, se siente agradecido porque considera que este préstamo es un apoyo para mejorar su negocio y por ello se compromete ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá para contratar peones para que cosechen café, y cuyas ganancias  serán destinadas a la compra de más animales.
texts.en:
Jhony is 21 years old and lives with his wife. She is pregnant and together they live in a house that was inherited from their parents. Jhony sells animals such as cows, sheep, and horses, as he has done for  the last 3 years. For his wife, this work is very important because thanks to it, he can generate sufficient income to cover the family's necessities.

That's why he needs to buy young animals at a low cost, then to fatten them and when they arrive at a state of development, to sell them in the livestock fair at a higher price, thus recovering the additional investment and earning a profit.

In addition, Jhony has land under cultivation, located in the central rain forest. Here he sows coffee, a product that is very profitable and in high demand in the market. His plan is to continue growing his capital and extending the coffee plantings.

This is Jhony''s first loan as a group member with MFP. He is very grateful because he considers the loan helpful in improving his business, and he promises to be punctual in his payments. The loan will be invested in hiring laborers to harvest coffee. The resulting earnings will be destined for buying more animals.

loans.use: TO HIRE DAY LABORERS TO HARVEST HIS COFFEE CROP

loans.name: Javier Isaias

texts.es:
Javier es un hombre jovial de 43 años que tiene un negocio de mercancía en un lugar muy  comercial de la ciudad de Barranquilla; su vida laboral inició  una vez finalizaron sus estudios de bachiller y  se empleó como auxiliar de una relojería en un taller  aunque no conocía el oficio;  allí recibió todo su aprendizaje, razón por la cual sus jefes  al verle su interés y buena disposición en esta  actividad,  lo vincularon a una cooperativa de relojeros, mecánicos y electrónicos;  así fue como trabajó durante 5 años, época en la cual conoció a su cónyuge con quien hoy tiene tres hijos en las edades de 10 a 20 años, de los cuales se siente muy orgulloso y por ellos  se esmera en seguir produciendo ingresos para lograr su bienestar. Hace 20 años cuando decidió independizarse  emprendió su propio negocio y continuo capacitándose, por eso hoy además de ofrecer el servicio de  mantenimiento y reparación de relojes, donde cuenta con clientes fijos entre los joyeros del sector, también vende relojes y joyeria en general. 
Javier ha recibido dos créditos con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con ellos ha ampliado su infraestructura y ha mejorado la exhibición con la compra de dos vitrinas exhibidoras, ahora está aplicando a su credikiva con el cual comprará relojes accesorios y repuestos para modernizar su oferta y responder a la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Javier is a cheerful man of 43 that has a business selling merchandise in a shopping district in the city of Barranquilla.  He started his working life when he finished high school and got a job as an assistant in a watch shop even though he didn't know the profession.  There he received all of his training.   His managers recognized his interest and inclination for this job so they connected him with a cooperative of watchmakers, mechanics and electricians.  He worked this way for 5 years.  During this time he met his wife and today they have three children between the ages of 10 and 20.  They are very proud of their children and work very hard to provide for their well-being.  Twenty years ago he decided to start working independently and opened his own business while he continued his training.  Today, in addition to offering watch maintenance and repair services, he has a steady stream of customers from the jewelers in the district.  He also sells watches and jewelry.  

Javier has had two loans with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo which he has used to expand his infrastructure and improve his showroom by buying two showcases.  Now he is applying for a Kiva loan so he can buy watch accessories and spare parts to upgrade his supplies and meet the demands of his customers.

loans.use: to buy watch accessories and spare parts to upgrade his supply.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials to make improvements to his room

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.es: Crisanta tiene 62 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo en su casa que es propia. DesD. hace 4 años posee una tienda en donD. venD. productos D. primera necesidad, es así que atienD. todas las mañanas a sus clientes que acuden a su establecimiento, en ocasiones su esposo y su hijo la apoya en las ventas, puesto que también posee animales a las que debe dedicarle tiempo, para ella amabas actividades son importante por que son una fuente D. ingresos para ella y para su familia. Actualmente Crisanta ha perfeccionado su forma D. trabajo en administrar adecuadamente sus recursos y ganancias a fin D. que su negocio se auto sostenga, además D. desarrollarse en la ganadería. Ella esta muy satisfecha D. lo que ha logrado, por ello procura abastecer su tienda con variados productos y ese es su prioridad. Es su primer crédito con MFP, y se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos  ya que es nueva integrante en su banco comunal y esta my agradecida por haber sido admitida en su grupo. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra D. productos para implementar su tienda.
texts.en:
Crisanta is 62 years old and lives in her home with her husband and son.  She has had a store where she sells primary needs products for the past four years.  Every morning she tends to the customers who visit her establishment.  Sometimes her husband and son help with the sales because she also has animals that she must care for.  To her, both activities are important because they both represent a source of income for her family.  Crisanta has mastered her form of adequately managing her resources and earnings so that her business has become self-sufficient and she can develop her livestock.  She is very satisfied with what she has accomplished.  She wants to stock her store with various products.  This is her priority.

This will be her first loan through MFP and she is committed to being on time with her payments.  She is new to her communal bank and is very grateful for having been allowed into the group.  She will use the money from this loan to buy products to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy products to stock her store
