Araceli is well known in the area and relies on an established clientele.  She also counts on a motortaxi that she rents out to other drivers for them to offer transportation services for passengers.  With these activities she can help her husband who works on an industrial fishing crew, sustain the family's finances.  She wishes to invest her loan in the purchase of more reed material in order to make her hats.  With such an investment, Araceli can increase her production and improve sales.

loans.use: to purchase reed for the making of her hats.

loans.name: Eulalia's Group

texts.en:
Eulalia M. is from the village of Estrada. She is 52 years old. Eulalia is the leader of a six-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Eulalia M.'s Group.

Eulalia is married and has two adult children. 

To make a living, Eulalia runs a food stall/canteen. Eulalia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Eulalia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Eulalia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Eulalia is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 11th loan taken out by Eulalia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Norma's Group

texts.en:
Norma E. is from the village of Holy Friday. She is 52 years old. Norma is the leader of a seven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Norma E.'s Group.

Norma is married and has four school-aged children. 

To make a living, Norma owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Norma has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Norma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Norma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Norma is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the 12th loan taken out by Norma from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy A., age 50, earns a living by raising livestock, specifically pigs, for fattening and sale. Mercy has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP every three months. She is from the village of Diamantina, Cabatuan, Isabela. She and her husband have three adult children. 

In 2008, Mercy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services. She wished to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Mercy has successfully repaid her most recent previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. 

She is presently requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase essential medication for her livestock. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Mercy from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase essential medication for her livestock

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta A., from the village of Diamantina, Cabatuan, Isabela, is 43 years old, widowed, and has three grown children. To make a living, Julieta owns and operates a business venture raising pigs for fattening and sale. Engaged in her business for over four years, she earns approximately 7000 every three months.

In 2008, Julieta joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies, she is now requesting her seventh loan of 15000 PHP for the same purpose. Julieta plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Nuriddin

texts.ru: Шамонов Нуриддин проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 29 лет. Женат. Имеет 2 детей. Вместе с семьей занимается растениеводством. Он сажает фруктовые деревья и выращивает овощи. Он в основном выращивает овощи для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается 10 лет. Кроме того у него высшее медицинское образование, он врач. По профессии проработал 5 лет. Кредит берет для закупа семян. Хочет посеять и получить хороший урожай для продажи.
texts.en: Nuriddin S. lives in Hamadoni.  He is 29 years old, married, and has two children.  He and his family work in agriculture.  He grows fruit trees and plants vegetables.  He primarily grows vegetables for sale.  He has been doing this work for ten years.  Additionally, he has a medical degree.  He is a doctor.  He worked in his profession for five years.  He is taking out a loan to buy seeds.  He wants to sow and reap a good crop for sale.

loans.use: to buy seeds

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is engaged in the business of offering second-hand shoes for sale. She has been in this business for five years. She also operates a salon, where she earns approximately Kes. 30, 000 per month.  With the additional income from the salon business, she is able to raise her three children.  

Mary is a hard-working lady who hopes to have a fully established business in the future. 

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 50, 000 kes in order to buy shoes to offer for sale.

loans.use: to buy shoes to offer for sale

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, age 44, has worked as a dairy farmer for the past year. His other trade is tailoring, and he decided to supplement that work with farming so that he can earn more money to support his family. He and his wife have three children. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to develop his business, which has allowed him to improve his family's living standards. He hopes to build a strong and stable business so that he can become more financially stable in the future.  

He has requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 kes to buy fabric and a sewing machine for his tailoring business.

loans.use: to buy fabric and a sewing machine for his tailoring business

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia A., age 39, is a farmer. She plants and harvests rice to offer for sale. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. She is from the village of Diamantina, Cabatuan, Isabela. She and her husband have three school-aged children. 
 
In 2008, Virginia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid her most recent previous loan of 16,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. 

Virginia is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure to use in her rice field. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Virginia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure for use in her rice field

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is a 39-year-old single mother of two. To earn enough money to raise her children, she has two businesses. She has been a dairy farmer for three years, and she supplements her income by operating a cafeteria. She was previously earning a smaller income by selling milk.  

Through Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to run her businesses, and her proven dedication allows her to access business loans easily.  

She has requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 Kes to buy a cow and a chaff cutter.

loans.use: to buy a cow and a chaff cutter

loans.name: Elisha

texts.en:
Elisha, age 34, sells second-hand clothes to earn a living. He has been running his business for one year and has one employee. He is unmarried. Besides being a businessman, Elisha works as an actor and a model. He dreams of having a well established business in the future.  

Elisha has requested a loan in the amount of 20,000 kes to buy clothes.

loans.use: to buy clothes to offer for sale

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana A. is from the village of Diamantina, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 28 years old. Juliana is married and has one infant child. 

To make a living, Juliana prepares and sells barbecue pork. Juliana has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Juliana joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Juliana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional ingredients to make more products to sell. 

Juliana is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Juliana from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary W. W. is a 22-year-old single mother. 

She joined Moonlight Group in Faulu Kenya so that she could access loans easily because the members of the group guarantee each other loans. She is able to pay weekly dues with the group because she sells clothes and fabric. She is also able to meet her basic needs with the income from her business. 

She hopes that one day she will open a big business. 

She has requested  20,000 KES to buy more fabric and ladies' clothes.

loans.use: to buy ladies' clothes and fabric

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel B. is from the village of Diamantina, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 34 years old. Maricel is married and has three school-aged children. 

To make a living, Maricel prepares and sells cooked food for daily meals. Maricel has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Maricel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Maricel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional ingredients to cook more dishes to sell. 

Maricel is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional ingredients to cook more dishes to sell. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Maricel from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients to cook more dishes to sell

loans.name: Donna

texts.en:
Donna B. is from the village of Diamantina, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 42 years old. Donna is married and has two school-aged children. 

To make a living, Donna owns and operates a general store, selling food and daily use products. Donna has been engaged in her business for over 17 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Donna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Donna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Donna is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Donna from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nehemia

texts.en:
Nehemia C., age 44, owns and operates a general store, where she sells both food and daily-use products to members of the local community. Nehemia has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. She and her husband have two school-aged children. She is from the village of Diamantina, Cabatuan, Isabela. 

In 2008, Nehemia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Nehemia has successfully repaid her most recent previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Nehemia is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Nehemia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell in her general store

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is a 22-year-old married woman who lives in Fort Portal, Uganda.  She has one child.  After realizing that her husband could not solely provide for the family, she decided to venture into shoe selling.  Her dream is to set up a stable income-generating activity.

Priscilla has been in this kind of business for four years and the business is profitable despite the challenge of irregular sales.  Nonetheless, she desires to set up a boutique.  Priscilla is seeking the loan to buy shoes to resell.

loans.use: to buy shoes to resell.

loans.name: Marifel

texts.en:
Marifel E. is from the village of Diamantina, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 38 years old and married, with 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Marifel runs a general store where she sells food and products for daily use. Marifel has been engaged in her business for more than 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Marifel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marifel has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI, which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Marifel is requesting a new loan of 16000 PHP which will be also used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Marifel from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Diadina

texts.en:
Diadina C. is from the village of Diamantina, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 58 years old. Diadina is widowed and has 7 adult-aged children. To make a living, Diadina raises pigs for fattening and sale. Diadina has been engaged in her business for more than 3 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month.

In 2008, Diadina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Diadina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Diadina is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Diadina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon P. is from the village of Diamantina, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 49 years old and married, with 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Corazon runs a general store, where she sells food and products for daily use. Corazon is just starting this business.

In 2008, Corazon joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Corazon has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Corazon is requesting a new loan of 18000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Corazon from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina R. is from the village of Diamantina, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 49 years old and married, with 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Avelina  raises pigs for fattening and sale. Avelina is just starting this business.

In 2009, Avelina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Avelina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase hog feed and other supplies. Avelina is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Avelina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita V. is from the town of Diamantina, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 57 years old. Jovita is married and has 10 adult children. 

To make a living, Jovita prepares and sells cooked food for daily meals. Jovita has been engaged in her business for over 35 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jovita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Jovita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

Jovita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Jovita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Bindu

texts.en:
Bindu is 38 years old and lives in the town of West Point. She is a widow and has three children aged 20, 19 and 13; they all live with her and are attending school. 

For three years she has been selling frozen chicken. She used to buy frozen chicken for herself and the owner of the store asked her if she wanted to sell on her own. Now she has a regular group of customers that she visits regularly to deliver frozen chicken. She sells on credit to some clients and sometimes is not able to collect all the money to pay for all the chicken. What she likes about the business is making her own money. 

Bindu has requested a loan to purchase more frozen chicken. In the future, she wants to be her own boss and wants her children to live a good life.

loans.use: to purchase more frozen chicken

loans.name: Munah

texts.en:
Munah is 40 years old and lives in the town of West Point. She is single and has four children aged 30, 25, 17 and 16. Only the two youngest live with her and are attending school. 

Munah cooks and sells rice and soup by the bowl, she has been doing this for 20 years. She says sometimes the business is very good and she has good profits and sometimes it's slow and she doesn't make any money. She started the business with money from her husband. 

Munah has requested a loan to buy rice, meat, pepper and other ingredients. In the future, she wants to build a house for her children.

loans.use: buy rice, meat, pepper and other ingredients

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is 39 years old and lives in the town of West Point. She is married and has six children from 5 to 17 years old. All of them attend school but three live with her sister. Her husband is a pastor. 

For two years Ellen has had a table in the market where she sells chicken. Sometimes she has many customers and makes good money and sometimes it's very slow. She started frying donuts but that became very expensive and she decided to mainly sell chicken. 

This is the first time Ellen has requested a loan; she plans to mostly purchase chicken, but a small part will go to ingredients for donuts. She wants to improve and continue growing her business. She wants to give her children a good education. When she gets old she wants her children to help her.

loans.use: to purchase chicken and ingredients for donuts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy restaurant furniture

loans.name: Mariah

texts.en:
Mariah is 25 years old and lives in the town of West Point. She has one 6 year-old child and lives with her boyfriend who brings in goods from outside Liberia. Her child lives with her mother and is attending primary school. 

In December of last year Mariah started selling cosmetics like body lotion and perfumes in the local market. Her fiancé gave her money and she was able to purchase products to start selling. 

Mariah has requested a loan to buy more cosmetics, body lotion, cream, and perfumes to sell in the market. In the future, she hopes to generate enough money to keep paying for her child's school expenses and also to pay her fees to go to college.

loans.use: buy more cosmetics, body lotion, cream, and perfumes

loans.name: José Reyes

texts.es:
José  tiene  52 años de edad, es soltero y  reside junto a  sus  padres  en el caserío Cruceta que se encuentra a 26 km del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores y aves de corral, el cría gallinas, patos, pavos y gallinas en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. 

El desea adquirir alimentos  balaceados para sus aves así también comprar más animales e incrementar su negocio. Por  ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
José is 52 years old. He is single and lives with his parents in the small town of Cruceta. This is located 26 km from the agricultural district of Tambogrande, an agricultural area located in Piura, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the region of Lambayeque.

He raises and sells small livestock and poultry. He raises chickens, ducks, and turkeys behind his house. When they have reached a good size, the offers them for sale to the buyers that come to the area where he lives.

He wants to buy feed for his poultry and also buy more animals to increase his business. In order to do this, he has requested from Edpyme Alternativa a loan of PEN 1,000.00.

loans.use: to buy animals and feed

loans.name: Ma. Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 34 years old and lives in the town of West Point. Her husband has his own business. They have three children, aged 10, 7 and 3; the two oldest are attending school. 

Since 2003 Julie has been selling soap, toothpaste, charcoal, and other small things. She started frying banana chips and then started trying other products to sell. Sometimes the business is very slow and she has to go to her customers and try to sell.  What she likes about having her own business is that she likes to contribute to keep her children in school. 

Julie is requesting a loan to buy merchandise (soap, toothpaste and coal). In the future she would like to be an international business-woman and wants to send her children to university; she would like them to be something like a doctor or lawyer.

loans.use: to buy soap, toothpaste, and coal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animals and feed

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
Gladis tiene 50 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su familia en el caserío Huaca Blanca que se ubica a 12 km del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Ella cuenta con una bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí  ofrece en venta a sus vecinos diversos productos de consumo diario entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio cuenta con una antigüedad de 3años y actualmente cuenta con una clientela fija y fidelizada. Gracias a esta actividad ella ha podido ayudar a  mantener a su familia y sacarla adelante durante todo este tiempo. Adicionalmente se dedica a la venta de aves de corral.

Gladis desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, asimismo compra de animales para incrementar su negocio, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Gladis is 50 years old. She is married and lives with her family in the small town of Huaca Blanca. This is located 12 km from the agricultural district of Tambogrande, an agricultural area located in the region of Piura, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the region of Lambayeque.

She has a small grocery store in her home. She sells to her neighbors a variety of products, such as basic products and groceries. The business is 3 years old and has an established and loyal client base. Thanks to this business she has been able to support her family and help them get ahead. She also sells poultry. 

Gladis would like to expand her business with the purchase of more merchandise so that she can satisfy the demands of her customers. She would also like to buy animals to increase her business. In order to do this, she has requested from Edpyme Alternativa a loan of PEN 1,500.00.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her small grocery store

loans.name: Socorro Del Pilar

texts.es:
Socorro es una madre de familia de 44 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a su hijo en el caserío Tejedores Bajo que se ubica a 12 km del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir, ella recorre el caserío y zonas aledañas, ella ofrece estos productos tanto al crédito como al contado y los ofrece principalmente entre sus vecinos y conocidos, realiza cobranzas semanales y quincenales. Esta actividad es de mucha ayuda para la economía de su familia y gracias a ella ayuda a su esposo con el mantenimiento de la economía diaria.

Socorro desea adquirir más mercadería para ampliar su negocio y aumentar su nivel de ventas y ganancias, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1700 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer bastante hogareña y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien responsable y de confianza.
texts.en:
Socorro is a mother who is 44 years old and lives with her husband and son in the Tejedores Bajo rural area which is 12 km from the Tambogrande agricultural district in the Piura Region.  It is over four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque.

She sells clothing throughout the rural area and villages for a living.  Her neighbors and acquaintances are her main customers.  She sells either on credit or for cash and collects payment weekly or biweekly.  The business has been of great economic help to her family and has allowed her to help her husband cover daily household expenses.

Socorro wants to purchase more merchandise to expand her business and increase sales and earning.  She thought it would be a good idea to request a loan for 1,700 PEN through Edpyme Alternative to help her reach her goal.

She is a home-loving woman and very intent on getting ahead.  People who know her say she is very responsible and dependable.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Petronila

texts.es:
Petronila tiene 38 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Monsefu, un distrito cuya economía depende principalmente del turismo y  artesanía que se encuentra ubicado a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de pescado en el Mercado de Monsefu desde hace mas de 5 años, contando a la fecha con clientela fidelizada, sus ventas son de forma diaria y al contado, el pescado lo compra en el terminal de Ecomprisa y lo lleva a vender al mercado de Monsefu.

Petronila desea ampliar su negocio de venta adquiriendo pescado fresco y salado a otros pescadores de la zona para ofrecerlo en venta a menor precio. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Petronila is 38 years old, married and lives with her family in the district of Monsefu, whose economy is mainly tourism and crafts.  It is about 40 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

For over five years she has been selling fish at the Monsefu market.  She has loyal customers and does business daily on a cash basis.  She buys the fish at the Ecomprisa terminal and then sells it at the market.

Petronila wants to expand her business by buying fresh and salted fish from other fishermen in the area so she can lower her prices.  To reach her goal she decided to apply for a loan in the amount of 2,000 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy products for her business

loans.name: Miguel Vicente

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 26 años de edad, es soltero y reside junto a sus padres en el sector Caja de Deposito, una zona que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Chiclayo, capital de la Región de Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la ingeniera  mecánica eléctrica desde hace un año y medio. Trabaja como coordinador de remodelación de redes de tensión. Actualmente, la casa de Miguel se encuentra en un estado deteriorado. Desea realizar algunos arreglos en su vivienda y solventar algunos gastos personales. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Miguel es una persona responsable y dedicada a su trabajo y su familia a fin de mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Miguel is 26 years old, single and lives with his parents in the Caja de Deposito sector, which is located in the district of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque Region.

He has been working in electrical mechanical engineering for a year and a half, as tension line upgrade coordinator.  Miguel wants to renovate his home and take care of personal expenses.  That is why he decided to apply for a loan in the amount of 2,000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa.

Miguel is responsible and works to provide a better lifestyle for his family.

loans.use: To renovate his house

loans.name: Maria Emilia

texts.es:
María es una madre de familia de 54 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en el sector San Nicolas,  una zona urbano marginal de la ciudad de Chiclayo, una zona bastante comercial que se encuentra ubicada al norte del Perú.

Ella cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ofrecen en venta a los vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida desde hace 2 años. 

La creciente demanda que la bodega de María ha venido experimentando ha hecho que ella piense en ampliarla adquiriendo más productos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
María is a mother who is 54 years old and lives with her family in the San Nicolas sector, a marginal urban area in the city of Chiclayo which is a commercial zone located in Northern Peru.

She has a small store that she operates out of her house.  She sells a variety of daily consumption items and groceries to neighbors and customers in the area.  For two years business has been doing well.

The growing demand that Maria's store has been experiencing has made her think about expanding and acquiring more products.  This is why she decided to apply for a loan for 500 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy store merchandise

loans.name: Marco

texts.es:
Marco tiene 50 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos en el sector Nuevo Mundo del distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz. Uno de los distritos más poblados de la región Lambayeque, caracterizado principalmente por tener altos índices de pobreza, ya que las personas viven generalmente en zonas urbanas marginales que carecen de servicios básicos.

Desde hace más 15 años tiene instalado en el exterior del mercado de abastos Atusarías se dedica a la venta de frutas como sandias, piñas en rodajas. Este negocio es una fuente importante de ayuda a la familia. El negocio de Marco siempre cuenta con clientes que prefieren su buen trato y amabilidad. 

El desea adquirir más Fruta, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.  De esta manera ella podrá adquirir la fruta a menor precio y por consiguiente ayudara a tener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Marco is 50 years old, married and lives with his wife and two children in the Nuevo Mundo sector of the José Leonardo Ortiz District.  This is one of the most populous districts in the Lambayeque Region, known mainly for its high rate of poverty since most people live in the marginal urban areas that lack basic services.

For over 15 years he has had a stall outside the Atusarías market.  He sells fruit such as watermelon and sliced pineapple.  The business is an important source of income for the family and its customers are loyal because Marco treats them well and with kindness.

He wants to buy more fruit and decided to apply for a loan in the amount of 500 PEN through Edpyme Altnerativa.  This will allow him to buy fruit at lower cost so he can increase his income.

loans.use: To buy fruit

loans.name: Lucero Esmeralda

texts.es:
Lucero tiene 44 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en el sector Nueva Arica del distrito de Chiclayo. Un distrito agrícola que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque.

Lucero se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, especialmente cerdos, en algunos corrales situados cerca a su domicilio desde hace 10 años. Ella los alimenta de granos y pastos naturales, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentemente visitan la zona en donde reside. 

Ella desea adquirir más animales y alimento balanceado para ampliar su negocio y percibir mayores ingresos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Lucero is 44 years old and lives together with her family in the Nueva Arica sector of Chiclayo District.  Chiclayo is an agricultrual district located in Lambayeque Province.

Lucero makes her living raising small animals, in particular pigs.  For 10 years she has raised them in corrals situated near her home.  She feeds them grains and natural grasses.  When they reach the right level of development, she offers them for sale to the traders who frequent the area where she resides.

Lucero wants to acquire more animals and animal feed to expand her business and to receive a greater income.  That is why she has found it beneficial to request a loan of 800 nuevos soles ($300 USD) from Edpyme Alternativa, which will help her to meet her goal.

loans.use: to acquire more animals and animal feed.

loans.name: Juana  Petronila

texts.es:
Juana es una madre D. familia D. 65 años D. edad que resiD. junto a su familia en el caserío Sialupe del distrito D. Chiclayo, que se encuentra a 5 minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización D. animales menores y aves D. corral, el cría gallinas, patos, pavos y gallinas en la parte posterior D. su domicilio y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel D. desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donD. resiD. y en el mercado D. Moshoqueque. 

Ella desea adquirir alimento balanceado y adquirir más animales, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Juana is 65 years old and the mother of a family. She resides with her family in the Sialupe settlement of Chiclayo district, some 5 minutes from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region.

Juana raises and sells small farm animals and farm birds, such as hens, ducks, and turkeys, behind her house. When they have reached a good level of development, she sells them to the businesses who visit the zone where she lives, and in the Moshoqueque market.

Juana wants to acquire farm animal feed and, also, more animals, therefore she is requesting a loan through Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 new sols.

loans.use: TO ACQUIRE LIVESTOCK FEED AND MORE FARM ANIMALS TO RAISE AND SELL

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes tiene 44 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos. Vive en casa propia en el departamento de Piura, ubicado a 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos y perfumes. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace más de 1 año, en su propio domicilio, lugar situado en la avenida principal, siendo muy concurrido y con clientela ya establecida.  Los ingresos que percibe en esta actividad le ayuda para el sostenimiento económico de su familia.

Con su crédito, Mercedes desea comprar más mercadería de ropa, zapatos y perfumes. Con esta inversión, desea incrementar sus ventas diarias y de esta manera sus ingresos. Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 44 years old, lives with her partner and has 3 children.  They live in their own home in Piura Department, which is located 4 hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque Department.

Mercedes makes her living selling clothing, shoes and perfumes.  She has had this business for more than a year.  It is run out of her own home, which is situated on the main thoroughfare.  Her business is very busy and she has an established clientele.  The income that she receives from her business helps to support her family financially.

With the loan, Mercedes would like to purchase more merchandise such as clothes, shoes and perfumes. She would then be able to increase her daily sales.  This is why she thinks it is beneficial to obtain a loan of 1000 nuevos soles ($375 USD) from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise, such as clothing, shoes and perfumes.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco, es casado y reside  junto a su familia en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El cuenta con ovejas y aves de corral, los cuales cría en algunos ambientes dentro de su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta al público en general y a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona. Con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad se encargan de sacar adelante a su familia.

Francisco desea ampliar su negocio comprando más animales y alimento balanceado de modo que pueda aumentar sus ventas durante esta temporada navideña, que es cuando la demanda por sus animales aumenta, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Francisco is married and lives with his family in the Olmos district, a busy agricultural area in the province of Lambayeque, more than an hour and half from the city of Chiclayo.

He raises sheep and poultry in areas inside his homestead, and when they have reached a good size, he sells them to the public and to merchants who come to this district.  With the profit that he will earn from this work he hopes to get his family ahead.

Francisco would like to increase his business by buying more animals and balanced feed so that he can have more sales during the Christmas season.  That is when the demand for animals increases so he plans to request a loan of 1500 new sols from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy more animals and balanced feed

loans.name: Lucia Adelaida

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Los Corrales se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Los Corrales a pocos minutos de Montecristi ciudad con una rica cultura prehistórica, en este sitio los habitantes tiene diferentes actividades, tales como: artesanía y comercio en general.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Lucia, tiene 57 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad pero uno de ellos aun viven en su casa. El marido es chofer.
 
Ella se dedica a preparar bajo pedido almuerzos y meriendas, prepara la comida en su casa y luego la lleva a entregar a Manta, nos cuenta que ella entrega sus deliciosos platos  a dos empresas como son Autoridad Portuaria y Petroecuador, ella trabaja de lunes a viernes y lleva cinco años dedicada a esto, lo cual le ha ayudado a sacar a su familia adelante, su hijo le ayuda con las entregas.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado papas y otros ingredientes para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace cuatro ciclos, es la tesorera del grupo  y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy puntuales con los pagos.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y tener buena salud para continuar hacia adelante.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank, The Corrals, meets every 15 days in a place called the Corrals located a few minutes from the Montecristi city. This city has a rich cultural history. The inhabitants here have various jobs such as making artisan crafts and being in the trade business.

Here we met Mrs. Lucia, who is 57 years old, lives in a common-law marriage where she has two grown children and one still living at home. Her husband is a driver.

She prepares lunches and afternoon snacks. She makes the meals at home then makes deliveries at Manta. She tells us that she delivers her delicious meals to two large companies, Port Auhtority and Petroecuador. She works from Monday to Friday and has been selling food for five years. With this job she is able to maintain her family. Her son helps her make the deliveries.

She will use this loan to buy rice, fish, potatoes, and other ingredients to prepare the meals. She has been with the Communal Bank for five loan cycles. She is the treasurer of the group and she is content because her members are punctual with their payments.

Her goals are to grow her business and have good health to continue improving her life.

loans.use: to buy rice, fish, potatoes, and other ingredients to prepare meals

loans.name: Magdalena De Jesús

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Los Corrales se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Los Corrales a pocos minutos de Montecristi, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes actividades, tales como: artesanía y comercio en general.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora  Magdalena. Tiene 43 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tuvo 4 hijos, tres de ellos ya son mayores de edad, la menor esta en colegio y es la única de sus hijos que vive con ella. Su esposo es comerciante. 

Es una gran ama de casa que se dedica a la venta de zapatos y bisutería, su forma de venta es puerta a  puerta y también vende en su casa lugar donde tiene su mercadería a disposición de sus clientes, vende al contado y también deja a crédito pero solo en dos pagos. Trabaja todos los días desde las 09h00 hasta las 15h00, su mercadería la va a comprar a Guayaquil una vez al mes ya que allá hay más variedad y le sale más barata. Nos cuenta que lleva en este negocio cinco años y que fue una amiga la que la impulso a poner este negocio.
 
Este crédito es para comprar más mercadería. Está en el Banco Comunal desde sus inicios y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe del banco.

Sus sueños son mejorar su casa y construir un  local comercial.
texts.en:
The community bank "Los Corrales" meets every 15 days in a town called Los Corrales, a few minutes from Montecristi, where most people earn their living in different ways, such as making handicrafts or trading in general.

Here we met Señora Magdalena. She is 43 years old, and is in a common-law marriage, from which she has four children, three of whom are grown up, and the youngest is in school and is the only child who lives with her. Her husband is a trader. 

She is a housewife who sells shoes and jewelry, both door to door and from her house where her merchandise is readily available to customers. She takes cash and also credit, but only in two installments. She works every day from 9 a.m. to 3 p.m. Once a month she goes to Guayaquil to purchase her goods, as there's more variety there and it's cheaper. She tells us that she has been working in this business for five years, and it was a friend of hers who encouraged her to launch the business.

This loan is to buy more merchandise. She has been with the community bank since its inception and she enjoys the support she receives from the bank.

Her dreams are to improve her home and build a shop.

loans.use: To buy shoes and jewelry.

loans.name: Johanna Beatriz

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Los Corrales se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Los Corrales a pocos minutos de Montecristi ciudad con una rica cultura prehistórica, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes actividades, tales como: artesanía y comercio en general.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Johanna, tiene 26 años de edad, está casada y  de esta relación tiene un hijo de un año y seis meses. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica en Manta.

Es un ama de casa que para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, aunque sus clientes también llegan hasta su casa a comprar su mercadería. Ella aprovecha las mañanas para salir a sus ventas ya  que su suegra le va a ayudar en el cuidado de su hijo y los fines de semana es su esposo quien le ayuda. Deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días, nos cuenta que empezó con el crédito anterior y que gracias a Dios le está yendo muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar pantalones, camisetas, ropa de niños pero sobretodo ropa de damas que es lo que más vende. Este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque gracias al crédito pudo poner su negocio.
 
Su sueño es  tener su casa propia ya que vive en la casa de los suegros.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the Los Corrales community bank meets in a town called Los Corrales which is located just a few minutes from Montecristi, a city with a rich prehistoric culture.  The majority of the people here work in different business activities such as handicrafts and general commerce.

Here we meet Johanna.  She is 26 years old, married, and has an eighteen-month-old son.  Her husband works in a factory in Manta.

Johanna is a housewife.  In order to help her husband with their household expenses, she sells all types of clothes.  She makes her sales door to door though her customers also come to her home to buy her merchandise.  In the mornings, she goes out to make her sales, taking advantage of the fact that her mother-in-law helps look after her son.  On the weekends her husband helps out.  Johanna leaves her products on credit and collects payment every two weeks.  She tells us that she started her business with her previous loan and, thanks to God, it is doing very well.

Johanna will use this loan to buy pants, t-shirts and children's clothes but mainly women's clothes because that is what sells the most.  This is her second loan cycle with her community bank and she likes it because her previous loan helped her to establish her business.

Johanna's dream is to own her own home since she currently lives in her in-laws' home.

loans.use: to buy pants, t-shirts, and children's and ladies' clothes

loans.name: María Gladis

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Los Corrales se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Los Corrales a pocos minutos de Montecristi ciudad con una rica cultura prehistórica, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes actividades, tales como: artesanía y comercio en general.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Gladis, tiene 48 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo el mismo que ya es mayor de edad pero que  aún viven en su casa. El marido es ganadero.
 
Ella tiene un local en su casa en el cual se dedica a vender cuajada, este es un delicioso plato que se lo prepara con leche, cuajo y azúcar, este postre es una especie de quesillo que es delicioso y muy apetecido por los turistas y personas de su localidad, ella lo sirve acompañado de uno o dos plátanos asados de acuerdo a la preferencia de sus clientes. Nos cuenta que llegan muchas personas de otras ciudades hasta su local a servirse sus productos, lleva más de 10 años con su negocio y nos cuenta que a lo largo del tiempo se ha mantenido y ha crecido mucho.
 
Este crédito es para comprar leche, plátanos, azúcar y cuajo para preparar la deliciosa cuajada. Este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la organización del grupo. 

Su sueño es tener un gran local en Manta.
texts.en:
The communal bank, "Los Corrales" meets every two weeks in a town called Los Corrales, which is located a few minutes from the city of Montecristi.  Montecristi has a rich prehistoric culture, and the majority of the people in this area have various jobs such as craftwork or general business.

Here is where we met señora Gladis, who is 48 and has a live-in boyfriend with whom she has one son, who is now an adult but still lives in her house.  Her boyfriend raises livestock.

She has a a location in her house that she uses to sell "cuajada," which is a delicious dish made with milk, rennet, and sugar.  This dessert is a type of soft cheese that is delicious and is enjoyed by tourists and people in the area.  She serves it along with one or two roasted plantains like her customers like.  She tells us that many people from other cities come to her business to buy her products.  She has had this business for more than 10 years, and she tells us that through time, she has maintained it, and it has grown a lot.

This credit will be used to buy milk, plantains, sugar, and rennet to make delicious cuajada.  This is her second loan with the communal bank, and she likes the organization of the group.

Her dream is to have a big location in Manta.

loans.use: To buy milk, plantains, sugar, and rennet.

loans.name: Diana Carolina

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Los Corrales se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Los Corrales a pocos minutos de Montecristi ciudad con una rica cultura prehistórica, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes actividades, tales como: artesanía y comercio en general.

En este lugar conocimos  a la señora Diana, ella tiene 21 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de dos años. Su esposo es comerciante.

El crédito que ella realiza es para el negocio de su esposo. Él se dedica a la compra y venta de tagua (producto que se utiliza para fabricar botones, artesanías y otras muchas variedades de productos) trabaja cuatro días a la semana, él  se desplaza en las mañanas hasta los campos donde consigue este producto más barato para luego llevarlo a Manta donde les vende a comerciantes que luego llevan a otras ciudades. Nos cuenta que lleva en este negocio ya por 4 años y que le va bien.

Este crédito es para comprar tagua. Este es su quinto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le agrada porque le dan la posibilidad de ayudar a su esposo con los créditos.
 
Su sueño es darle lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en:
The village bank Los Corrales meets every 15 days in a place called Los Corrales, a few minutes from the city of Montecristi which has a rich prehistoric culture. Here, the majority of the residents have different economic activities like artisan crafts and general business.

Here we met Diana, who is 21 years old, married and has a two year old son. Her husband is a merchant. 

The loan will be used for her husband's business. He buys and sells tagua (a product used to make buttons, artisan crafts and many other varied products). He works four days a week. In the mornings he heads to the fields where he gets the product cheaper, and then later carries it to Manta where he sells it to the merchants who will take it to other cities. He tells us that he has been doing this for four years now, and that it's going well.

The loan is to buy tagua. This is Diana's fifth cycle with the village bank and she's grateful that it gives her the possibility of helping her husband with the loans. 

Her dream is to give her son the best.

loans.use: to buy tagua nuts

loans.name: Angela Maribel

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Los Corrales se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Los Corrales a pocos minutos de Montecristi ciudad con una rica cultura prehistórica, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes actividades, tales como: artesanía y comercio en general.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Angela, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos, tres mayores de edad y una chica de 11 años que estudia en escuela, dos de sus hijos  aun vive con ella. Su esposo tiene un tanquero. 

Tiene un pequeño restaurante en su casa en el cual vende comida y también la deliciosa cuajada que es un plato hecho con leche y que a las personas les encanta. Trabaja todos los días, desde las 8h00 hasta las 15h00 o hasta que se termine lo que se preparo. Trabaja con la ayuda de sus hijos, nos cuenta que viene realizando esta actividad desde hace tres años y que le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar leche, plátanos y otros productos para preparar los alimentos. Este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta los créditos que le sirven para financiar en parte su negocio.
 Su sueño es tener una tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
The village bank Los Corrales meets every 15 days in a place called Los Corrales, a few minutes from the city of Monticristi which has a rich prehistoric culture. The majority of residents here have different economic activities like artisan crafts and general commerce.

Here we met Angela, who is 42 years old, married and has 4 children, three of whom are grown and one girl who is 11 and in school. Two of her children still live with her. Her husband has a tanker. 

She has a small restaurant in her house where she sells food and also delicious cuajada, a cheese that many people love, made with milk. She works every day from 8:00am until 3:00pm, or until she runs out of what she made. Her children help her in her work. She tells us that she has been doing this for three years and that it has gone very well.

The loan will be used to buy milk, plantains and other products to make food. This is her second cycle with the village bank and she likes the loans that help her to partly finance her business.

Her dream is to have a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy milk, plantains and other ingredients to prepare meals

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
Alfredo tiene 53 años de edad, es casado y tiene 3 hijos aún dependientes. Vive junto a su familia en casa propia en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo. 

Desde hace dos años, gana la vida trabajando como empleado en una empresa que produce productos de belleza y salud. Este trabajo lo ayuda solventar sus gastos familiares. Actualmente, desea invertir en la educación de sus hijos. Su mayor anhelo es mejorar el nivel de educación que sus hijos reciben para que ellos puedan obtener mejores oportunidades en el futuro. Por ello, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para ayudar con los gastos escolares de sus hijos. Este préstamo permitirá que Alfredo trabaje más tranquilo sin tener que recurrir a prestamistas informales que le cobrarían tasas altísimas, lo cual perjudica su liquidez diaria. Les agradece a los prestamistas de Kiva por su apoyo en sacar adelante a su familia. Alfredo es muy trabajador y es un padre bastante entregado a su familia. Posee muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de su comunidad rural.
texts.en:
Alfredo is 53 years old, married and has 3 dependent children. He lives together with his family in their own home in the district of Olmos, an agricultural zone with a lot of commercial activity that is located in the province of Lambayeque, an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. 

For two years he has earned a living working as an employee at a business that produces beauty and health products. This work has helped him to pay for his family's expenses. Currently, he wants to invest in the education of his children. His greatest desire is to improve the level of education that his children receive, so that they can have better opportunities in the future. For this reason he has asked for a loan of 1000 nuevo soles from Edpyme Alternativa to pay for the school costs of his children. The loan will allow Alfredo to work more peacefully without having to return to the informal lenders that charge high interest rates, which puts his daily cash flow in jeopardy. He is thankful to the Kiva lenders for their support in helping his family to get ahead. Alfredo is very hard working and is a very involved father. He has very good personal and professional references from his rural community.

loans.use: to pay school costs for his children

loans.name: Maria Marleny

texts.es: Maria tiene 26 años de edad. Es soltera y no tiene hijos. Vive en casa de sus padres en el distrito de Morrope en la provincia de Lambayeque ubicado en el norte de Perú. Vive en la parte rural de este distrito.  Desde hace 3 años, cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ofrecen en venta a los vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. Maria es muy conocida en la zona y cuenta con clientela ya establecida. Desea surtirse su bodega con más mercadería para poder aumentar sus ventas e ingresos. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles. Con sus ingresos, Maris puede seguir ayudando a sus padres con sus gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Maria is 26 years old, single and has no children. She lives in her parents' house in the district of Morrope in the province of Lambayeque, located in the north of Peru. She lives in the rural part of the district.

For three years, she has had a small grocery store in her home. There she offers diverse products of daily consumption for sale to her neighbors and customers from the area, including staple goods and groceries. Maria is very well known in the area and has an established clientele. She wants to stock her store with more merchandise so that she can increase her sales and income. For this reason, she has asked Edpyme Alternative for a loan of 2000 nuevo soles. With her income, Maria will be able to continue helping her parents with their family expenses.

loans.use: to stock her grocery store with more products

loans.name: Tania Gabriela

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Los Corrales se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Los Corrales a pocos minutos de Montecristi ciudad con una rica cultura prehistórica, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes actividades, tales como: artesanía.

La señora Tania tiene 20 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de dos  años. Su marido es comerciante.

El crédito que ella realiza es para el negocio de su esposo. Él se dedica a la compra y venta de tagua (producto que se utiliza para fabricar botones y otros productos) él se desplaza hasta los campos  en otras ciudades donde consigue este producto más barato, luego lo  transporta hasta Manta donde les vende a comerciantes que exportan a otros lugares. Trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 8h00 hasta las 17h00.

Este crédito es para comprar más tagua para surtir a sus clientes de este producto. Este es su tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy responsables.
 
Su sueño es comprar una casa propia ya que viven en la casa de sus suegros.
texts.en:
The village bank Los Corrales meets every 15 days in a place called Los Corrales, a few minues from the city of Montecristi, which has a rich prehistoric culture. Here, the majority of the residents have different economic activities such as artisan crafts.

Tania is 20 years old and in a common-law marriage from which she has one son, two years old. Her husband is a merchant.

The loan will be used for her husband's business. He buys and sells tagua (a product that is used to make buttons and other products). He goes out to the fields in other cities where he gets the product more cheaply, and then later takes it to Manta where he sells it to merchants who export it to other places. He works from Monday to Friday, 8:00am to 5:00pm. 

This loan will be used to buy more tagua to suply his customers with the product. This is her third cycle with the village bank and she likes it because her colleagues are very responsible.

Her dream is to buy her own home, since right now they live in the house of her in-laws.

loans.use: to buy tagua nuts

loans.name: Leticia Emperatriz

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Los Corrales se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Los Corrales a pocos minutos de Montecristi ciudad con una rica cultura prehistórica, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes actividades, tales como: artesanía.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Leticia, ella tiene 28 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 15, 8 y 6 años los mismos que están en escuela y colegio, su marido trabaja en una fábrica de harina de pescado.

Tiene una  tienda de abarrotes en su casa en la cual vende productos de priM. necesidad y algunos productos de bazar, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 19h00, los productos los adquiere en Portoviejo ya que allá le salen más baratos. Trabaja con la ayuda de uno de sus hijos cuando él tiene tiempo, nos cuenta que le encanta su tienda ya que además de ganar sus propios recursos está al tanto de sus pequeños hijos para  ayudarlos en las tares y brindarles el mejor de los cuidados.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes y otros productos que aun le hacen falta. Este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque gracias al crédito pudo instalar su negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que vive en casa de su mamá.
texts.en:
The village bank Los Corrales meets every 15 days in a place called Los Corrales, a few minutes from the city of Montecristi which has a rich prehistoric culture. Here the majority of residents have different economic activities such as artisan crafts.

Here we meet Leticia, who is 28 years old, married and has 3 children ages 15, 8 and 6 years old who are in elementary and high school. Her husband works in a fish-meal factory.

She has a grocery store in her home where she sells staple goods and other bazaar products. She works every day from 6am to 7pm. She gets the products in Portoviejo since they are cheaper there. One of her sons helps her when he has time. She tells us that she loves her store since not only does she bring in good income, but she is there to help her young children with there homework and to take care of them.

The loan will be used to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent and other products that she still lacks. This is her second cycle in the village bank and she likes it because thanks to the first loan she was able to start up her business. 

Her dream is to have her own home, since right now she lives in her mother's home.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oils, detergent and other basic necessities

loans.name: Letty Mariana Del Jesús

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Los Corrales se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Los Corrales a pocos minutos de Montecristi ciudad con una rica cultura prehistórica, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes actividades, tales como: artesanía y comercio en general.

La señora Letty es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito y porque aquí ha hecho más amigas. Tiene 41 años de edad,  está casada y fruto de esta relación  tiene dos hijos de 25 y 17 años, él menor vive con ella y estudia en colegio. Su esposo es albañil.

Ella tiene un comedor en el sector donde vive, trabaja de viernes a domingo desde las 8h00 hasta las 15h00, prepara el delicioso encebollado de pescado que es un plato muy solicitado por los habitantes del sector y de la provincia, su hijo le ayuda cuando tiene tiempo libre. Nos cuenta que lleva con su negocio 12 años y que siempre le ha ido muy bien ya que según ella nadie prepara el encebollado más rico que ella.
 
Este crédito es para comprar pescado, yuca, sodas, chifles y otros productos necesarios para la preparación de los alimentos.

Sus sueños son tener un gran restaurante y que su hijo sea un buen profesional.
texts.en:
The village bank Los Corrales meets every 15 days in a place called Los Corrales, a few minutes from Montecristi, a city with a rich prehistoric culture. Here, the majority of residents have different economic activities such as artisan crafts and general commerce.

Letty is a founding member of the village bank and she likes it because the interest rates are lower than in other credit institutions and because she has made many friends here. She is 41 years old, married and has two children, 25 and 17 years old. The youngest lives with her and is in high school. Her husband is a mason.

She has a restaurant in the area where she lives. She works Friday to Sunday from 8:00am to 3:00pm making encebollado de pescado [a traditional Ecuadorian fish stew], which is a plate that is very popular with the local inhabitants. Her son helps when he has free time. She tells us that she has had this business for 12 years and that it has always gone very well, since according to her no-one makes encebollado better than she does. 

The loan is to buy fish, yucca, sodas, plantain chips and other products necessary to prepare the meals.

Her dreams are to have a bigger restaurant and that her son becomes a professional.

loans.use: to buy fish, yucca, sodas, plantain chips and other ingredients to prepare meals

loans.name: Elisa Rosa

texts.es:
Elisa tiene 64 años D. edad y es casada. Ya tiene hijos adultos e independientes. Vive junto a su esposa en casa propia en el distrito D. José Leonardo Ortiz cerca D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, la capital D. la región D. Lambayeque. Su comunidad es emergente y urbana y cuenta con los servicios básicos como luz y agua.

DesD. hace más D. 5 años, cuenta con un negocio donD. venD. abarrotes. Cuenta con su puesto propio en el mercado MiPeru, un mercado ubicado en su distrito. Desea ampliar su mercadería y ofrecer más D. una variedad en sus productos. Asi incrementará sus ventas. Para lograr su meta, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo D. 500 nuevos soles. Su mayor anhelo para su negocio es tener todas las variedades D. productos para mejor responder a las necesidades D. sus clientes. Elisa es muy trabajadora y responsable. Goza D. buenas referencias personales y laborales manifestadas por vecinos y amigos. Es un cliente recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa donD. ha manejado otros créditos que canceló en forma puntual. Gracias a los préstamos obtenidos por la Edpyme, Elisa ha mejorado la calidad D. sus servicios e incrementado sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Elisa is 64 years old, married, and has adult children who are already independent. She lives with her husband in their own home in the District of José Leonardo Órtiz, which is near the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region. Her community is an emerging urban area that receives basic services such as electricity and water.

Elisa has been selling groceries for more than five years. She has her own stand at the MiPeru Market which is located in her district. Elisa wants to expand her inventory of merchandise and offer a wider variety of products. This will help increase her sales. To achieve this goal, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 500 PEN. Her greatest wish for her business is to have all types of products so that she can respond better to the needs of her customers.

Elisa is extremely hardworking and responsible. She possesses good personal and work-related references from her neighbors and friends. Elisa is a repeat client of Edpyme Alternativa and has repaid her other loans in a timely manner. Thanks to the loans provided by Edpyme Alternativa, she has been able to improve the quality of her services and increase her earnings.

loans.use: To purchase various grocery products to sell.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
Felipe tiene 38 años de edad, es soltero y tiene 2 hijos.  Reside junto a su familia en una casa propia en Pimentel, ubicado a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, caracterizado por su playa, la que es muy concurrida en época de verano.

Se gana la vida desde hace quince años criando y vendiendo animales menores en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio, Felipe cría a su ganado y cuando ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive.

Felipe desea adquirir alimento balanceado para mejorar la alimentación de su ganado y venderlo a un mejor precio. Para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Felipe is 38 years old, single, and has two children. He resides with his family in their own house in Pimentel, which is located twenty minutes away from the city of Chiclayo. This area is known for its beach, which is very crowded during the summer.
