Felipe has earned his living by raising and selling animals for the past fifteen years. He keeps the animals in pens located behind his house. Felipe raises his animals until they have reached the proper point of development. At that time, he offers the animals for sale to traders who frequently visit the area where he lives.

Felipe wants to acquire balanced feed to improve the diet of his livestock so that he can sell them at a better price. To achieve this goal, he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN.

loans.use: To purchase balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Víctor tiene 46 años, es soltero, y reside en Monsefú, distrito de Chiclayo, el cual está ubicado a 20 minutos del centro de Chiclayo.  Este distrito es conocido como Capital de las Flores, esto por la producción elevada de flores en esa comunidad.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura desde hace mas de diez años.  Contando a la fecha con un campo de cultivo donde siembre todo tipo de grano .  Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad le ayudan en sus gastos personales y los de su familia.

Actualmente ha sembrado maíz en su terreno de cultivo y se encuentra trabajando arduamente para que esta siembra le brinde una buena producción, por este motivo ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes con los cuales brindará mantenimiento a su maíz.
texts.en:
Victor is 46 years old, single, and resides in Monsefú in the District of Chiclayo, which is located twenty minutes away from central Chiclayo. This district is known as “Capital de Las Flores” (The Capital of Flowers) since there is a higher production of flowers in the community.

Victor has been performing farm work for more than ten years. At the time he started, he acquired a plot of land on which he grows all types of grain. The income that he generates from this activity helps him cover his personal expenses and those of his family.

At the moment, Victor is growing corn on his farmland and is working hard to make sure that his crop results in good production. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN to invest in the purchase of fertilizers to maintain his crop of corn.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Maria Natalia

texts.es:
Maria tiene 33 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos. Vive junto a su familia en casa propia,  que está ubicada en el caserío Luchadores Sociales en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. Vive en la parte rural de este distrito y no cuenta con los servicios básicos de agua o luz.

María se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida y chicha de jora (una bebida típica de Perú a base de harina de maíz).  Vende su comida y bebidas a sus vecinos los viernes a lunes en su domicilio. También se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral pavos y gallinas contando con 11 pavos y 20 gallinas. Cría sus animales en la parte posterior de su casa. Los engorda para luego comercializarlos en el mercado local. Tiene más de 4 años de experiencia en estos rubros. 

Desea usar su crédito para comprar más productos que usa en la preparación de su comida y chica y en la crianza de sus animales. Comprará una olla lo que la ayudará reducir el tiempo de la preparación de la chicha. También comprará más harina para la elaboración de la chica y alimentos balanceados para el engorde de los pavos y gallinas. Espera que sus animales logren un mayor tamaño y peso para luego venderlos a un mejor precio. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Altnerativa. María desea seguir creciendo en su negocio y les agradece a los prestamistas de Kiva por su apoyo en esta meta.
texts.en:
Maria is 33 years old, married, and has four children.  She lives with her family in her own home which is located in the village of Luchadores Sociales in the District of Tambogrande.  This farming area is situated in Piura region and located more than four hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.  Maria lives in the rural section of this district and does not receive basic services such as water or electricity.

Maria prepares and sells food and “chicha de jora” (a traditional Peruvian beverage made of cornmeal).  She sells food and beverages to her neighbors from Friday through Monday in her home.  Maria also raises poultry and currently has 11 turkeys and 20 chickens.  She raises her animals in an area behind her house.  Maria fattens the animals so that she can sell them later at the local market.  She has four years of experience in these business activities.

Maria wants to use this loan to buy more products that are used in preparing food and “chicha”, as well as for raising her animals.  She wants to buy a cauldron that will help her reduce the time required for preparing “chicha”.  Maria will also buy more cornmeal for preparing “chicha” and balanced feed for fattening her turkeys and chickens.  She hopes that her animals will reach a good size and weight so that she can sell them at a good price.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 1500 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa.  Maria wants to continue growing her business and expresses her gratitude to the Kiva lenders for their support that will help her reach her goal.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for preparing food and beverages as well as balanced feed for her animals.

loans.name: Mily Fiorella

texts.es: Mily tiene 25 años de edad y es soltera. Vive en casa con su madre en el distrito de Paijan en el norte de Perú. Gana la vida vendiendo útiles escolares a sus vecinos y amistades. Cuenta con un pequeño puesto instalado en su domicilio. Ahora que la temporada escolar ha comenzado en Perú, Mily desea ampliar su inventario para poder responder a la aumentación de demanda de sus clientes. Por ello, ha creído solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 800 nuevos soles. Mily tiene buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos y conocidos. Las personas que la conocen dicen que es una persona trabajadora y responsable.
texts.en:
Mily is 25 years old and single. She lives at home with her mother in the District of Paijan in northern Peru. Mily earns her living by selling school supplies to neighbors and friends. She manages a small vending stand in her home. Now that the school year has started in Peru, Mily wants to expand her inventory so that she can respond to the increased demand from her customers. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 800 PEN.

Mily has good references from her neighbors and acquaintances. The people who know her say that she is a hardworking and responsible person.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of school supplies.

loans.name: Maria Etelvina

texts.es:
María tiene 47 años, es conviviente y reside junto a su familia en Batangrande, distrito ubicado a 45 minutos dela ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura desde hace mas de diez años, el cría animales menores en su domicilio y los vende a los negociantes que visitan la zona para adquirirlos y revenderlos en la ciudad de Cayaltí y en Chiclayo. Adicionalmente cuenta con un campo de cultivo donde siembre todo tipo de granos y también trabaja como obrero en la empresa agroindustrial del lugar.

Actualmente ha sembrado maíz en su terreno de cultivo y se encuentra trabajando arduamente para que esta siembra le brinde una buena producción, por este motivo ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes con los cuales brindará mantenimiento a su maíz.
texts.en:
María is 47 years old, in a common law marriage, and lives with her family in Batagrande. This district is located 45 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Department of Lambayeque.

María has been engaged in farm work for more than ten years. She raises small animals at home and sells them to traders who visit the area in order to acquire them for resale in the cities of Cayalti and Chiclayo. In addition, she has a field where she grows all types of grain. María also works a field laborer for an agro-industrial company.

She currently grows corn on her land and works hard to make sure that this crop results in good production. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN. The funds will be invested in the purchase of fertilizers to maintain her corn.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for her crop of corn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase clothing to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia tiene 58 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Cuenta  con una bodega instalada en el mercado de Olmos. Allí ofrece en venta a sus vecinos diversos productos de consumo diario entre productos de primera necesidad, abarrotes y plásticos. Actualmente cuenta con una clientela fija y fidelizada. Gracias a esta actividad ha podido mantener a su familia y sacarla adelante durante todo este tiempo.

Lidia desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Lidia is 58 years old, single, and lives with her family in the District of Olmos, a farming area that has significant business activity and is situated in Lambayeque Province. This community is more than an hour and a half away from the city of Chiclayo.

Lidia has a store at the market in Olmos. There she offers different everyday consumer products to her neighbors such as basic necessities, groceries, and plastic goods. She currently has an established and loyal customer base. Thanks to this business, she has been able to support her family and help them move forward throughout this entire time.

Lidia wants to expand her business by purchasing more merchandise to satisfy the demand from her customers. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Augusto

texts.es:
Augusto tiene 41 años de edad, casado con 05 hijos. Vive en casa propia,  que está ubicada en el caserío Vallecito en el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores agrícolas desde hace más de siete años, el cuenta con un terreno agrícola en el cual suele sembrar mangos y de la venta de la fruta  depende el sostenimiento económico de su familia por lo que siempre da lo mejor de si para mantener sus cultivos de la mejor manera.

En esta ocasión el ha sembrado mango y se encuentra trabajando arduamente para lograr que su cultivo brinde una buena cosecha, por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la adquisición de fertilizantes que le permitan brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo.
texts.en:
Augusto is 41 years old, married, and has five children. He lives in his own home in the village of Vallecito in the District of Tambogrande. This farming district is situated in Piura region and located more than four hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Augusto has been farming for more than seven years. He has land on which he grows mangos. Since the financial support of his family depends on the sale of this fruit, Augusto always tries to provide excellent care for his crops in the best way he can.

On this occasion, he is planting mangos and working hard to ensure that his crop will result in a good harvest. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN. He plans to use the funds to acquire fertilizers that will enable him to maintain his crop.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for his mango crop.

loans.name: Ana Margarita

texts.es:
Ana Margarita tiene 25 años de edad, es soltera y  no tiene hijos. Vive junto a sus padres en la parte rural del distrito de Monsefú, una zona conocida por sus festividades turísticas y religiosas. La zona se encuentra ubicada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Las principales actividades que se realizan en este caserío son la producción de flores, la artesanía y la crianza de ganado vacuno. La zona está llena de vegetación y la comunidad es muy pequeña. La zona cuenta con servicios básicos de luz y agua. Tiene un alcantarillado en proyecto. 

Ana Margarita se dedica a la confección de todo tipo de ropa para mujeres, hombres y niños. Cuenta con un puesto en el Mercado Central de Chiclayo donde recibe sus clientes y desempeña sus actividades. Es muy conocida en la zona y cuenta con una clientela ya establecida. Antes de comenzar su propio negocio, trabajó como costurera en una empresa. Tiene más de 5 años de experiencia en este rubro. Esta actividad le permite solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar a sus padres con los gastos familiares. Desea usar su crédito para adquirir una nueva máquina industrial de coser, la cual le facilitará en el desempeño de su oficio, minimizando el tiempo de coser la ropa y maximizando la producción. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Ana Margarita is 25 years old, single, and has no children. She lives with her parents in the rural section of the District of Monsefú, an area that is known for its tourist and religious festivals. This community is located twenty minutes away from the city of Chiclayo. The main business activities in this village are flower production, handicrafts, and livestock breeding. For such a small community, the area is full of vegetation and receives basic services such as electricity and water. A drainage system is being planned.

Ana Margarita manufactures all types of clothing for women, men, and children. She has a booth at the Central Market of Chiclayo where she attends to her customers and performs her duties. Ana Margarita is well-known in the area and already has an established customer base. Prior to starting her own business, she worked for a company as a seamstress. She has more than five years of experience in this field. This business enables her to cover her personal expenses and help her parents with the family expenses.

She wants to use this loan to acquire a new industrial sewing machine which will help her develop in her trade, minimize the time required to complete the clothes, and maximize her production. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (a Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 2000 PEN.

loans.use: To acquire a new industrial sewing machine.

loans.name: Las Progresistas (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Las Progresistas esta conformado por 4 mujeres y 3 hombres quienes viven por diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es la tercera ciudad más importante del país, es patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, tiene una gran variedad en su gastronomía y su gente mantiene su cultura y tradiciones. Nuestras socias laboran en diferentes actividades que les permiten ayudar en la economía de sus hogares y así entregar a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida.

La Señora Vicenta M.  es socia del banco comunal Las Progresistas, vive por la comunidad de Ayaloma que  pertenece al cantón Nabon.

Tiene 20 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 5 años y un bebé 3 meses de edad, su primer hijo estudia en una escuelita de la comunidad. Su esposo labora como oficial de albañil, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus suegros de manera independiente.

La Señora. Vicenta ha iniciado el negocio de cría de pollos hace 3 meses, eligió esta actividad por que le da la oportunidad de cuidar de sus hijos que aun se encuentran pequeños.
 
Es el primer crédito que realiza en el banco, fue invitada por su amiga quien es socia activa del mismo, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más pollos y en su alimento.

Su meta es crecer en el negocio de cría de animales.
texts.en:
Las Progresistas ( The Progressive) communal bank is made up of 4 women and 3 males who live in different parts of the city of Cuenca.  Cuenca is the 3rd most important city in the country, a cultural heritage site, it has great food variety and its people maintain its culture and customs.  The members work in different sectors that allow them to supplement their household finances and this way provide a better quality of life to their families.

Vicenta M. started raising chickens 3 months ago, she chose this activity because it gives her the opportunity to care for her kids who are still little.
This is her first loan, she was invited by a friend who is a current member of the same bank.  She will invest the loan in the purchase of more chickens and their feed.
Her goal is to grow in the business of raising animals.

loans.use: to purchase hens and feed for the animals

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia tiene 44 años de edad y es viuda. Vive con sus hijos en el caserío Cerro Cascajal, ubicado en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola bastante comercial que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra situada a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ofrece en venta a los vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida debido a la buena calidad de los productos que ofrece y a la buena atención que brinda. Además obtiene otros ingresos de la crianza y venta de ganado ovino, porcino y caprino. Despues de criar y engordar sus animales, los ofrece en venta en el mercado loca. Cuenta con clientela ya establecida en la zona. Lleva más de cinco años realizando esta actividad, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. Con los ingresos que le brindan estas actividades, ella se encarga del sostenimiento económico de su familia.

La creciente demanda que su bodega ha venido experimentando ha hecho que piense en ampliarla adquiriendo más productos. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Lidia es muy trabajadora y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es seguir generando buenos ingresos para brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Lidia is 44 years old and a widow. She lives with her children in the town of Cerro Cascajal, located in the district of Olmos, an agricultural and very commerical area that belongs to the province of Lambayeque, an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

She has a small store set up in her house. There she offers neighbors and area customers different daily consumption products and groceries. The business is popular due to the good quality of products and good service it offers. In addition she also gets good income from raising and selling sheep, pigs and goats. After raising and fattening up her animals, she sells them in the local market. She already has established customers in the area. She has been doing this activity for more than five years, so she knows the business well.  With the income that these activities give her, she is the only financial support for her family. 

The growing demand that her store has undergone has made her think of expanding, acquiring more products. For this, she has found it useful to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles, with which she plans on meeting her customers demands. Lidia is very hardworking and responsible. Her greatest wish is keep generating good income to give a better quality of life for her children.

loans.use: to buy more inventory for her store

loans.name: Rosa Beatriz

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa C. es socia del banco comunal San Vicente, vive en la comunidad de San Vicente que  pertenece a la parroquia de La Victoria del Portete, este lugar es de clima frió, su gente se dedica a la ganadería, agricultura y muchos salen diariamente a la ciudad de Cuenca a laborar en diferentes actividades.

Doña Rosa tiene 50 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 28, 25, 22 y 11 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos han migrado en busca de un mejor futuro, su tercer hijo estudia en la universidad y su ultimo hijo en el colegio. Su esposo también se encuentra en el extranjero, con el sacrificio y trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

La Señora. Rosa se dedica al bordado, esta actividad la realiza hace 28 años, trabaja en su casa de lunes a sábados sin un horario fijo. También se dedica a la cría de vacas, borregos y cuyes que son para su consumo y para la venta.

Se encuentra en el banco comunal hace 5 años y  su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de telas,  hilos y en el arreglo de su máquina de coser.
 
Su meta es  construir una nueva casa para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosa C. is a member of the San Vicente community bank.  She lives in San Vicente community which is located in La Victoria del Portete parish.  This area has a cold climate and its people raise livestock and farm.  Many leave the community daily to travel to the city of Cuenca to work in different jobs.

Rosa is 50 years old, married, and has four children aged 28, 25, 22 and 11.  Her two eldest children have migrated in search of a better future.  Her third child is studying at university and her youngest is in school.  Her husband is abroad.  Through their joint sacrifice and work, they have managed to build their own home.

Rosa's business is embroidering.  She has been doing this work for 28 years.  She works from home, from Monday to Saturday but doesn't working fixed hours.  She also raises cows, lambs and guinea pigs which are for her own consumption and also to sell.

Rosa has been a member of her community bank for five years and she will invest her new loan in buying fabric and threads.  She will also get her sewing machine fixed.

Rosa's goal is to build a new house for her children.

loans.use: to buy fabric and threads, and to fix a sewing machine

loans.name: Julia Narcisa

texts.es:
La Señora. Julia P. es socia del banco comunal San Vicente, vive en la comunidad de San Vicente que pertenece a la parroquia de La Victoria del Portete, este  lugar es de clima frió, su gente se dedica a la ganadería, agricultura y muchos salen diariamente a la ciudad de Cuenca a laborar en diferentes actividades.

Doña Julia tiene 40 años, es divorciada y tiene 3 hijos de 20, 16 y 12 años de edad, sus dos primeras hijas se dedican al bordado y  ayudan en la economía del hogar y su ultima hija le ayuda en los quehaceres de la casa. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive en la casa de sus padres compartiendo gastos.

La Señora. Julia se dedica al bordado, aprendiendo esta actividad trabajando hace 20 años, tiene un pequeño taller en su casa y labora de lunes a viernes desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde.

En el banco comunal esta desde que lo  fundaron, el dinero de su crédito lo va ha invertir en la compra de hilos, telas y para el arreglo de una de sus maquinas.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Julia P. is a member of the San Vicente community bank.  She lives in San Vicente community which is located in La Victoria del Portete parish.  This area has a cold climate.  Its people raise livestock and farm.  Many also leave the community daily to travel to Cuenca where they work in different jobs.

Julia is 40 years old, divorced, and has three children aged 20, 16 and 12.  Her two eldest daughters embroider and help with the household finances.  Her youngest daughter helps her with the housework.  They don't own their own home but live in her parents' home, sharing expenses.

Julia's business is embroidering.  She has been in this business for 20 years.  She has a small workshop in her home and she works from Monday to Friday, from 6.00am to 6.00pm.

Julia has been a member of her community bank since it was founded.  She will invest her loan money in buying fabric and threads, and to fix one of her machines.

Her dream is to own her own home.

loans.use: to buy fabric and threads, and to fix a machine

loans.name: Zoila Balvina

texts.es:
La Señora Zoila Z. P. es socia del banco comunal San Vicente, vive en la comunidad de San Vicente que pertenece a la parroquia de La Victoria del Portete, este lugar  es de clima frió, su gente se dedica a la ganadería, agricultura y muchos salen diariamente a la ciudad de Cuenca a laborar en diferentes actividades.

La Señora. Zoila tiene 42 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 20, 18, 15 y 13 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja y le ayuda en la economía del  hogar, sus tres últimos hijos  estudian en el colegio. Su esposo labora en el área de la construcción como albañil.
 
Doña Zoila trabaja realizando bordados hace 20 años, cuenta con un pequeño taller en su casa y este oficio lo ha aprendido trabajando, labora todos los días dependiendo de cuanto trabajo tenga y sin un horario fijo. También cría cuyes, chanchos, gallinas y borregos  que son para su consumo y para la venta.

En la banca comunal está desde que lo fundaron, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vaca para crecer en esta actividad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Zoila Z. P. is a member of the San Vicente community bank, which belongs to the parish of La Victoria del Portete. This place has a cold climate. Its people work with cattle and farming. A lot of them go every day to the city of Cuenca to work in different activities. 

Zoila is 42 years old. She is married and has 4 children, aged  20, 18, 15 and 13 years old. Her oldest son works and helps with the household expenses. Her three younger children go to high school. Her husband works as a bricklayer in contruction.  
 
Zoila has done embroidery for 20 years. She has a small workshop in her house and she learned this job by working at it. She works every day depending on how much work there is and has no set schedule. She also raises guinea pigs, pigs, chickens and sheep, which are for her consumption and to sell.

In the community bank, her loan will be used to invest in buying a cow to grow in this activity.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Jose Raul

texts.es:
José tiene  65  años de edad,  casado, con carga familiar, Vive en casa  propia, la cual esta ubicada en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, en Chiclayo, capital del Departamento de Lambayeque.

José cuenta con negocio en el mercado Modelo y se dedica a la venta de repuestos y accesorios para la actividad automotriz, con puesto fijo, con más de 11 años de experiencia en el rubro.  Estos ingresos le sirven para el sostenimiento económico de su familia.

José desea apoyar a su hijo con sus gastos  universitarios,  por lo que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles en Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
José is 65 years old. He is married and has a family. He lives in his own house, located in the district of José Leonardo Ortiz, in Chiclayo, capital of the departamento of Lambayeque.

José has a business in the Modelo market and he sells replacement parts and accessories for cars. He has a set space and more than 11 years experience in this area. This income helps him supprt his family financially.  

José wants to help his son with university expenses. For this he has found it useful to get a loan of 1000 nuevos soles in Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to help pay for university expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine and different kinds of cloth and thread

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a new carpet weaving frame and other equipments for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more cloth and some new design dress making supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy merchandise for his general store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy anther taxi for his brother

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase furniture for his hotel

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase the size of his store and buy new equipment.

loans.name: 09 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Hương N. Thị (48) is a 45-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoá. Hương is the group leader of a seven member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this loan group is 09 Đông Vệ (08.01.09 Đông Vệ). 

Hương is married and has 2 school-aged children. To making a living, Hương owns & operates a food stall in her community. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of food products. Hương has been engaged in this business for over 7 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) a month from it. 

In 2010, Hương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Hương has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,253,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. She is now requesting a new loan of 6,159,600 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be her second loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hương plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About the Other Borrowers in the Group: 

1.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Liliosa

texts.en:
Liliosa C. is 51 years old and married with six children.

Liliosa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like bread and groceries to sell.

Liliosa has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 15 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Liliosa aspires to save money to expand her business and buy a new motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy more items for her general store

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa D. is a 50-year-old widow with nine children.

Josefa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like sardines and groceries.

Josefa has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 20 years and also earns an income from selling rice, corn and native coffee beans.

Josefa aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her general store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Khen

texts.en: Khen T., 29, who has been a local farmer for many years in the province of Kompong Tom, also raises pigs behind her house for additional profit. Khen is married to Say Sorn, 42, who is currently selling firewood to earn a living. This couple has five children. Because Khen's pig-raising business is very profitable, earning income that benefits her entire family, she will use her loan to purchase extra piglets to breed for selling.

loans.use: to purchase extra piglets to breed for selling.

loans.name: Mercy

Mercy, a 35-year-old married mother of five children, works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a sari-sari store in the Philippines for 10 years and earns additional income from vegetable farming and chicken-raising.

Mercy, who has received and repaid 19 loans from NWTF, is now requesting a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase soap, biscuits, groceries, etc. to sell in her store. She aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks for her general store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

Alma is a vegetable farmer in the Philippines. Alma requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Alma has been vegetable farming for 19 years now and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Alma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mary Grace

Mary Grace M. is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tricycle business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts and to maintain her motorcycle for her tricycle business.

Mary Grace has been in this business for seven years, and she earns additional income from fish vending.

Mary Grace has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business and send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and maintain her motorcycle

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from dried fish. 

Helen is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to buy new fishing boat for her fishing business.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to improve her dried fish business to earn more profits.

loans.use: to purchase a new fishing boat

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sot

texts.en: Rice is an essential product vital to Cambodian people, and cultivating rice is part of 29-year-old Sot S.’s daily routine. She learned to do this from her grandmother, and she has been very widely known in this sector since before she was married. Her husband, Kong Brouspao, assists her with the farm work.  They are blessed with two children who are still young. Sot S. will be using her loan to buy two cows for supporting her in the farm field. She appears with her husband in the photograph.

loans.use: to buy two cows for supporting her in the farm field

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth D., 44, is a married woman with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur. 

Lilibeth has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and equipment.

Lilibeth has been in this business for 10 years.  

In the future, Lilibeth would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and equipment

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Violeta P. works hard to support her family.

She has a fruit and vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Violeta is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy papaya, squash, ampalaya, etc., for her business.

Violeta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fruit and vegetables for her business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha, a 45-year-old married mother of seven children, works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines for 30 years and also earns an income from fishing. Having received and repaid nine previous loans from NWTF, Editha is now requesting a PHP 29500 loan to buy additional items to sell in her store such as shampoo, groceries, etc. Editha aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie is a 23 year-old married woman with a school-aged child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ana Marie has a business selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like bags, shirts, etc., for her business.

Ana Marie has been in this business for 4 years.  In the future, Ana Marie would like to save enough money to send her child to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items for her clothing business

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is 60 years old and married, with 10 children.

Marietta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling rice and has requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional stock of rice for her business.

Marietta has obtained and repaid 16 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the business for 17 years and also earns income from a general store and hog fattening.

Marietta aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a plot of farmland and to help sustain her lotus flower business

loans.name: Deisy Jacqueline

texts.es:
Deysi tiene 25 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos menores de edad.  Su cónyuge trabaja como obrero en un establo. Vive en el Distrito de Monsefú. En este distrito es uno de los que se dedican a la artesanía y trabajos manuales propios del departamento.

Deysi se dedica a la producción de palitos de anticuchos y chupetes en su domicilio el cual esta ubicado en la zona rural del distrito e Monsefu donde la artesanía o trabajos manuales es su ingreso principal.

Deysi desea comprar una mesa de trabajo y más herramientas ya que tiene una mayor demanda de sus productos y a la vez contratará a una persona para que le ayude en este trabajo.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Deysi is 25 years old. She is married and has 3 minor children. Her spouse works as a laborer in a stable. She lives in the district of Monsefú. In this district, she is one of those who work in artisanal crafts and handiwork in the department.

Deysi makes kebab and lollipop sticks in her home, located in a rural area of the district of Monsefu, where artisanal crafts or handiwork is the main source of income. 

Deysi wants to buy a work table and more tools since she has a higher demand for her products. She will also hire a person to help her with the work. That is why she has decided that it is useful to get a loan for 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy a work table and more tools for her business.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 38 years old and married, with 3 children.  She earns a living by raising pigs. Luzviminda is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Luzviminda has been raising pigs for 12 years and also earns additional income from a general store.  She works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Reoum

texts.en: Reoum S., 49, is a married woman who has been living in the province of Siem Reap.  She always stays at home in order to manage the household work. She has a life partner in her husband, who earns an income of around $6 USD per day by working in the construction field. The couple have seven children, two of whom are married. Three of the children earn money by working in various occupations. They have been paying money for taxis to get to work because they don't own a vehicle. To eliminate this expense, Reoum S. is applying for a loan to purchase a new motorcycle, which her kids will use to commute to work.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle for her kids to commute to work

loans.name: Justa

texts.en: Justa, a 68-year-old married mother of seven children, works hard to provide for her family.She has been running a general store in the Philippines for 20 years and also earns an income from buying and selling livestock. Having already received and repaid 19 previous loans from NWTF, Justa is now requesting a PHP 20000 loan to buy items such as coffee, sugar, groceries, etc. to sell in her store. Justa aspires to save money for business expansion.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her sari-sari store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.es:
Eunice tiene 55 años de edad, es madre soltera con 1 hijo. Vive en casa propia en el Distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz.  Este distrito es uno de los más grandes de la ciudad ubicado en el distrito, en Chiclayo, capital del Departamento de Lambayeque.

Tiene un puesto de venta de verduras. Todos los días ofrece a sus clientes una variedad de legumbres y tubérculos frescos los cuales adquiere en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Este negocio es una fuente importante de ayuda a la familia. El negocio siempre cuenta con clientes que prefieren su buen trato y amabilidad. 

Eunice desea adquirir más mercadería, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles. Eunice es una persona bastante trabajadora y entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria.
texts.en:
Eunice is 55 years old.  She is a single mother and has one child.  She lives in her own home in José Leonardo Ortiz district which is one of the biggest districts in Chiclayo province, in Lambayeque department.

Eunice has a vegetable stall where, every day, she offers her customers a variety of fresh vegetables and tubers which she acquires in the wholesale market in the city of Chiclayo.  This business is an important source of support for her family and she always has loyal customers because of her good customer service and kindness.

Eunice would like to acquire more merchandise.  For this reason, she has requested a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  Eunice is a hard-working person who is committed to her family.  Her biggest wish is to continue growing as a businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace B. is from the village of Poblacion, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 46 years old. Grace is married and has two adult children.

To make a living, Grace owns and operates a specialized retail store selling home products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste. Grace has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Grace joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Grace has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell in her retail store. 

Grace is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which also will be used to purchase additional products to sell in her retail store. This will be the second loan taken out by Grace from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell in her retail store

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel A. is 27 years old and has a common-law husband and one child. Maricel works very hard to provide for them.

Maricel runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her store.

Maricel has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as candies, sugar, bread, biscuits, etc.. 

In the future Maricel would like to build and expand her business to provide for the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her sari-sari store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

As a married mother of one child, Corazon E. works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from dried fish. Corazon is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to buy fishing net and a new engine for her fishing boat.

Corazon has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.name: Luy

texts.en: Luy S. has been living in Kompong Cham province, and selling Khmer noodles. She typically earns around $1.33 in profits each day.  She was a widow, then she re-married, but she is now divorced from her husband. She lives with her two young children, who are enrolled in school. Luy S. is worried about her old house, and she does not have enough money to build a new house. In order to deal with this issue, she is requesting a loan from Kiva through HKL to construct her new house.

loans.use: to construct her new house

loans.name: Virgenia

Virgenia A. is 61 years old and married with eight children.

Virgenia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Virgenia has borrowed and paid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 25 years and also earns an income from food vending, vegetable farming and raising livestock .

Virgenia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items for her general store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora A. is 64 years old and married with nine children. Leonora works very hard to provide for them.

Leonora runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, coffee, milk, sardines, etc..
 
She has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell. 

In the future Leonora would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items for her general store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Luzviminda
