Luzviminda M. is 43 years old and married with six children, three of whom are in school. Luzviminda works very hard to provide for them.

Luzviminda buys and sells rice in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

Luzviminda has been in this business for four years. 

In the future Luzviminda would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Emelina

texts.es:
Emelina tiene  33 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 12 años, 11 años y 8 meses. Reside junto a su familia en casa de sus padres en la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de pollo en el mercado Santa Rosa desde hace 3 años. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los destina para el sostenimiento económico de su familia, mejorando así su calidad de vida.

Emelina desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más pollo de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes durante esta temporada, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Emelina is 33 years old, married, and has three children aged 12, 11 and 8 months.  She lives with her family in her parents' home, in the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque department.

Emelina's business is selling chicken in Santa Rosa market.  She has been in this business for three years.  She uses the income that she makes to financially support her family, improving their quality of life.

Emelina would like to expand her business by purchasing more chicken so that she can meet her customers' demand during this season.  For this reason, she has requested a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy more chicken to sell in the local market

loans.name: Oth

texts.en: There are many Cambodians who make a living as rice cultivators; one of them is Mrs. Oth S., who has been working in this sector for many years. She and her husband grow rice on their own farmland that they inherited from their grandparents. From this business they generate an income of around US $ 2.50 per day. This humble couple have five single children; three are students, while the other two are employed as sewing workers in Phnom Penh city. This family’s living conditions are not so good because their lattices are broken down. To solve the trouble, Oth S. has requested a loan to buy some lattices to use for flooring in her house.

loans.use: to buy some lattices to use for flooring in her house

loans.name: Raut's Group

texts.en:
Raut lives in Khanewal, which is a small city located in the Punjab province of Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in the area of Shanty nagar for the past many years in a two-room brick house with her family. She is married to A. D. who works in the field and grows different seasonal crops. Raut is very supportive. She also helps her husband financially by stitching clothes for her neighborhood clients. She is expert in her art and produces quality work. 

She has four children: two sons and two daughters. Her sons have a business painting houses and buildings. They do that work on contract. They just got their education until 5th standard and now they are working to support their family financially. Raut’s elder daughter is 16 years old and stays at home while her youngest daughter is studying in class 6th. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her husband in his business. Through the loan, he will buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticide to grow crops and to earn maximum profits. 

He has been doing this business for the past 10 years. Raut is hopeful that an investment will put her husband’s business in a more profitable position and her family will be able to enjoy better financial benefits as a result.

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Raut.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides to grow crops

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena P. is from the village of Cabangcalan, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 48 years old. Filomena is married and has three school-aged children. 

To make a living, Filomena owns and operates a restaurant in the local community. Filomena is just starting this business.

In 2011, Filomena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Filomena is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant. This will be the first loan taken out by Filomena from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant

loans.name: Chhin

texts.en: Chhin R., 57, owns a small wooden house and a grocery store in front of her house, where she sells many items, including cooking ingredients, sweets, soft drinks, and gasoline. Her customers include passers-by and neighbors. She has been running her business for a long time and earns an average of $1.50 a day. She is taking out a loan to buy more inventory for resale. To help ensure the family’s financial stability, her husband works as a state officer. The couple now live with six children who are going to school and to work.

loans.use: to buy more inventory for resale

loans.name: Geraldine's Group

texts.en:
Geraldine C. is from the village of Centro 2. She is 28 years old. Geraldine is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Geraldine C.'s Group.

Geraldine is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Geraldine owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Geraldine has been engaged in her business for more than six years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Geraldine joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Geraldine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Geraldine is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Geraldine from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: William

texts.es:
William tiene 38 años de edad, es casado con dos hijos a su cargo. Vive en casa de sus padres la cual está ubicada en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz.  Es una comunidad relativamente mediana formada hace casi 12 años.

William se dedica a la comercialización de rocotos, un pimiento típico de Perú y Bolivia, al por mayor en el Mercado Mayorista Los Pathos. Este negocio es administrado por él y su conviviente en puesto propio. Gracias a esta actividad él ha podido mantener a su familia y sacarla adelante durante todo este tiempo.

William desea adquirir más mercadería ya que tiene mucha demanda de público por lo que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
William is 38 years old, married, and has two children in his care.  He lives in his parents' home which is located in José Leonardo Ortiz district.  He lives in a medium-sized community which was created almost 12 years ago. 

William's business is selling 'rocotos', a traditional Peruvian and Bolivian pepper.  He sells his produce wholesale in the Los Pathos Wholesale Market.  He owns his own stall and runs the business together with his wife.  Thanks to his business, he has been able to support his family and get them ahead in life over the years.

William would like to acquire more merchandise since he has a lot of demand.  For this reason, he has requested a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Tarcela

texts.en:
Tarcela P. is from the village of New Bethlehem, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 48 years old. Tarcela is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Tarcela owns and operates a business venture making and selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Tarcela has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Tarcela joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tarcela is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Tarcela from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase snacks and other delicacies to sell

location.town: New Bethlehem, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Noreen's Group

texts.en:
Noreen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her brother in his agriculture business. He owns a small piece of land and grows different seasonal crops in it to earn money for the family. Through the loan, he will buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides to get maximum output from his land and to gain maximum profits. 

Noreen is a mother of three children. All of her children are enrolled in a local school and getting their education.  Her husband's name is R.. He is also involved in the agriculture business and is an expert in his work. 

Noreen is a very caring lady who prefers to stay at home and do her household responsibilities. She is a very responsible person by nature and pays her responsibilities effectively.  She lives in Khanewal, which is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in the area of Shanti nagar in a two-room brick house with her family for the past 20 years. 

She is hopeful that the loan investment will help her brother in expanding his business and increasing his income. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Noreen.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Sum

texts.en:
Sum V. is a local rice farmer who has been working in this sector for years. Her husband earns a living by driving a horse cart in and around his community. The humble couple have five children, two of whom are married. 

Sum V. grows rice on her own farmland, then harvests and sells the mature produce around three months after planting.  From this business, she generates an income of around $3 USD per day. She is taking out a loan to decorate her old house. She appears with her husband in the photo.

loans.use: to decorate her old house

loans.name: Eudosia

texts.es:
Eudosia tiene 42 años de edad, es casada con 3 hijos a cargo. Vive en casa propia. La cual está ubicada en el caserío de San Luis, el cual es pequeño, rural y que pertenece al distrito de La Victoria.

Eudosia se dedica a la elaboración y venta de chicha de jora, una bebida típica de Perú. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace más de 03 años en su domicilio. Ella vende sus bebidas a vecinos y obreros de la zona. Complementariamente se dedica a la actividad de confección de ropa (costurera) y a la crianza y venta de aves de corral. Cría sus animales en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen tamaño y peso, los vende a sus vecinos y los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona. 

Eudosia desea pagar la matrícula de su mayor hijo el cual estudia en un instituto y comprar útiles  escolares de sus menores hijos, el cual le ayudará a desempeñarse correctamente en sus estudios y tener su profesión, de cara al futuro.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Eudosia is 42 years old, married, and has three children in her care.  She lives in her own home, in the village of San Luís which is small and rural, and located in La Victoria district.

Eudosia's business is making and selling 'chicha de jora', a traditional Peruvian (corn-based) drink.  She has been in this business for more than three years and works from home.  She sells her drinks to neighbors and workers in the area.  Eudosia is also a dressmaker and raises and sells poultry.  She raises her animals in an area behind her home.  When her animals have reached a good size and weight, she sells them to her neighbors and the traders who usually visit her area.

Eudosia's eldest son is attending high school and she would like to pay his registration fees and buy school supplies for her younger children..  This will help them to study properly and have a profession in the future.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to pay her children's school expenses

loans.name: Shakeela's Group

texts.en:
Shakeela is 31 years old and married to Mr. G. who operates an agriculture business. He has a small piece of land where he grows different seasonal crops and sells to his clients for a profit. He also has a sweetmeat selling business. His shop is located in the market and he opens it after his day work. 

Shakeela is a very supportive lady. She assists her husband in his work by making sweetmeat. She is also a very good housewife who manages her household works effectively.  She lives in the area of Shanty nagar in Khanewal in a three-room brick house with her family. Khanewal is located in the Punjab province of Pakistan and is known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there for the past 15 years. She is the mother of a daughter and two sons. None of them is able to attend school due to poor financial conditions of Shakeela and her husband. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her husband’s agriculture business. Through the loan, he will buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides to grow better quality crops and earn more profits hopefully. He has been operating this business for the past eight years and Shakeela is very hopeful that an investment will bring better profits to her husband by improving his business conditions. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shakeela.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides

loans.name: Ronald Steve

texts.es:
Ronald tiene 24 años de edad, es soltero y tiene 2 hijos. Vive junto a su familia en el distrito de La Victoria, ubicado a 10 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.
 
Se dedica a la carpintería metálica.  Brinda el servicio en un lugar acondicionado dentro de su casa donde atiende a sus clientes.  Los ingresos que obtiene los invierte en el sostenimiento económico de su familia, a quienes quiere darle una mejor calidad de vida.

Ronald quisiera comprar más herramientas para su negocio, ya que su demanda ha incrementado.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Ronald is 24 years old, single, and has 2 children. He lives with his family in La Victoria district, which is located 10 minutes from Chiclayo, the capital city of Lambayeque department.
 
He is a metalworker, and offers his services in an air-conditioned place within his house where he can attend to his customers. The income he earns he invests in maintaining his family, to whom he wants to give a better quality of life. 

Ronald would like to buy more tools for his business, since demand has increased. For this reason he thought it best to request a loan of 1500 soles ($550) from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to purchase more tools for his metalworking business

loans.name: Rovilyn

texts.en:
Rovilyn G. is from the village of Cabangcalan, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 27 years old. Rovilyn is married and has an infant. To make a living, Rovilyn owns and operates a general store in the local community. Rovilyn has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rovilyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rovilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Rovilyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Rovilyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase products to sell for her general store

loans.name: Khuon

texts.en:
Khuon S., 45, is a widow who lives in the province of Kompong Cham. She is a local rice farmer who has been working in this sector since her children were very young. Currently, she owns a piece of land on which she cultivates different kinds of crops to earn a living. 

Khuon S. was married, but her husband died of senility years ago, leaving her with three children. To help meet the family’s financial needs, one of her sons is working for a tour company. She saw that her son is having difficulty commuting to work because he doesn’t own a vehicle. Therefore, Khuon S. decided to seek a loan to purchase a used motorcycle for her son to ride to work.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle for her son to ride to work

loans.name: Shareefan's Group

texts.en:
Shareefan is a resident of Khanewal, which is a small city in Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. Her house is located in the area of Shanti nagar where she has been living with her family in a three-room brick house for more than 30 years. She is a caring lady who performs her responsibilities of a housewife very well. 

Her husband's name is J. D. and he is a farmer by profession. His small piece of land is very fertile and he grows different seasonal crops on it to get earning for her family. Shareefan has given birth to three sons. Her eldest son helps his father in his business and the second one has a construction supplies business. Her youngest son is 16 years old and stays at home. 
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who will use the loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to grow crops and gain maximum output from them. He has been operating this business for the past 15 years. Shareefan is hopeful that an investment will bring more profits to him and improve his business further. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. She has established a good credit record in the previous loan year by paying her installments on time and by attending every meeting.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides

loans.name: Sek

texts.en: Sek S. is a 29-year-old woman who has been living in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. She is married without any children. She works as a tailor, repairing and sewing clothes in her village in order to earn a daily profit. She has a life partner in her husband who owns a workshop along the street where he provides a haircutting service. Sek S. is requesting a loan of $300 in order to buy a cow for breeding purposes.

loans.use: to buy a cow for breeding purposes.

loans.name: Aasia's Group

texts.en:
Aasia lives in Khanewal, which is a small city located in the Punjab province of Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in the area of Shanty nagar for the past six years in a two-room brick house with her family. She is married to B. who is a rickshaw driver and provides transport services to the passengers. The rickshaw he drives is rented and he wants to buy his own to earn maximum profits. 

Aasia is very supportive in nature. She carries out the responsibilities of a housewife and makes the utmost effort to bring comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her husband buy a new rickshaw. The owned rickshaw will help him to earn the whole fare for his struggle. 

Aasia is hopeful that an investment will put her husband’s business in a more profitable position and she will be able to enjoy a better financial life as a result. She is a new loan user and this is her first loan application to Asasah.

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Aasia.

loans.use: To buy a rickshaw

loans.name: Belinda's Group

texts.en:
Belinda F. is from the village of Turod. She is 45 years old. Belinda is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Belinda F. Group.

Belinda is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Belinda owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Belinda has been engaged in her business for more than 20 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Belinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Belinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Belinda is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Belinda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei is married with two adult children. He has a greenhouse business where he grows tomatoes, cucumbers and other vegetables. Sergei has been in this business for 25 years. He enjoys working with the land and providing people with high quality vegetables. Sergei keeps his greenhouses and household in order. He fixes things himself in case something breaks.  His wife helps Sergei in this business, too. 

Last year, Sergei purchased additional land and is going to build more greenhouses to grow his business and increase the income for his family. Sergei is requesting 10,000 Grivnas to equip new greenhouses.

loans.use: to equip new greenhouses

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
There are four members who have joined together in this loan. Sok S., 49, is the head of the group. She earns a living by selling handicrafts out of her home. She sells furniture that is made from water hyacinth. She is married to Navy, 52, who is a district consultant adviser. They are blessed with five unmarried children, one of whom is employed as internal staff for an organization. Sok S. would like to repair her house, which is damaged often. So Sok S. is asking for a loan in order to buy bamboo to repair her house. 

There are the other three borrowers: 
P. is seeking a loan to purchase a machine to link with her fishing boat. 
R. is applying for a loan to buy additional fishing nets.
H., a fisherman, is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets.

loans.use: to buy bamboo to repair her damaged house.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es: Orlando tiene 31 años de edad. Vive con su pareja e hija en casa de familiares la cual está ubicada en la ciudad de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque en el norte de Perú. Orlando vive en la parte rural de esta ciudad. Gana la vida brindando servicios de transporte público en las calles de Chiclayo desde hace más de 2 años. Desea usar una parte de su crédito para el arreglo y mantenimiento de su vehículo. Necesita mantener su vehículo en buenas condiciones para seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio a sus clientes.  También desea invertir en la educación de su hija. Su mayor anhelo es mejorar el nivel de educación que ella recibe para que pueda obtener mejores oportunidades en el futuro. Por ello, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 800 nuevos soles. Orlando tiene muy buenas referencias personales. Con el tiempo, ha ido mejorando su nivel de vida en su hogar debido a saber desenvolverse muy bien con una fuente de ingreso.
texts.en:
Orlando is 31 years old. He lives with his wife and daughter in a relative's house which is located in Chiclayo, the capital city of the Lambayeque region in northern Peru. Orlando lives in the rural part of this city.

For more than 2 years he has earned a living offering public transportation services on the streets of Chiclayo. He wants to use part of his loan on repairing and maintaining his motorcycle. He needs to keep his vehicle in good condition in order to continue offering good service to his customers. 

He also wants to invest in his daughter's education. His greatest wish is to improve the level of education she receives so that she may have better opportunities in the future. 

For these reasons, he has requested a loan of 800 soles ($300) from Edpyme Alternativa. Orlando has very good personal references. Over time he has been improving his living conditions at home as he knows he is managing very well with a source of income.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle and to pay educational expenses for his daughter

loans.name: Enkhtsetseg

texts.en:
Enkhtsetseg is 45 year old widow and lives with her two daughters, aged 21 and 24, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her family lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent, in the outer ger districts of the city. Her youngest daughter is a student while her oldest daughter helps with her business. 

Enkhtsetseg supports her family by operating a shoe retail stall at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia with help from her daughter.

When she first began her business in 2002, she was a contracted seller of a local shoes factory and she didn't have her own working capital. As result of her hard work, today she has 3,000,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) in working capital at her stall. During the past nine years, she has gained a lot of experience and she has been able to improve her living conditions. She is requesting a loan of 2,400,000 MNT to purchase shoes for spring. 

She wants to improve her business with this loan and then be able to build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase shoes for spring

loans.name: Hormecinda

texts.es:
Hormecinda tiene 45 años D. edad. Vive junto a sus dos hijos menores D. edad escolar y su esposo, quien labora en la empresa agroindustrial. ResiD. en el distrito D. Cayaltí, en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganaderia. Se encuentra ubicada a más D. una hora D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Hormecinda se dedica a la crianza D. aves D. corral, cuyes, conejos y ganado junto a su padre. Ellos crian los animales y cuando ya han alcanzado un buen tamaño y peso, los venD. a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona. Con su crédito, atenderá la alimentación D. sus animales. También desea usar una parte para solventar los gastos escolares D. sus hijos. 

Hormecinda es una persona conocida en su rubro y tiene buenas referencias laborales y personales. Gracias a la asesoría brindada por Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner), Hormecinda podrá otorgar un amplio servicio a la demanda en su zona, contando con clientes nuevos e ingresos adicionales a la familia.
texts.en:
Hormecinda is 45 years old. She lives with her two school-aged children and her husband, who works for an agribusiness company. She lives in a farming and business community in the Cayaltí district, located more than an hour from Chiclayo, the capital city of the Lambayeque region. 

Hormecinda and her father raise poultry, cuyes [guinea pigs; sometimes raised for meat in parts of Latin America], rabbits, and cattle. They raise the animals and when they have reached a good size and weight, she sells them to the dealers who often visit the area. 

With her loan, she will see to the feeding of her animals. She also wants to use part of the loan to pay off educational expenses for her children. Hormecinda is well-known in the business and has good work and personal references. Thanks to the advice offered by Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner), Hormecinda will be able to proviD. expanded service to meet the demand in her area, gaining new customers and additional income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase commercial feeds for her animals and to pay educational expenses for her children

loans.name: Thượng Thôn - Nhóm 09 (Nhóm 09) Group

texts.en:
T. Hoàng Thị (20203060047) is a 21 year-old woman living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  T. is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Thượng Thôn - Nhóm 09 (Nhóm 09).

T. is married and does not have any children. To making a living, T. works in someone else's furniture making business. The main source of income for the business comes from making & selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members. T. has been engaged in this business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3,000,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) a month from these activities.

In 2011, T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. T. is requesting her first loan from SEDA, for 5,152,000 VND which will be used to purchase machinery to expand the business. T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Ngô Thị

loans.use: to purchase machinery to expand the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothing materials and sew spring clothes

loans.name: Yalene Noemi

texts.es: Yalene tiene 21 años de edad y es soltera. Vive en casa con su madre en el distrito de Paijan en el norte de Perú. Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza. En la foto, Yalene está en la oficina de Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) y muestra algunos de sus productos. Ella vende sus productos por catalogo a sus vecinos y amistades en su caserío y sus alrededores. Ella desea diversificar su inventario y vender útiles escolares. Hay una demanda para estos productos ahora que la temporada escolar ha comenzado en Perú. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa. Yalene tiene buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos y conocidos. Las personas que la conocen dicen que es una persona trabajadora y responsable. Les agradece a los prestamistas de Kiva por su apoyo en seguir creciendo su negocio.
texts.en:
21-year old Yalene is single and lives with her mother in Paijan district in the north of Peru. She earns her living by selling beauty products. In the photo she can be seen in the office of Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva field partner) displaying  some of her products.

Yalene sells from a catalog to neighbours and friends in her village and surrounding areas. She wishes to diversify and start selling school supplies for which there is a demand now that students are back in school in Peru. So Yalene is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 500 soles. She has good references from her neighbours and acquaintances who say she is a hardworking responsible person.

Yalene thanks Kiva donors for their support in helping her expand her business.

loans.use: to diversify into school supplies

loans.name: Zaib's Group

texts.en:
Zaib lives in Khanewal, which is a small city located in Punjab province of Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. She has been living in the area of Marzipura in a two-room brick house with her family for the past 15 years. She is married to M. N. who works for the Pakistan railway for a low income. To fulfill the basic needs of the family, and to financially assist her husband, Zaib does sewing and embroidery work for neighborhood clients. The money she earns helps pay the utility bills and cover other household expenses.

Zaib has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, to further improve her business. With this loan, she will purchase clothes and embroidery materials such as beads and colored thread to fulfill the orders of her customers on time and to increase her income. She has been in this business for the past five years and is very sure that an investment will definitely be helpful to her in improving her business.

Zaib is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. She has built a good credit record in the previous loan year and never missed any meeting. In the photo, the lady with a book (an Asasah passbook) is Zaib.

loans.use: to buy clothes and embroidery material.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more ducks to raise and sell

loans.name: Thượng Thôn - Nhóm 04 (Nhóm 04) Group

texts.en:
Lệ Trương Thị (20203060022) is a 62-year-old woman living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. Lệ is the group leader of a 6 member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Thượng Thôn - Nhóm 04 (nhóm 04).

Lệ is married and has 3 adult children. To making a living, Lệ owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling food & daily use products. Lệ has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3,500,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) a month from it.

In 2010, Lệ joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Lệ has successfully repaid her first loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. She is now requesting her second loan, for 7,392,000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Lệ plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1. Cao Thị Như (0) is a 25-year-old woman who is requesting a 7,392,000 VND loan to support her specialized retail store.

2. Trương Thị L. (0) is a 40-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,944,000 VND loan to support her business making & selling food.

3. Nguyễn Thị N. (0) is a 40-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,944,000 VND loan to support her  clothing business.

4. Đào Thị C. (0) is a 50-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,944,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

5. Nguyễn Thị N. (0) is a 36-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,944,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Lệ Trương Thị (20203060022) là 62 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. Lệ là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, N.ng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Thượng Thôn - Nhóm 04 (nhóm 04).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán cả hai loại thức ăn & các nhu yếu phẩm trong cộng đồng địa phương. Lệ thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 4 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Lệ kiếm được khoảng 3,500,000 VND. Vào 2010, Lệ đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Lệ đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5,152,000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7,392,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1. Cao Thị Như (0) là 25 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7,392,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


2. Trương Thị L. (0) là 40 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,944,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


3. Nguyễn Thị N. (0) là 40 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,944,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh quần áo.


4. Đào Thị C. (0) là 50 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,944,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


5. Nguyễn Thị N. (0) là 36 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,944,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Giovany

texts.es: Giovany tiene 23 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo. Vive junta a su familia en un caserío ubicado 20 minutos del distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. Se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y aves de corral como pavos y gallinas. Cria los animales en corrales ubicados en una parte de su casa. Además cuenta con un pequeño terreno agrícola que heredó de su padre en el cual tiene sembrado limón. Cosecha el limón semanalmente. Tiene una antigüedad de más de 3 años de experiencia en estos rubros. Solicita un crédito para la compra de alimentos para el engorde de su ganado y la compra de fertilizantes para su cultivo de limón. Con estas inversiones, Giovany podrá ampliar el tamaño y peso de sus animales y limón, lo que la ayudará venderlos para un mejor precio y generar mayores ingresos. Giovany es muy trabajadora y responsable. Les agradece a los prestamistas de Kiva por su ayuda en crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
23-year old Giovany is married and has a son. She lives with her family in a village located 20 minutes from Tambogrande district which is an agricultural area in Piura region, more than four hours from the town of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region. Giovany earns her living by raising pigs and poultry such as turkeys and chickens in a section of her house. She also has a small plot of land inherited from her father where she grows lemons and picks them every week. Giovany has been doing this work for more than three years. 

She is seeking a loan to buy food for her animals and fertilizer for her lemon trees. The pigs and poultry will increase in size and weight, as will the lemons, so she’ll be able to sell them for a better price and increase her income.

Giovany is hardworking and responsible. She thanks Kiva donors for their support in helping her expand her business.

loans.use: to buy food for her animals and fertilizer for her lemon trees

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
T. Nguyễn Thị (20203060007) is a 43-year-old woman living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  T. is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members in the case that someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Thượng Thôn - Nhóm 01 (Nhóm 01).

T. is married and has 2 adult children.  To making a living, T. owns and operates a business venture making and selling food.  The main source of income for the business comes from selling dried goods in the local community.  T. has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 3,500,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2010, T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She is now requesting a new loan of 7,392,000 VND, which will be used to buy more kind of products to meet the demand of customers.  This loan will be her second loan from SEDA.  T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Nguyễn Thị Thơ (0) is a 49-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

2.  Nguyễn Thị T. (0) is a 49-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,944,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

3.  Chu Thị T. (0) is a 45-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business providing recycling services.

4.  Ngô Thị L. (0) is a 35-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,944,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

5.  Đào Thị Q. (0) is a 29-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized store.

6.  Nguyễn Thị B. (0) is a 26-year-old female who is requesting a 7,392,000 VND loan to support her business of making and selling food.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Noreen's Group

texts.en:
Noreen is a very supportive lady. Along with her household responsibilities, she also operates a sewing business. She receives orders from neighborhood clients and fulfills them on time to earn profits for her family. She is married to J. M. and has four children. Three of them are studying while youngest one is only 5 years old and has not started getting an education yet. Her husband sells wheat and cotton. Her brother-in-law also lives with her family. He is 26 years old and in the same business as J. M.. 

Noreen has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, to improve her sewing business. With the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine that will help her complete her work in less time and produce good quality clothes. She has been in her business for the past eight years and is very confident that an investment will be productive for her business and take her business to a more profitable position. 

Noreen lives in Khanewal, which is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agricultural industry. She has been living in the Marzipura area in a two-room brick house with her family for the past 20 years. In the photo, the lady with a book (an Asasah passbook) is Noreen.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business.

The official name of this borrowing group is Cụm Đông Thái - Nhóm 09 (Nhóm 09).


Ngũ is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To making a living, Ngũ owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Ngũ has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4,500,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2010, Ngũ joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Ngũ has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase rice as raw material  needed to make products for sale. She is now requesting a new loan of 7,392,000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA. Ngũ plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.name: Khatoon's Group

texts.en:
Khatoon is 46 years old and married to M. Y., who works in the Pakistan army. His income is not enough for the whole family – that’s why Khatoon assists him financially by sewing clothes and doing embroidery for neighborhood clients. She receives regular orders from community ladies and fulfills them on time to earn an income. 

Khatoon lives in a small city called Khanewal in a two-room brick house with her family. Khanewal is located in Punjab province of Pakistan and is known for its agricultural industry. She has been living there for the past 35 years. She is the mother of five sons. Her eldest son sells wheat and rice, while the second one has a sweetmeat shop. Her remaining children are enrolled in a local school and are getting their education. Their education was only possible through the work and efforts of Khatoon; otherwise, their financial conditions wouldn't allow them to get an education. 

Khatoon has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for the betterment of her sewing and embroidery business. With the loan, she will buy embroidery materials such as beads, colored thread and sketches in bulk to provide good quality services to her clients. She has been operating this business for past five years and is very hopeful that an investment will bring better profits to her by improving her business condition. In the photo, the lady with a book (an Asasah passbook) is Khatoon.

loans.use: to buy embroidery material.

loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.en:
M. Nguyễn Thị is 40 years old and lives in the town of Huyện Yên Phong  - Bắc Ninh.  She is married, has three school-aged children and makes a living by farming fish. She has been in this line of work for more than 10 years and earns about 3,000,000 VND a month from her work.

In 2009, M. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid two previous loans of 6,496,000 VND from SEDA and is applying for her third, for 8,288,000 VND, to buy feed and other supplies.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated by this loan to continue expanding her business.


About SEDA:
The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and northern Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

M. Nguyễn Thị (20203050029) là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong  - Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 3 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, M. Tham gia công việc kinh doanh của gia đình.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ nuôi cá để bán.  M. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, M. kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2009, M. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  M. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thức ăn gia súc & các loại cung cấp khác.  Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  M. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to buy livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Shahlan's Group

texts.en:
Shahlan is a resident of Khanewal, which is a small city in Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. Her house is located in the area of Marzipura and she lives there with her family. She is an active 36-year-old lady. She not only provides comfort to her family by completing her household responsibilities but also supports them financially from her sewing and embroidery works. She offers her services to her neighboring clients and earns income for the family. Her family respects her and loves her a lot for her kind and helping nature towards them. 
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further improvement of her business. Through the loan, she will buy embroidery materials such as clothes, beads and colored thread in bulk quantity that will help her offer better services to her clients, which will definitely affect her monthly profits. Shahlan is hopeful that this investment will bring more profits to her and will improve her business conditions. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shahlan.

loans.use: To buy embroidery materials

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more foods and different kind of beverages for his general store

texts.en:

In 2009, V. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid two previous loans from SEDA and is applying for a new one, for 8,736,000 VND, to buy additional supplies for her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by this loan to continue expanding her business.

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and northern Vietnam.

loans.name: Đoàn

loans.name: Trương's Group

texts.en:
Q. Trương Thị (20203050021) is a 24-year-old woman living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. Q. is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Ô Cách 1 nhóm 04  (Nhóm 04).


Q. is married and has two school-aged children. Q. owns & operates a business venture manufacturing furniture. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from making & selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members. Q. has been in business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5.000.000 VND a month.


In 2009, Q. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.  Q. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5.152.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to expand product offerings.  She is now requesting a new loan of 8.288.000 VND, which will be used to purchase wood as material to expand her production scale.  This will be Q.'s third loan from SEDA. Q. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Nguyễn Thị C. (0) is a 29-year-old woman who is requesting a 7.392.000 VND loan to support her manufacturing business.


2.  Nguyễn Thị T. (0) is a 25-year-old woman who is requesting a 7.392.000 VND loan to support her furniture manufacturing business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Q. Trương Thị (20203050021) là 24 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Q. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Ô Cách 1 nhóm 04  (Nhóm 04).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán trang thiết bị gia dụng thông thường cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Q. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 3 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Q. kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND.  Vào 2009, Q. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Q. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.152.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua nguyên liệu thô bổ sung để mở rộng việc giới thiệu sản phẩm.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyễn Thị C. (0) là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất.


2.  Nguyễn Thị T. (0) là 25 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm C. phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to purchase  wood as material

loans.name: Ali

texts.ar: علي في عمر 31 سنة يعمل في بيع الحبوب والاعلاف والزيوت متزوج وله 5 اولاد له في عمله 3 سنوات يسعى الى تطوير عمله وتجديده يريد ان يدعم عائلته وان يؤمن لهم العيش الكريم والرغيد يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة جديدة وشراء بيك اب لنقل هذه البضاعة فهو يسعى الى زيادة مدخوله والاعتماد على نفسه في العمل يتميز بالعمل الدقيق والنشاط له زبائن من محيطه والقرى المجاورة له يواجه بعض الصعوبات بالتنقل بين المناطق لذلك يسعى الى شراء البيك اب حتى يتمكن من تسهيل عمله يحب عائلته وقد ساهمت في دعمه بالقرض السابق من المجموعة حيث ساهم في تطوير العمل وتحسيت جودة البضاعة لديه فهو نشيط ويحب العمل ويريده ان يتطور
texts.en: Ali is 31 years old, and he works selling grains, animA. feeds, and cooking oil. He is married with five children, and he has three years of experience in his line of work. He is always trying to find new ways to develop his business. He would like to be better able to support his family so that he can ensure that they will have a comfortable and respectable life. With a loan from A.-Majmoua, he would like to buy new goods for his store, as well as a pick-up truck so that he can move his store's supplies himself. He would like to buy these things because he is looking for ways to both increase his income and to become more self-sufficient in his business. He stands out in his line of work due to his attention to detail and his work ethic. He has customers from his community as well as from neighboring villages, and it is because he has customers from such a large area that transportation is where he faces challenges in his business. A pick-up truck would help him overcome these difficulties. He loves his family, and they supported him during his last loan from A.-Majmoua. He used his last loan to develop his business by improving the quality of the goods in his store. He likes his business, and he would like to see it grow.

loans.use: to buy new goods such as grain,  and cooking oil , and to buy a pick-up truck so that he can deliver his customers' purchases.

loans.name: Kimanyisho

texts.en: Kimanyisho N. is 30 years old, married and has four children. She has farmed her own piece of land for the last six years and makes a monthly profit of Ksh. 5,000. She learned about KADET LTD from our staff and has paid two previous loans on time. She used these loans to buy fertilizer, maize and other farm supplies. She hopes to use the profit generated by this loan to expand her farm and make sure that her children get a good education. She believes she can do this because she is a hardworking woman and is very dedicated to her farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim lives in a small city in Pakistan called Khanewal. Khanewal is located in the Punjab province of Pakistan and is known for its agriculture industry. Her house is situated in the area of Jinnah Abadi and contains two rooms. She has been living there for the past 25 years with her family. 
She is 41 years old, married to G. A. and has five children. Except for her eldest son, all of her remaining children are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. 

Shamim is a very caring lady. She manages her responsibilities as a mother and wife very well. He husband owns a small piece of land where he grows different seasonal crops. He is very hard worker and works 8-12 hours a day. After his crops are full-grown, he cultivates them and sells to his clients for a good profit. 

Shamim has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s agriculture business. Through the loan, he will buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides, which will help him get better results from his field.Shamim is hopeful that her husband will be able to increase his profits this year.  
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. She has established a good credit record in her previous loan year and never missed any meeting. \

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shamim

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides

loans.name: Isaack

texts.en: Isaack is 28 years old, married and has two children. He has made a living by farming his own plot of land for the last 10 years and earns a monthly income of KES. 4,000. He has a good credit history with KADET and has repaid two previous loans on time. He is applying for this third loan to buy farm supplies and plans to use the additional income he earns to educate his children and expand his farm so that he can provide his family with a better life.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Nkaiwatei

texts.en: Nkaiwatei S. K. is 23 years old, single, and supports his parents. He has been a farmer for the past four years with a monthly income of  5,000 KES.   He repaid his previous loan in good time. He is requesting his third loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy farm inputs. With the profits generated he plans to expand farming and venture into the livestock business.  Nkaiwatei dreams to earn more money. He is an assiduous man who works with effort to attain more despite limited resources.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Khoumayni

texts.ar: خميني عمره 27 سنة اعزب يعمل في محل لبيع الالعاب والهدايا والاكسسورات بالاضافة الى الجزادين والأحذية له في عمله سنتين يحب عمله ويريد ان يطوره يسعى الى زيادة مدخوله يطمح في تكوين عائلة وان يكون لها مستقبل جيد فهو طموح اعتمد على نفسه حتى يكون عمل خاص به وقد استطاع وهذا ما يميز عمله فهو له زبائن من محيطه وجيرانه يتميز بالدقة في العمل والجدية وله رغبة بأن يصبح صاحب متجر كبير في المستقبل يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة جديدة احذية وجزادين  وعطورات والعاب فهو مثابر على العمل وكان يواجه بعض الصعوبات بالمنافسة فلذلك يريد زيادة البضاعة وتطوير المصلحة
texts.en: Khoumayni is 27 years old and single. He works in shop which sells gifts, toys, perfumes and colognes, purses, and shoes. He has two years of experience in this business. He likes his work and he would like to develop his business. He is trying to increase his income, as he wants to start a family and to be able to provide a good future for his family. He aspires to be self-sufficient, and this is why he opened his own business. He has customers from his community and from among his neighbors. He stands out in his line of work due to his attention to detail and earnestness. He hopes to one day own a big store. With a loan from al-Majmoua, he would like to buy new goods for his store including new shoes, perfumes and colognes, and toys. Though he is diligent in his work, he's having difficulty competing with the other businesses in his sector of the market. He might be able to overcome these difficulties by buying more goods for his store.

loans.use: to buy more goods, including shoes, purses, perfumes, colognes and toys, for his store.

loans.name: Trương

texts.en:
T. Trương Thị is  54 years old, married, and has four adult children.  They live in the town of Huyện Yên Phong-Bắc Ninh.  To making a living, T. owns and operates a business raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale.  T. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month.

In 2009, T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,840,000 VND from SEDA, which was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.  T. is requesting a new loan of 8,736,000 VND, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.  The loan will be T.'s third loan taken out from SEDA.  T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Kokoyian

texts.en:
Kokoyian E. K. is 55 years old, the married mother of eight children who depends on her. She has been a farmer in Nkareta-Narok, Kenya for a period of ten years with an income of about KES 6,000 per month.

She knew about KADET LTD through other women registered with them in her area of residence. She repaid the previous loans successfully and without complication. This is her third loan from KADET LTD which she wants to use to buy farm supplies such as seedlings and fertilizer. 

She hopes to grow different crops on her farm and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Haleema's Group

texts.en:
Haleema is 45 years old, married to M. B. and has five children. Four of them are enrolled in a nearby school and getting their education. 

Her husband does a private job for a low income. After his day job, he also works in the fields and grows different crops. He has a good number of business contacts and he makes reasonable profits by fulfilling their orders. By managing two jobs, he is able to cover the expenses of his home. 

Haleema is a housewife and does her household tasks by staying at home. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her husband in expanding his agriculture business. Through the loan, he will buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides, etc. to grow better crops and make more profits. 

She is very much confident that after making an investment in her husband’s business, his business will grow and make him more profits than before which will result in better financial life for her family. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. She hopes that this loan experience will prove a good one for her as was her previously one. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Haleema.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides for agriculture business.

loans.name: Noomali

texts.en: Noomali is a very painstaking lady who practices farming in Olopito-Narok, Kenya. She has been in this business for over five years and earns a monthly profit of KES 7,000. She is 28 years old and married to Jackson, also a farmer, and they have two children. She is applying for her first loan, which she plans to use to buy farm inputs. Noomali intends to use the additional income generated by this loan to buy cattle for fattening and to pay her children's school fees. She hopes to develop her business and to be financially stable in the future

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Nooretet

texts.en: Nooretet is 34 years old and married with five children. She has been farming on her own piece of land for the past eight years. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET staff member where she lives. She has applied for the her third loan which she intends to use to buy wheat seed and fertilizer. She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activity from small scale to large scale and, also, to buy a few cows for fattening. Nooretet dreams of educating her children to a higher level of education. She is a thorough woman who is determined to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy wheat seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Ali

texts.ar: علي عمره 20 سنة يعمل كسائق سيارة اجرة اعزب له في عمله 3 سنوات علي طموح جدا ويعتمد على نفسه في تطوير عمله ومجتمعه يعمل حتى يطور نفسه ويؤمن مستقبل فهو يحلم في تأسيس عائلة ويريد ان يساعد اهله دائما فعائلته هي من اهم اهتماماته فرابط العائلة هو اساسي عنده يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى صيانة سيارته وثم مساعدة الأهل في تحسين المنزل يتمنى بأن يصبح صاحب عدد اكبر من السيارات فهو في عمر طموح جدا واهم شيء لديه هو عمله وتطوير نفسه في المجتمع
texts.en: Ali is 20 years old and single. He works as a taxi driver. He has three years of experience in his line of work. Ali is very ambitious, and he is self-reliant when it comes to developing his business and his community. He works because he wants to improve his own life and secure a good future for himself. He dreams of starting a family, and he hopes that he will always be able to provide his parents with some sort of financiA. support. The reason why he is focusing on these goals is that he considers his family and his ties to his family to be some of the most important things in his life. With a loan from A.-Majmoua, he would like to have maintenance completed on his car and to help his family improve their home. He would like to own a number of cars one day, as he is a very ambitious person, and the things which are most important to him are his work and improving his sociA. standing in society.

loans.use: To do necessary maintenance to his taxi and to help his parents improve their home.

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group
loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 25 years old, single and lives with two family members; only one of them works.

In 2009, Ahmad opened his own shop for mobiles phones an accessories. He is becoming well known and has an excellent reputation.

He is requesting a $1800 loan to pay rent to the owner of the shop to renew the rental contract. He is aiming to increase his sales so he will expand in the future.

loans.use: To pay compensation for the owner of the shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 40-year-old married man from Lebanon and the father of two school-aged children. He has owned a restaurant since 2005. He produces tasty Lebanese bread, pastries and other food. His restaurant is located in a pleasant area with mountains and a sea view at the same time, where customers can enjoy his delicious food and other products.
 
Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to perform needed maintenance on his restaurant and renew its decoration. This renovation will allow him to attract more customers which will result in increasing his income. He is very positive about his future plans and wants to better support his family.

loans.use: perform needed maintenance and redecorate his restaurant.

loans.name: Firas

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 30 years old and married.

Firas has owned a shop for ladies' and kids' shoes since 2009. He inherited this job from his father. He is becoming well known and has a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting a $3000 loan to pay rent to the owner of the shop to renew the rental contract. He is aiming to increase his sales so he will expand in the future.

loans.use: To pay compensation for the owner of the shop.

loans.name: Patricie

texts.en:
Patricie is 39 years old.  She is married with four children who are between 3 and 13 years old. Patricie makes her living by sewing different styles of African clothes.  She has been in this business for five years.  She operates her business from 8am until 7pm every day. She employs three people to help her.

Patricie has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company s.a. in order to purchase more African clothes for sewing.  Patricie will hopefully earn more profit, which will allow her to create other areas of the same business.  She will also be able to save money for her future.

loans.use: To purchase more African clothes for sewing

loans.name: Hussein

texts.ar: حسين عمره 43 سنة يعمل في محل لبيع المواد الغذائية له في عمله 10 سنوات يريدان يطور نفسه وان يوسع عمله متزوج وله 5 اولاد يحب تعليمهم بكل امكاناته له زبائن من محيطه وجيرانه ل تاريخ جيد في عمله كان للقرض السابق من المجموعة الأثر الجيد في زيادة دخل العائلة يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة جديدة وخضار حتى يزيد من مدخوله فهو يواجه بعض الصعوبات في زيادة الدخل من خلال المنافسة فهو يريد ان يزيد من البضاعة حتى يتميز عن محيطه يسعى الى تربية اولاده بشكل جيد وتعليمهم بشكل افضل من خلال تحسين وضعه فهو طموح ويحب عائلته ويريد لها ان تتحسن اجتماعيا وماديا
texts.en: Hussein is 43 years old and works in a grocery store. He has ten years of experience in this line of work. He would like to develop himself and expand his business. He is married with five children. He enjoys teaching his children about anything he is able to teach them about. He has customers from his community and from among his neighbors. He has a good history in his business, and his last loan helped him to increase his family's income. With a loan from al-Majmoua, he would like to buy new goods for his store, for example vegetables. In doing so, he should be able to increase his income. Currently, the competition in the grocery business is creating some difficulties for Hussein. Because of this, he would like to increase his store's inventory so that he can distinguish his store from the other grocery stores in his community. Hussein wants to raise his children well by giving them a better education than the education they currently have, and he can do this by improving his current material circumstances. He is ambitious, and he loves his family, and he wants to help the members of his family improve their material situation and social status.

loans.use: to buy new goods for his grocery store.

loans.name: Hyacinthe

texts.en:
Hyacinthe is 30 years old and married with three children between one and 3 years old. Hyacinthe sells charcoal and her business is well-organized. She employs two people to help her and she works from 8 am until 9 pm every day. She has one year's experience.

Hyacinthe has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more sacks of charcoal for sale. With the profits, she will reinvest in her business, satisfy her customers, and save money for her future.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
