Doris M. is 54 years old, from Kakamega, and is married to John. They have two children who go to school.

Doris has been running a retail shop for the past two years. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy more detergent, eggs, cooking oil, flour etc. to add to her stock at her retail shop. 


The profits will be used to help with the family's needs and pay school fees for her children. She hopes own a wholesale shop in future.

loans.use: To buy detergent, eggs, cooking oil, flour etc to add to her stock

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Heng C. is a 32-year-old married woman. She  lives with her husband and  four school-aged children and earns a living by planting various crops on their own farmland. Heng C. currently plants a potato crop, which she will harvest  when it  matures.  Heng C. says that she faces difficulties in traveling  anywhere. She and her husband hire a taxi or walk because they don't have their own vehicle. To solve this difficulty, Heng C. has requested a loan to buy a used motorcycle to provide transportation.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle to provide transportation.

loans.name: Bonefance

texts.en:
Bonefance is a 54 year old married man, with six children living in his own semi permanent house in Fort Portal Uganda.

He is solely responsible for looking after the family, and his dream is to educate them up to university level.  He has been farming for 20 years.   Bonefance needs the loan to grow onions.  He started by harvesting one sack per season, but he can now harvest ten sacks of onions in a season.  His major challenge is price fluctuation and his dream is to  become a large scale commercial farmer.

loans.use: To grow onions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy paint and additional tools.

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her husband in his business selling animals. Her husband has been doing this business for the past 10 years  by purchasing cattle, and it has proved to be a profitable one for him.  With the help of the loan, he will purchase young goats and sheep, raise them, and will sell them at a profit to butchers. He also does a private job for a low income which helps him pay utility bills and other expenses.
  
Shazia is a mother of two sons. Her elder son is studying in class one while her younger one is only three years old and has not started getting an education yet.  She is a very good mother and housewife,  raising her children with great care.   

This is her 1st loan application.  She belongs to Khanewal which is a small city in Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in a 2-room brick house with her family in the area of Jinnah Abadi for the past 10 years. 
 
Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shazia.

loans.use: To buy goats & sheep for animal sales business.

loans.name: Vang

texts.en:
Vang V. is married and a mother. She and her husband are local farmers and they have three single children who are still in school. This couple currently generates an income of approximately $5 per day from their business. 

Vang V. is taking out her loan to purchase a piece of farmland in a good location for farming, on which she will grow potatoes. In addition, she will rent her land to another farmer.

loans.use: to purchase a piece of farmland for growing potatoes

loans.name: Nuhaila

texts.en:
Nuhaila N. is 38 years old and married to Naser Abu Salem. They have five children. She is an artistic, talented and creative woman who started to use her skills in a professional way two years ago making straw products such as hats, baskets, trays and other items.

Nuhaila has widened her market base, by contracting with some of the biggest traders in the area who help her selling her products. Now Nuhaila is applying for a loan to improve her business by adding more products and having a display area for her products.

loans.use: To have a display area for her crafts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 42-year-old married man living with his wife and four young children who are still attending school. He has been working as a home painter for the past 20 years. He works on a freelance basis taking on home projects. His income is vital to support his family and be able to pay the heavy expenses of life. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a mini-van for his work. In that way, he will benefit from making his transportation faster and easier especially since he serves customers located in different areas and villages. He hopes to further expand his business and continue his work properly to earn good income for his family. In the future, he is planning to open his own shop where he can sell house paint and all related tools.

loans.use: to purchase a mini-van for his work.

loans.name: Soun

texts.en:
Soun M. is a 56-year-old farmer who lives in Kompong Cham province. She is married to Touk Mao, who is also 56. Soun and her husband work together to cultivate and sell rice. The couple has two adult children who are married and who help them in the business. 

Soun is requesting a loan to buy a plot of farmland to grow a variety of crops. This loan will provide her with a new asset.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland

loans.name: Ruqqiya's Group

texts.en:
Ruqqiya belongs to Khanewal which is a small city of Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She lives there with her family in a 2-room brick house in the area of Jinnah Abadi. She moved here 10 years ago. She is a housewife and spends most of her time staying at home and doing her household work. She has a one-year-old son and takes care of him and is raising him very well. 

Her husband’s name is M. S. and he works in the fields as a farmer. He grows different seasonal crops and after cultivating, he makes good profits.  

Ruqqiya has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to buy fertilizers, seeds and pesticides to grow his business further. 

He has been operating this business for the past 10 years and Ruqqiya is hopeful that an investment will bring better profits to him by expanding his business. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Ruqqiya.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides for agriculture business.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary A. is 42 years old, from Kisumu, married to Charles.  They have six children who are all in school.

Rosemary has been running a grocery business for the past year. She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a friend and is applying for her first loan. Rosemary will use the loan to buy bananas, sugarcane, carrots and eggs to add to her stock. The profits made will be used to educate her children.

She hopes to own a big grocery shop in the future and venture into a cereals business. Rosemary also plans to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy beans, bananas, sugarcane, carrots and eggs to add to her stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his banana warehouse .

loans.name: Sann

texts.en:
Mrs. Sann was born in 1967 married to Mr. Ing who was also born in 1967.  They are farmers, who own a 1.50-hectare plot of land, which they use to grow rice and corn for their family living. 

They do not have enough money to buy what they need, to support their farming activities. Therefore, Mrs. Sann decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, rice seeds, and corn seeds for the farm. The couple has three children, who all are students.  The children also help their parents with the farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, rice seeds, and corn seeds for farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build aluminum shelves for his shop.

loans.name: Nao's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of sixteen members. Mrs. Nao, who was born in 1966, is the village bank president. She was selected to be the village bank president by the other members.

Mrs. Nao is a widow with four children: two are seamstresses in the garment factories while the others are students and also support their mother by farming. 

Mrs. Nao is a farmer.  She owns a plot of land, which she uses to grow bananas and potatoes for a living.  She doesn’t have enough money to grow her crops, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers for cultivating bananas.  The rest of the loan she will use for growing potatoes.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for cultivating bananas and potatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 19-year-old single man living with his parents and one sibling. Despite his young age, he started working as a mechanic four years ago. Today, he is the owner of a car repair shop. His work is specialized in repairing all types of vehicles from the inside and the outside. From time to time, this man has promotions and offers special prices on his products and services in order to make his shop a center of attention. He follows this strategy because it allows him to earn a good income. 

He is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new mechanical tools in place of his used ones. He intends to adopt a new business plan which will bring him superior profits.

loans.use: to purchase new mechanical tools.

loans.name: Yen

texts.en: Yen S. was born in 1963 and is a married woman. Yen’s husband works as a chief-of-construction worker for a mobile construction service. Yen has built a pigpen behind her house where she raises pigs to earn a living. She has two children who are both employed in different jobs. Because they have no vehicle, Yen’s children need to hire a taxi to commute to work every day. Yen is requesting a loan to buy a motorcycle so that her kids can commute to their workplaces.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Asmaa

texts.en:
Asmaa Q. is a 48-year-old married woman, who used to do her own house decoration. Her husband Ali and her children noticed that she is artistic and had a sense of creativity in doing that, so they encouraged her to start her own business.

Asmaa started 5 years ago, making beautiful baskets and painting frames at her house using straw and other materials. Over these five years she was able to gain more customers by word of mouth.

Since Asmaa’s business is growing, she applied for this loan so she can open her own independent store and to buy more materials to have more variety of products.

loans.use: to open her own independent store.

loans.name: Penh's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Penh was born in 1969. She is the village bank president. She was selected to be the village bank president by its thirteen members. 

Mrs. Penh and her husband, Mr. Khut, fish to make a living. They are able to earn a small income to support their family. Now their business faces some problems. Their fishing boat is broken, and they do not have enough fishing nets. In order to improve their business, Mrs. Penh would like to ask for a loan to buy fishing nets and to fix her fishing boat. 

This couple has three children: two children are seamstresses in garment factories, and the other child is a student in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets and to fix her fishing boat.

loans.name: Mehdi

texts.ar: مهدي عمره 28 سنة متزوج يعمل في جلي البلاط له في عمله 12 سنة يحب عمله ويطوره بشكل مستمر يسعى الى تأمين مستقبله من خلال تطوير العمل وزيادة المدخول طموح مجد ومحب للعمل له زبائن من خارج محيطه وجيرانه يتميز ياتقان العمل يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء جلاية للبلاط وتوسيع العمل كان للقرض السابق الأثر الجيد على عمله وزيادة مدخوله
texts.en: Mehdi is 28 years old and married. He works buffing tile floors. He has 12 years of experience in this field, and he likes his work. In addition, he is always developing his business. He is trying to secure a good future for himself by developing his business and by increasing his income. He is ambitious, just as he is serious about his work. He has customers from both outside his community and from among his neighbors. He stands out in his field by way of the excellent quality of his work. With a loan from al-Majmoua, he would like to buy a new floor buffer in order to expand his business. His last loan from al-Majmoua had a positive impact on his business and helped him to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy a floor buffer.

loans.name: Asteria

texts.en:
Asteria T. is from the village of Brgy. Roxas, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 46 years old. Asteria is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Asteria owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Asteria has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

Asteria joined ASKI this year to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Asteria is requesting a new loan of 18000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Asteria from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Va's Group

texts.en:
Thirteen members make up this village bank loan. Va is the village bank president, selected by the other members. 

He was born in 1952 and is married to Khoem, who was born in 1959. They have three children. One is a laborer, and the other two are students who also help their parents on the farm. 

Va and his wife are farmers who own a plot of land which they use to grow bananas and potatoes. At this time they do not have enough money to support it.  Va would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers for cultivating bananas, and the rest of the loan he would use for growing potatoes.  Aside from working their own farm, they are also farming laborers where they can earn a small income to help support their family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for cultivating bananas, and for growing potatoes.

loans.name: Dot

texts.en:
The woman shown in the picture above, Mrs. Dot N., is a 32-year-old farmer residing in the rural area of Kompong Tom province. She feeds some pigs in a pigpen behind her house. Eventually, she will sell her pigs to a slaughterer, and does so in four-month cycles. Besides this work, she has also been planting a rice crop, and that is her annual business. Her husband is a firewood seller as well as helping her in raising piglets. 

Mrs. Dot N. is looking for a loan to buy additional feed and piglets for feeding. She has three single children who are attending the local school.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and piglets for feeding.

loans.name: Nolmeshhuki Enole

texts.en:
Nolmeshhuki, 25 and married to Edwin K., a farmer, has been a wheat farmer for the past five years, earning a monthly income of KES.3,000. Introduced to KADET LTD by a registered client, this is her first loan from KADET which she will use to purchase maize seeds and fertilizers. She hopes to generate profits from the loan which will go toward expanding into large-scale commercial farming.

Nolmeshhuki hopes she will live a better life in the future and see her children achieve magnificence.

loans.use: to purchase maize seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Mehdi

texts.ar: مهدي في عمر 52 سنة يعمل في بيع الخضار والفواكه له في عمله 7 سنوات متزوج وله 5 اولاد له تاريخ قديم مع المجموعة وقد كان يلقى الدعم الكامل من العائلةله زبائن من محيطه وجيرانه يسعى الى تحسين وضعه المادي والاجتماعي وتعليم اولاده بشكل جيد فهم كل اهتمامه ولكن ما ينقصه هو المادة الى تحسين وضعه يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء خضار وفواكه وزيادة أصناف جديدة له خبرة كبيرة في عمله وهو نشيط ويتميز بالنظافة والدقة في العمل
texts.en: Mehdi is 52 years old and makes a living by selling fruits and vegetables. He has seven years of experience in this business. He is married and has five kids. His a long history with al-Majmoua, and his family supported him during his last loan from al-Majmoua. He has customers from his community and from among his neighbors. He is trying to improve his material circumstances and social status. Additionally, he is trying to give his children a good education, as they are his number one concern in life. However, he lacks the resources needed to improve his and his family's living situation. With a loan from al-Majmoua, he would like to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell, including new kinds of fruits and vegetables. He has a lot of experience in his work, and he is a hard-working individual. Not only that, but he stands out in his line of work due to the cleanliness of his store and his attention to detail.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for his fruit and vegetable business, as well as to increase the variety of fruits and vegetables available in his store.

loans.name: Oyunjargal

texts.en:
Oyunjargal, a 29-year-old widow, lives with her two daughters in a rented one-bedroom studio in Erdenet, the second biggest city in Mongolia. Her oldest daughter, Uranchimeg, attends a local secondary school, while her youngest daughter, Tselmeg, stays at home.

Oyunjargal used to be a teacher at “Urlakh Erdem” university, the famous Mongolian fashion design school from which she graduated. Then she started her own tailoring business in 2006, employing a friend who studied in university with her. Oyunjargal now rents a stall at ”Danista” market, the crowded city market. Her dream is to buy her own apartment and to give her children a proper education and good morals. This will be her first loan, with which she intends to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Rours' Group

texts.en:
Seventeen members form this village bank loan. Mrs. Rours is the village bank president, selected by the other members. 

Mrs. Rours and her husband are farmers who own a plot of land which they use to cultivate bananas. In order to support this farming, she would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers. The rest of the loan she would use to buy oil for supporting her water machine.  Her husband is a laborer who is able to earn a small income to help support his family. 

This couple has three children. One is a seamstress in the garment factory and the others are students and alS. support their parents' farming.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for growing bananas

loans.name: Chanthoeun

texts.en: Mrs. Chanthoeun is married to Mr. Saren, and they have three children. Two of the children are studying in local public school. Their youngest child is 5 years old. Mrs. Chanthoeun owns a general store in her village where she sells groceries. She earns some profit to support her family. Her husband is a sand seller and a farmer. He owns a small piece of land where he grows rice. He sells part of the rice and the family uses the rest of the rice. Mrs. Chanthoeun wants to breed a cow, but she does not have enough money to buy one. So Mrs. Chanthoeun is applying for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim P. is 47 years old and the mother to two children. One is single and the rest are married and have already started new families. 

In the beginning of 2000, Kim Pao built a small store in front of her home. In her shop, she sells a few snack products, soft drinks, cooking ingredients, and other products to the neighbors who live near her house in the village. She is married to Ban Phea, 48, a local rice farmer. 

Kim Pao will take out a loan to buy some feed and small chickens for breeding, and she will sell them when they are big enough. She hopes to increase her income by using Kiva’s loan.

loans.use: to buy feed and small chickens to breed

loans.name: Abida's Group

texts.en:
Abida lives in Jaranwala which is a small city of Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in the area of Madni Park with her family in a 2-room brick house for many years. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who operates a motorbike rental business. He has two motorbikes which he rents to people and charges on an hourly basis. He is very good in customer dealings and has been doing this business for the past 8 years. With the loan, he will buy another motorbike to further improve his rental business. 

Abida has given birth to four daughters. Two of them study while the others are very young and are not of school-going age yet. Abida is a housewife and does her household responsibilities, staying at home. She is a very active lady and always shows full support to her husband in difficult times. She also does sewing work as a part-time job to financially contribute to the family. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year, she established a good credit record and attended every meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Abida.

loans.use: To buy another motorbike for motorbike rental business.

loans.name: Trey's Group

texts.en:
Four people form this group loan. Mrs. Trey is the group leader selected by the other members. Each member of this group will use their portion of the money to support their different purposes.

Mrs. Trey, who was born in 1975, is a widow with three children who all are students and also help with their mother's business.

Mrs. Trey is a pig breeder who is able to earn a small income to support her family. In order to support this business, she would like to ask for a loan to buy pig food. Aside from pig breeding, she also works as a seamstress in a garment factory.

loans.use: to buy pig food

loans.name: Hussein

texts.ar: حسين عمره 40 سنة متزوج وله 6 اولاد يعمل في حدادة السيارات وبيع الاكسسوارات الخاصة بها، له في عمله 28 سنة. يحب عمله ويطوره بشكل مستمر يريد دائما التجدد والتطور في العمل،  يريد تأمين حياة افضل لأولاده وتعليمهم بشكل جيد فهو محب للعائلة مجد في العمل ونشيط يتميز بالدقة في العمل والنشاط وطلب التطور دائما يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة جديدة مخصصة لعمله في حدادة السيارات بالإضافة إلى الإكسسوارات اللازمة لبيعها. كما أن حسين يريد دعم محل الهواتف الخليوية، فهو يطمح بأن يصبح صاحب محل اكبر حتى يتمكن من التطور وزيادة مدخولة والربح بالإضافة إلى تربية أولاده بشكل جيد ومريح
texts.en: Hussein is 40 years old and married with six children. He works as a mechanic and merchandiser of car accessories. He has 28 years of experience in this line of work. He likes his work and is always finding new ways to develop his business. He enjoys improving his business and augmenting his income as much as he can. He would like to secure a better life for his children, as well as provide them with a good education, because he loves his family very much. He is serious about his work, and he has a strong work ethic. In addition, he stands out in his line of work due to his attention to detail, the energy he puts into his work, and his drive to constantly improve his business. With a loan from A.-Majmoua, Hussein would like to buy new goods and accessories for his car business. He aspires to one day own a bigger store so that he can improve his standard of living and increase both his income and his business profits. These things will better enable him to raise his children both well and in comfortable financiA. circumstances.

loans.use: To buy new products for his business in vehicle repair, in addition to increasing his stock of car accessories

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Van, 56, is a mother of four children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, one is employed in a private company, and the others are studying in the local public school. She and her husband, Chea, are farmers who own a two-hectare plot of land where they can grow both rice and vegetables to sell to earn some money to support their family.

In the fields it is time to plow, but Van does not have enough oxen for plowing. So to solve her problem, she is applying for a loan to buy another ox.

loans.use: To buy an ox

loans.name: Keu's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Keu and her husband have three children: one is a staff worker in an NGO, one is a grocery seller, and the third is attending a local school. Keu is a group leader; she was selected as the leader by the other four members.

Keu and her husband sell beef in the market and are able in this way to earn a small income to support their family. Since this business is doing well, Keu wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more beef to enlarge her current business.

loans.use: To buy more beef to enlarge her current business

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Mrs. Chantha is married to Mr. Suna, and they have three children, two of whom are studying in the local public school, while the youngest one is only two years old. 

Chantha was born in 1980. She is a farming laborer and a farmer who owns a plot of land where she can grow rice. She sells some part of the rice, and the rest she uS. for her family. Her husband is a fisherman and a construction worker. 

Now she wants to start a new business, so she needs some money to support it. To accomplish this, Mrs. Chantha is asking for a loan to buy five piglets for breeding, pig food, and vaccine. Her husband is shown in the photo with her.

loans.use: to buy five piglets for breeding, pig food, and vaccine

loans.name: Kroeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Kroeurn was born in 1957 and she is married Mr. Touch. They have three children, one of whom is a driver who gets a low salary, another one is a seamstress in a garment factory, and the third is studying in the local public school. 

She and her husband are farmers who own a small piece of land where they can grow rice. They sell part of the rice and use the rest for their family. Her husband is a duck breeder. Although they try to work hard, they can earn only a little income. So to improve this condition, Mrs. Kroeurn is seeking a loan to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business. Her husband is presented in the picture with her.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of fourteen members. Mrs. Pov is the village bank president selected by the other members. 
 
Her husband, Mr. Brak, who was born in 1953, is a motorcycle taxi driver who is able to earn a small income to support his family. They have five children. One is seamstress in a garment factory, two are laborers, and the other two are students in the local school. 

Mrs. Pov earns a living by selling groceries in the local village. In order to increase her income and improve her family's standard of living, she would like to ask for a loan to buy more groceries to expand her business activities.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to expand her business activities

loans.name: Laet

texts.en:
Mrs. Laet was born in 1985 has two children who attend the local public school. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she grows rice. She sells part of her crop and uses the rest to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Sochea, owns a mill machine. 

It is time to plant in the dry season and Mrs. Let would like to plant rice and improve her crop. She is requesting a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer and pesticide to grow dry-season rice.

loans.use: to buy rice seed, fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mrs. Chea was born in 1956 is a widow with three children. Two of her children are seamstresses in the garment factories one is a laborer. Mrs. Chea is a farmer who owns a one-hectare plot of land which she uses to grows rice and corn for a living. She would like to grow rice in the dry season but does not have enough money. Mrs. Chea is therefore asking for a loan to hire laborers to plow her land and buy fertilizer and pesticides to grow rice and corn.

loans.use: to hire farm labor and buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi est constitué de 5 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge  de 36 ans, en moyenne 2 enfants et qui vivent majoritairement  dans des  familles monogames à OUAYERMA, un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur cinquième  collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait la vente d’articles divers tels des friperies à l’image  de KOROTOUMOU K., qui  compte acheter avec son  prêt,  10 balles de friperies. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de SIKASSO auprès des grossistes et revend, en famille et au grand marché de  Sikasso, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90.000FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
Elle ambitionne augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is composed of five married women averaging 36 years of age, with two children, who live mainly in monogamous families in Quayerma, a district in the city of Sikasso (the third administrative region of Mali).

They are on their fifth collaboration with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, with the goal of meeting customer demand. This group of women sells various articles, for example, used (second-hand) clothing, which is what Korotoumou K. does. She plans to use her loan to purchase 10 bales of used clothing. She buys her stock from wholesalers at the big market of Sikasso and resells out of her home and at the big market of Sikasso to a customer base composed of both men and women, for cash. She anticipates earning an average monthly income of 90,000 West African Francs, which will be used for everyday family expenses. Her goal is to increase her sales volume in order to better meet customer demand

loans.use: to buy used clothing

loans.name: Lun

texts.en: Ms. Lun was born in 1979. She is single and she lives alone. She is a farmer who owns a very small piece of land where she can grow rice. She sells part of the rice and with the rest of the rice, she supports herself. Aside from farming, she is a seamstress in a garment factory which is far away from her house. So she needs a motorcycle for transportation to work, but she does not have enough money to buy one. Ms. Lun would like to ask for a loan to buy a motorcycle for personal transportation.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to drive to work.

loans.name: Houssein

texts.ar: حسين يعمل في محل حلاقة رجالي له في عمله 8 سنوات متزوج وله 3 اولاد له مع المجموعة تاريخ جيد وقد ساهم القرض السابق بتحسين وضع محله وتطوير مصلحتهكان يلقى الدعم الكامل من العائلة يتميز بالعمل الجيد والنشاط يريد ان يؤمن مستقبل جيد له  ولعائلته يسعى الى زيادة مدخوله من خلال تحسين العمل يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء عدة جديدة كرسي للحلاقة وتسديد ما تبقى من ثمن سيارته يحب العمل ويسعى جاهدا على ملاحقة التطور فيه وتأمين افضل عيش لأولاده وعائلته وتحسين وضعه المادي والاجتماعي
texts.en: Houssein works in a barber shop for men. He has eight years of experience in this line of work. He is married with three children. He has a good history with al-Majmoua, and his last loan from al-Majmoua helped him to improve his barber shop in a way which very much benefited him. He received the full support of his family during his last loan. He stands out in his line of work by way of the quality of his service and the energy his puts into his work. He would like to secure a good future for himself and his family, and he is trying to increase his income by improving his business. With a loan from al-Majmoua, Houssein would like to buy new equipment for his barber shop, including new salon chairs. In addition, he would like to settle the rest of the payments he owes on his car. He likes his work, and he puts a lot of effort into finding ways to develop his barber shop. He also puts a lot of effort into securing the best life possible for his children and family, as well as into improving his own financial situation and social status.

loans.use: to buy several new salon chairs for his barber shop.

loans.name: Choun's Group

texts.en:
Five members form this group loan. Mr. Choun is the group leader. He was selected as the group leader by the other members. 

Mr. Choun was born in 1974 and is married to Mrs. Oem, born in 1982. They have three children who all are attending the local school.

Mr. Choun and his wife are recycling sellers who are able to earn a small income to support their family. In order to improve this business, Mr. Choun would like to ask for a loan to buy more recycled goods to resell. They also earn a living by growing herbs, and also as laborers.

loans.use: To buy more recycled items to resell.

loans.name: Zendere

texts.en: Zendere K. H. is a 55 year old lady. She is married to K., and they have three children together. Zendere has been a dairy farmer for the last five years. This marks her second loan from KADET LTD, and she plans to use the money to purchase another dairy cow for her business.  The anticipated profits will be directed into the purchase of medicine and animal feed. Her dream is to become a successful farmer.

loans.use: to purchase another dairy cow

loans.name: Chhiv

texts.en: From the province of Kompong Cham, Chhiv L. is 44 years old, married, and has three children, all of whom attend school.   Her husband, Chea Sary, is 46 and works as a policeman in his village. Chhiv L. is a farmer who inherited the farmland  from her grandmother.  She and her husband grow different kinds of crops. Chhiv L. currently plants a potato crop, which she will harvest when it is mature. Chhiv L. is requesting a loan which she will use to start her potato crop.

loans.use: To grow potatoes

loans.name: Choen's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four members who will each use their part of the loan for different purposes to improve their families' standard of living. Mrs. Choen is the group leader who has been selected by the other members. She is a married woman who has two children who are too young to work or study. She is a pig breeder and can earn some profit to support her family while her husband, Mr. Vun, is a farmer who owns more than one-hectare plot of land where he can grow rice. He sells some part of the rice and with the rest of the rice, he supports his family. He is also a duck breeder. 

Since her husband’s business is getting on well at the present time, Mrs. Choen wants to expand it. So Mrs. Choen is applying for a loan to buy more ducks.

loans.use: To buy more ducks to raise.

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en:
This group loan is comprised of four people who will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their family’s standard of living. The group leader, Mrs. Touch, was selected by the other members. 

Mrs. Touch was born in 1957 and is a widow with three children. Two of her children are seamstresses in garment factories and the youngest is a student. Mrs. Touch sells Khmer cheese to earn a profit and support her family. Her business is doing well and she would like to expand. Therefore, Mrs. Touch is requesting a loan to buy more Khmer cheese to sell.

loans.use: to buy cheese to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Meav's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of thirteen members. Mrs. Meav is the village bank president. She was selected as the village bank president by the other members. 

Mrs. Meav and her husband, Mr. Uk, are farmers. They own a plot of land, which they use to grow rice and vegetables for their family. 

This couple has five children. Two of the children are students and help their parents with farming. One of the other children is a seamstress in a garment factory, another child is a soldier, and the last child is a wedding beautician. 

In order to improve crop growth on Mrs. Meav and Mr. Uk's farm, Mrs. Meav is asking for a loan to dig a well.

loans.use: To dig a well for growing crops

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Mrs. Neang is married. She has two children. One of the children is a driver, who gets a low salary. The other child is studying in local public school. 
She is a Khmer noodle and a porridge seller in the local village where she earns some money to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Hieng, is a sand seller and a farmer who owns a small piece of land where he grows rice. He sells part of the rice and the rest of the rice the family uses. 
In the rice field, it is time to plow, but Mrs. Neang's family does not have enough oxen to plow. So Mrs. Neang is seeking a loan to buy oxen to plow the field.

loans.use: To buy an ox

loans.name: Ihab

texts.ar: ايهاب عمره 39 سنة متزوج وله 3 اولاد يعمل في مطعم لبيع الفروج والسمك وغيره من الاطعمة له في عمله 11 سنة يحب العمل ويتميز عمله بالدقة والنظافة يريد ان يطور عمله حتى يتمكن من تحسين وضع عائلته المادي والاجتماعي فهو يحب لعائلته التحسن في الوضع المادي والاجتماعي يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء عدة جديدة للمحل ثلاجة للسمك و منشار كهرباء ومكنة تغليف له زبائن من محيطه وجيرانه واقاربه يحلم بتطوير عمله وتحسين المبيع لديه حتى يتمكن من تطوير العمل من محل صغير الى مطعم كبير يتمكن من استقبال عدد اكبر من الزبائن فهو يتميز بطموحه الغير محدود ولرغبته بتحسين وضعه المادي
texts.en: Ihab, 39, is married with three children. He has been working for 11 years at a small restaurant that sells chicken, fish, and other foods. He is known at work for his perfection and hygiene. Ihab wants to promote his business. He loves his family and wishes to raise its financiA. and sociA. status. Ihab wants a loan from A. Majmoua to buy new equipment for his restaurant: fridge for fish, power saw, and packing machine.His clients are mainly from his neighbours, relatives and those who know him. He wishes to expand his business and to turn his small restaurant into a big one so that he can receive more clients. Ihab is very ambitious and wishes to raise his standard of living.

loans.use: To buy a fridge, power saw, and packing machine for his restaurant.

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en:
Pheap is the mother of five children, one of whom is a construction worker, another one is a rice seller who gets a low salary, another is a bicycle repairer, and the others are attending the local public school. She is a pig and chicken breeder who can earn some profit to support her family, while her husband is a motorcycle repairer and an iron welder. Since her business is getting on well, she wants to expand. 

So to improve her situation, she is seeking a loan to buy more pigs and pig food, and with the rest of the loan she is going to buy more iron welding supplies. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: to buy more pigs and pig food

loans.name: Um

texts.en: Um H. resides in the province of Kompong Cham. She makes a daily profit by helping other local farmers to grow rice. From this occupation, she usually earns an income of around $1 each day. She has a life partner in her husband who is highly skilled at building stone and wooden houses in and around his village. The couple are blessed with four children, three of whom are single while the other one is married. Um H. is concerned that her married child does not have their own house yet and still lives with her. Therefore, Um H. has decided to ask for a Kiva loan to add to her personal savings in order to buy a plot of land to build a small house for her married child to live.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land in order to build a small house

loans.name: Hea's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of ten members. Mr. Hea is the village bank president. He was selected as the village bank president by the others members.
Mr. Hea, who was born in 1975, is a motorcycle taxi driver who is able to earn a small income to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Pril, is a farming laborer. The couple has three children: two stay at home and the other is a student. Currently, Mr. Hea wants to buy some home appliances, but he doesn’t have enough money to do so. Therefore, he would like to ask for a loan to add to his savings in order to purchase home appliances.

loans.use: to purchase home appliances

loans.name: Dib

texts.ar: ديب اعزب وعمره 33 سنة يعمل في بيع وتربية المواشي له في عمله هذا 20 سنة يحب عمله ويريد ان يطوره يحلم في بناء عائل كبيرة يكون اساسها جيد ومتين وقائم على مدخول جيد يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء اغنام جديدة وشراء اعلاف للغنم فهو يربي الماشية بحب فهو مزارع اصيل يعمل بكد ونشاط له تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة وقد ساهم القرض السابق من تطوير العمل شراء عدد اكبر من المواشي يحلم بأن يصبح صاحب مزرعة كبيرة تضم عدد اكبر من المواشي والدواجن وغيره من الحيوانات
texts.en: Dib is 33 years old and single. He works raising and selling livestock. He has 20 years of experience in this line of work. He likes his work and is looking for ways to develop his business. He dreams of starting a big family on a solid financiA. foundation. With a loan from A.-Majmoua, he would like to increase the number of sheep on his farm, as well as buy feed for his sheep. He takes good care of his livestock as he is an authentic farmer with a strong work ethic. He has a good history with A.-Majmoua, and he used his last loan to effectively develop his business by increasing the number of animals on his farm. He dreams of one day owning a big farm on which he will raise a large number of livestock in addition to other animals.

loans.use: to buy feed for the sheep on his farm and to increase the number of sheep he raises on his farm.

loans.name: Rustam Group

texts.en:
M. Bashir is the leader of the Rustam group. He lives in the 8th district of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married with three children, and lives with his family.

M. Bashir has a bakery in the city of Kabul. He does not have access modern tools to provide food for his customers at his bakery; the building is also very ancient and needs reconstruction. He has therefore requested a loan to purchase modern tools and reconstruct his bakery in order to attract more customers and earn an average monthly income for his family. He appreciates the small-loan process in Afghanistan; he hopes that his loan will be beneficial for his bakery, and will lead to more loan cycles.

loans.use: to purchase modern tools and reconstruct his bakery

loans.name: Kou's Group

texts.en:
This group loan is made up of four members who will use their portion of the loan for different purposes in order to improve their family's standard of living.
Mrs. Kou is the group leader who has been selected by the other members. She was born in 1974 and is a mother of three children who attend a local public school. Mrs. Kou is a pig breeder who earns a profit to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Bang, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where he grows rice to support his family, and he is also a construction worker. Currently, Mrs. Kou has a problem because her husband’s workplace is far away from their house. So to improve this situation, Mrs. Kou is requesting a loan to buy a new motorcycle for her husband to travel to work. Mrs. Soem and Mrs. Pheap are group guarantors, so they are shown in the picture.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle for her husband

loans.name: Ngin

texts.en: Ngin S. L. has spent her life cultivating crops. This is a skill she learned from her grandparent when she was young. She is now married and has six single children; two of them are employed in different jobs to order to earn a profit. Her husband frequently works in the farm fields alongside her. Growing crops is a year on year activity with which she has had great success. She is able to plant the crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. Ngin S. L. is seeking a loan to buy two cows to use in her farming business. The cows can also be used for breeding purposes and Ngin can raise their offspring.

loans.use: to buy two cows to support her farming business

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda T. is from the village of Brgy. Roxas, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 30 years old, married, and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Belinda owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Belinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be Belinda’s 1st loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family’s general living conditions. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisher-folk and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en: Carolyne M. is a 26-year-old from the Lugulu area in Kakamega. She is married to Martin and they have two children aged four and two.  Carolyne runs a beauty salon, and also sells shoes to her clients. She is in need of towels, shampoo, and hair chemicals to add to her stock. She has applied for her second loan to enable her buy these items.  The profits generated from this business will be re-invested to ensure that the business grows. She hopes to be able to open a hairdressing college in the future.

loans.use: to buy towels, shampoo, and hair chemicals to add to her stock

loans.name: Moeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Moeurn was born in 1984. She is a mother of two children who are too young to work or study. She and her husband, Mr. Dy, are both farmers.  Mr. Dy is also a fisherman. They own a small piece of land where they grow rice, some of which they sell, and some of which they use to support their family. The couple have some problems because their field is not producing as it should in this dry season. So to improve rice production, Mrs. Moeurn is seeking a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer, gasoline, and pesticide. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: to buy rice seed, fertilizer, gasoline, and pesticide

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is a 49 year-old widow and mother of two children. Jamila lives and works in Tyre.  She opened a small bakery in 1997, specialized in making  manaqish (Arabic: مناقيش‎ manāqīsh; sometimes called معجنات mu‘ajjanāt 'pastry'), which is a popular Levantine food consisting of dough topped with thyme, cheese, or ground meat. Similar to a pizza, it can be sliced or folded, and it can either be served for breakfast or lunch. The word manaqish is the plural of the Arabic word manqūshah (from the root verb naqasha 'to sculpt, carve out'), meaning that after the dough has been rolled flat, it is pressed by the fingertips to create little dips for the topping to lie in.

Traditionally, Levantine women would bake dough in a communal oven in the morning, to provide their family with their daily bread needs, and would prepare smaller portions of dough with different toppings for breakfast.

Jamila has 16 years in this field.  She started working when her husband died and she found herself alone and responsible for two children. Jamila is a hard worker, she's a person with good reputation and all of her customers and friends speak about her good manners and her shyness. They also described her courage when struggling to prove herself in front of her children and society. 

Jamila is working on expanding her shop through adding upgraded machines that will help increase her income in less time.  She is also willing to do some small decoration to her shop. 

Jamila will also buy a big tent that will expand her working area, and will be used to start a new business. She plans to start a hookah cafe.  Also known as a waterpipe, a hookah is a single or multi-stemmed (often glass-based) instrument for smoking in which the smoke is cooled and filtered by passing through water. The tobacco smoked is referred to as narghile or shisha (sheesha) in the United Kingdom, United States and Canada. According to Cyril Elgood, who does not mention his source, it was Abu’l-Fatḥ Gīlānī (d. 1588), a Persian physician at the court of the Mughal emperor Akbar I, who “first passed the smoke of tobacco through a small bowl of water to purify and cool the smoke and thus invented the hubble-bubble or hookah.” However, a quatrain of Ahlī Šīrāzī (d. 1535) refers to the use of the ḡalyān, thus dating its use at least as early as the time of Ṭahmāsp I (1524–76). It seems, therefore, that Abu’l-Fatḥ Gīlānī should be credited with the introduction of the ḡalyān, already in use in Persia, to India. Smoking the hookah has gained popularity, especially in the Middle East and is gaining popularity in North America, South America, Europe and Australia.

This new business will provide her with extra income helpful for her family, Jamila has been a borrower in good standing  at Al Majmoua for ten cycles.  Each loan was requested to improve a specific part of her business. She hopes to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy new upgraded tools for her business

loans.name: Hoeun

texts.en: Mrs. Hoeun was born in 1978.  She is married to Mr. Sina, and has three children, one of whom is enrolled in the local public school (the others are too small to work or study). She and her husband are farmers who own a small piece of land where they grow rice, some of which they sell, and some of which they use to support their family. Besides being a farmer, Mr. Sina is also a driver who earns a low salary. In this dry season, it is time to grow rice, and Mrs. Hoeun needs some money to help her do this. She would like to ask for a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer, gasoline, and pesticide. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: to buy rice seed, fertilizer, gasoline, and pesticide

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is 40 years old.  She is married and has 5 children.

Liezel works hard to provide for her family. She owns a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has been running it for 10 years.  She also earns additional income from food vending.  

Liezel has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items such as canned goods and noodles to sell in her sari-sari store.  She has borrowed and repaid 4 previous loans from NWTF.

Liezel aspires to improve her sari-sari store business so that she can send her all her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional items for her sari-sari store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Dachi Ami Holassé

texts.fr: Madame Holassé est revendeuse  de pagnes, elle à 30ans. Elle s’approvisionne au Grand Marché de Lomé et revend de façon ambulante. Son activité à commencé en 2001 et elle sollicite ce troisième prêt pour acheter  des pagnes afin de se prendre en charge  et d’accroitre son activité.
texts.en: Mrs. Holassé is a reseller of traditional colorful “pagnes” fabrics. She is 30 years old. She stocks up at the big market of Lomé and resells as a street vendor. Her business was launched in 2001, and now she is seeking a third loan in order to stock up on “pagnes” fabrics in order to be able to grow her activities and support herself.

loans.use: to purchase traditional "pagnes" fabrics

loans.name: Phat

texts.en: Mrs. Phat is a mother of three children. One is a laborer, while the others are studying in the local public school. She was born in 1961. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she grows rice, some of which she sells, and some of which she uses to support her family.   Her husband, Mr. Vong, is in construction. Although they try to work hard, the couple earn little income. So to improve their condition, Mrs. Phat is seeking a loan to buy four piglets and pig food to start a new pig breeding business. She will also use some of the loan to buy a water machine.

loans.use: to buy four piglets and pig food

loans.name: Nhor

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhor is married to Mr. Korb and they have four children.  One is a construction worker, another one is employed in a garment factory, and the others are studying in the local public school.
Mrs. Nhor is a scarf weaver who earns some income to support her family while her husband is a traditional medicine man and a farmer who owns a small piece of land.  He grows rice to sell to support his family. In the rice field it is time for plowing, but Mrs. Nhor can’t plow her field because she does not have enough oxen to plow.  To improve rice production, Mrs. Nhor would like a loan to buy an ox for plowing.

loans.use: to buy an ox

loans.name: Sedemi Akoua

texts.fr: Madame S. à 32ans, elle est mariée à un étudiant et à 02 enfants en charge. Elle habite Nukafu. Akoua est couturière  et désire ajouter à cette activité la vente des articles de mercerie pour pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Elle  a démarré l’activité en 2009. Son approvisionnement se fait au grand marché de Lomé et la revente s’effectue à Nukafu. Vu les conditions difficiles pour assurer  un bon niveau d’études  à ses enfants, elle désire ce premier prêt  pour l’achat des articles de mercerie afin de réaliser un profit et de voir sa famille s’épanouir.
texts.en: Mrs. S. is 32 years old. She is married to a student and has two dependent children. She lives in Nukafu. Akoua is a seamstress and would like to also sell sewing supplies on the side, in order to be able to provide for the family needs. She has launched this business in 2009. She stocks up at the big market of Lomé and resells in Nukafu. Given the difficulty of ensuring a good education for her children, she is seeking this first loan to purchase sewing supplies in order to raise her revenues and help her family succeed.

loans.use: to purchase sewing supplies

loans.name: Kolap

texts.en:
Mrs. Kolap was born in 1967 and is the mother of five children, four of whom are attending the local public school.  The last one is too young to work or study. Mrs. Kolap is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she can grow rice. Some of the rice is sold and the rest is for her family.  

Her  husband, Mr. Seng, is a construction worker and a laborer.   His work place is far away from her home. S. to improve this condition, Mrs. Kolap is asking for a loan to buy a new motorcycle for her husband's transportation to work.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Roeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Roeun is married to Mr. Tha.  Both of them are farmers who own a small piece of land where they grow rice.  Some of the rice is sold and some is kept for the family.  Mr. Tha is a palm juice collector. They can only earn a small income although they work hard. 

Mrs. Roeun would like to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business. This couple has two children who are grocery sellers and who earn a low salary.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a room on to the house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to rent a shop and start his business in the shop and vast his business.

loans.name: Akouavi

texts.fr: Madame Akouavi est âgée de 58ans elle réside à Attiégou. Elle est veuve et à 03 enfants en charge. Elle a démarré l’activité il ya 6ans et est spécialisée dans la vente de pagnes et de céréales.  Madame Akouavi s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays et à Lomé et revend  au marché d’Akodesséwa.  Bien qu’elle s’occupe seule de ses enfants elle reste dynamique, courageuse et elle désire solliciter ce premier prêt pour acheter des pagnes et des céréales afin de mieux vendre pour  réaliser de profit et voir ses derniers grandir dans de bonnes conditions.
texts.en: Mrs. Akouavi is 58 years old and lives in Attiegou. She is a widow with three dependent children. She started her business six years ago, and specializes in the sale of African dresses and cereals. Mrs. Akouavi gets her supplies inside the country and in Lome, and retails on the market of Akodessewa. Even though she takes care of her children by herself, she remains energetic and resolute. She wants to request this first loan to purchase African dresses and cereals in order to sell more, make a profit, and be able to see her younger children grow up in good conditions.

loans.use: To purchases African dresses and cereals

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr:
Madame AISSATOU B. est une femme de 47 ans. Elle est veuve et mère de 08 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de WASSADOU-DÉPÔT depuis le 07 août 2009. Elle a 4 fois de suite reçu de crédit et a toujours remboursé sans contrainte.

Elle est vendeuse de fruits, précisément des bananes. Elle pratique cette activité avant même qu'elle en soit membre du Banc Villageois.

Avec son crédit elle ira toutes les semaines s'approvisionner en bananes à bord champ et revendre au marché du village.

Son objectif est de renforcer son activité afin de pouvoir subvenir à ses besoins et aussi participer à la prise en charge de la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aissatou B. is a 47-year old widow and the mother of eight. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of Wassadou-Dépôt since August 2009. She has obtained loans four times in the past and always repaid them without difficulty.

She sells fruits, more precisely bananas. She had been in this line of business even before joining Banc VIlleagois. With this loan she is going to stock up on bananas every week, buying them from the farmers and reselling at the village market. Her goal is to grow her business in order to be able to support herself and also help pay for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy fruits (bananas) for resale

loans.name: Mrs. Mom Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of fifteen people who will use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their families' standard of living. Mrs. Mom is a village bank leader who has been selected by the other members. 

She was born in 1978.  She is a mother of three children, two of whom are attending the local public school.  The youngest one is a 4 year-old. 
Mrs. Mom is a fruit seller in Phnom Penh city where she can earn money to support her family.  Her husband, Mr. Vet, is a construction worker and a farmer.  He owns a half-hectare plot of land where he grows rice.  Some of the rice is sold and the rest is for the family.

Mrs. Mom wants to start a new business and so is applying for a loan to buy some piglets for breeding.  With the rest of the loan, she will buy bamboo and zinc to fix her house.

loans.use: To buy some piglets

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: From the Reussey Keo commune of Phnom Penh city, Chan N. has been earning a daily income by selling meatballs at the busy market. On average, she could make around 5 USD in profit from her food sales business. She is 54 and she divorced from her husband years ago. Presently, she lives with her six children; five are single and one is married. She has two employed children who always contribute a part of their incomes toward the family's daily expenses. Chan N. would like to ask for her loan in order to rebuild some parts of her broken house. With this loan, she and her children will be able to live in a comfortable house.

loans.use: to rebuild some parts of her broken house.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 38 year-old married woman who lives with her husband and 6 children in Bint Jbeil. Daniel is a hard-working woman.  She started her new business a year ago to help her husband raise their 6 children in a good way. Daniel opened her Internet cafe because she was searching for a business that would be useful for her village's teenagers, where they can come for entertainment or to seek knowledge.  Davis was also searching for something that can keep her children in front of her eyes, so that they don't develop bad habits to entertain themselves (such as using drugs), like some teenagers who don't have someone wise to lead them to the right path to take. 
 
Daniel's business helped a lot in her area.  Her house is directly facing her shop, so she can fulfill her duties as a mother and a businesswoman in a perfect way.

Daniel is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the first time, in order to buy new batteries and uninterruptible power supplies (UPSes) necessary for her business, because she has to provide power to her customers when there's no electricity provided by the government.  

She hopes to expand her business more in the future through adding new computers.

loans.use: To buy new batteries and power supplies for her business

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is currently in the business of washing clothes. She is 39 years old, married, 8 children and 5 of them go to school. Mariam borrowed a loan to stock more water, soap, basins and an ironing box to use. She hopes to pay her children in school with the extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: purchase more water, soap, basins and an ironing box

loans.name: Ayele

texts.fr: Madame Ayélé à 27ans, elle est couturière et réside  à Kégué (un quartier du Togo). Elle est mariée à un revendeur et à 02 enfants en charge. Ayélé à crée son salon de couture depuis 2006 et  a pour nom « TOP CREATION » elle  emploie 06 personnes. Elle désire en plus de son activité faire le commerce des articles de mercerie et des produits de premières nécessités. Elle fait son approvisionnement au Grand marché de Lomé et revend à Kégué. Ce premier prêt  lui permettra de relancer son activité afin de prospérer et de mieux s’occuper de la famille.
texts.en: Mrs Ayélé is 27 years old; she is a seamstress who resides in Kegue (a neighborhood in Togo). She is married to a retailer and has two dependent children. Ayélé created her sewing room in 2006 under the name "TOP CREATION." She employs six people. In addition to her activity, she wants to retail sewing supplies and first-necessity products. She procures her supplies on Lome's Great market, and retails in Kegue. This first loan will allow her to relaunch her activity to prosper and take better care of the family.

loans.use: to purchase sewing supplies and first-necessity products

loans.name: Besse

texts.fr:
Madame BESSE S. est une femme de 63 ans. Elle est veuve sans enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SINTH MALEME DENTAL depuis le 17 juin 2009. Elle a 03 fois de suite bénéficié de prêt et a toujours remboursé sans difficulté.

Elle fait un petit commerce sur étalage de légumes et de condiment pour cuisine. 

Avec son nouveau crédit elle pourra financer son activité de petit afin d'accroitre ses revenus financier et enfin subvenir à ses besoins personnels.
texts.en: Mrs. Besse S. is a 63-year old  widow, without children. She is a member of the Banc Villageois of Sinth Maleme Dental since June 17, 2009. She took out loans three times and always repaid them without difficulty. She sells vegetables and food condiments from a stand. With her loan, she would like to finance her retail business in order to grow her revenue and be able to support herself.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and food condiments for resale

loans.name: Mrs. Uk Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The twelve people who make up this village bank loan will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their families' living standards. Mrs. Uk is the village bank president who has been selected by the other members. She was born in 1964. She and her husband are farmers who own a half-hectare plot of land where she can grow rice. They sell part of the rice and with the rest of the rice they support their family. She is also a fruit seller at the local market. 

Since her business is recently getting on well, she wants to expand, so Mrs. Uk would like to ask for a loan to buy more fruit for resale. She is a mother of four children, two of whom are laborers, while the other two are studying in the local public school.

loans.use: To buy more fruit for resale.

loans.name: Mrs. Pich Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nine people who have selected Mrs. Pich to be the village bank president make up this village bank loan. They will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their families' living standards. 

Mrs. Pich was born in 1969. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she can grow rice. She sells part of the rice and feeds her family with the rest of the rice. Her husband, Mr. Hai, is a battery seller. Since her husband’s business is getting on well, she wants to expand. So Mrs. Pich is seeking a loan to bU. more batteries for resale. This couple has four children, two of whom are employed in garment factories, while the other two are studying in local public schools.

loans.use: To buy more batteries for her husband to resell.

loans.name: Bassel

texts.ar: باسل عمره 28 سنة اعزب يعمل في محل للحلاقة رجالي له في عمله 6 سنوات يحب عمله ويريد دائما تطويره وتحسينه يريد دائما تحسين ظروفه المادية والاجتماعية فهو يسعى جاهدا الى تأسيس عائلة محبوب من محيطه العملي له زبائن كثر من محيط ضيعته وجوارها يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء كرسي للحلاقة و شراء ذهب للخطوبة فهو يسعى الى هذه الخطوة وذلك من حبه الى تكوين عائلة
texts.en: Bassel is 28 years old and single. He works in a barber shop for men and he has six years of experience in this line of work. He likes his work and is always looking for ways to develop his business. He would like to improve his material circumstances and his social status because he would like to start a family. He is well-liked by his work community. He has many customers from his community and his neighborhood. With a loan from al-Majmoua, Bassel would like to buy some salon chairs as well as the gold required in his society for an engagement. He very much wants to go through with the engagement process soon, as he would love to start a family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy several new salon chairs for his barber shop.

loans.name: Chhea

texts.en:
Sewing clothes is the main part of 35-year-old Chhea S.'s daily duty at the garment industry. She has been engaged in her job for over one year and has a formal salary. She has a life partner in her husband who works as a blacksmith in Phnom Penh city. The couple helps each other to earn money to feed their four kids. All of the kids are attending school. 

Recently, their living conditions have not been comfortable because their house is surrounded by pollutants, which is harmful to their health. Therefore, Chhea S. would like to request a loan to build a toilet for her family. She hopes to use the rest of the funds to repair her old kitchen.

loans.use: to build a toilet for her family and mend her old kitchen.

loans.name: Eunia

texts.en:
Eunia O. is 38 years old.  She is from Kakamega.  She is married to Daniel and they have three children, aged 6, 10, and 8.

Eunia has a business selling ropes. She normally sells them to livestock farmers.  Eunia is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy more ropes so that she can serve her clients well. The profits made will be used to cater to her family's needs.

Eunia's desire is to diversify into dairy farming in the future.

loans.use: to buy more ropes to sell

loans.name: Jipargul's Group

texts.en:
Jipargul K. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Bokonbaevo, a small village in the Isykul region.  Jipargul is 41 and married to a farmer. Together with her husband, she brings up two sons and a daughter. All the children are in school. 

Jipargul's family is engaged in farming.  They cultivate agricultural products and make money by selling the harvest. In order to earn additional money to meet family needs, Jipargul also sells homemade food and drinks.  Jipargul has applied for this loan because her family needs money to purchase fertilizers and a variety of seeds for farming. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Saul

texts.en:
Saul O. is a 52-year-old from Bungoma.  He is married and has two children who are 30 and 27 years old.

Saul is a carpenter and has been in this business for the past 10 years. He is applying for his third loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy more timber to use in his workshop to make cupboards and household furniture. 

Saul will use the profits generated to cater to his family's needs. He hopes to be able to open up another workshop in the neighbouring town.

loans.use: To buy timber for his carpentry business

loans.name: Joanes

texts.en: Joanes is 33 years old.  He is married and blessed with three children. He runs a motorbike transport business for a living.  He has been operating his business for two years.  He also sells charcoal and does farming for extra income.  He hopes to add ten more motorbikes to his business and employ more people.  He has requested for 20,000 KES to add stock of charcoal to resell.

loans.use: To buy charcoal to resell

loans.name: Mrs. Bunsok Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of 11 people. Mrs. Bunsok is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. Each member's portion of the loan will be used for different purposes in order to improve their family's standard of living. 
Mrs. Bunsok is a farmer who owns a one-hectare plot of land where she grows rice for her own family and to sell. She is also a beautician while her husband is a soldier. Since her business is getting on well, Mrs. Bunsok wants to expand it. Therefore, to improve her business, Mrs. Bunsok is applying for a loan to buy more beauty equipment. She is a mother of two children who are farmers.

loans.use: to buy more beauty equipment

loans.name: Fayrouz

texts.en:
Fayrouz is a 54-year-old divorced woman, the mother of one child. Fayrouz lives and works in Dahieh with her child.  She started working 10 years ago when she found herself alone, and she works hard to provide a living for her small family.
 
Fayrouz has been an Al Majmoua borrower for three consecutive cycle, and she is a member in good standing. Most of her customers describe her good manners and hard work. Her previous loans helped in proving herself and supporting her business. This time her request is to improve her business by buying a new modern advanced tailoring machine.  This machine is necessary to do the requested work in a short time and also to provide perfect quality.  Fayrouz would also like to buy a collection of textiles that helps her customers finish the design they need in a very short time.

Fayrouz hopes to move her business outside her house to a nearby shop, so she can provide her child with the privacy that every person needs and requests.

loans.use: To buy a modern advanced tailoring machine

loans.name: Deyaa

texts.ar: ضياء عمره 21 سنة اعزب يعمل في محل لبيع اللحم والدجاج له في عمله 6 سنوات يتميز عمله بالنظافة والدقة والجدية في العمل يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء عدة جديدة للعمل براد للحمة والدجاج وشراء خلاط ضياء جدي في العمل له زبائن من محيطه وجيرانه واقاربه له معرفة في عمله وهذا ما يميزه انه يسعى الى تحسين وضعه المادي وزيادة مدخوله حيث انه في طور تأسيس مستقبل فهو في بادىء حياته ويحب ان يكون مستقبله جيد متطور ومنتج لانه طموح يعمل بكل طاقته
texts.en: Deyaa is 21 years old and works as a butcher. He has been doing this for six years and is distinguished for precision, hygiene, and seriousness in his work. With this loan he wants to purchase new appliances for his shop, more meat and poultry, and a blender. Deyaa is hardworking and has customers from amongst his relatives, neighbours as well as other local residents. He has intricate knowledge of what he does and this distinguishes him from others. He aspires to improve his financial situation and increase his income as he wants to build a good future for himself. He is young, ambitious and gives his all to his business.

loans.use: to buy new appliances and a blender for his butcher's shop

loans.name: Mrs. Sophat Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of 11 members. Mrs. Sophat is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. Each member will use their portion of the loan for different purposes in order to improve their family's standard of living.
Mrs. Sophat is a mother of three children, one of whom is a laborer while the others study at the local public school. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she grows rice for her own family and to sell. Her husband, Mr. Norb, owns some cinema equipment that he rents out to earn some money to support his family. Since her husband’s business is getting on well, Mrs. Sophat wants to expand it. Therefore, she is applying for a loan to buy more cinema equipment.

loans.use: to buy more cinema equipment

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Sorn S., age 49, is a rice farmer who lives in Preypreah Commune, Kampong Tom province. She is married and has eight children. Sorn S.’s husband is the head of the family so he has to work hard every day to cover his family’s living expenses. He has many jobs to generate income such as raising piglets and growing rice. 

Sorn S. also assists her husband in the same businesses. They typically generate a daily income of about $5. In order to earn extra income, Sorn S. will be using the loan to buy more piglets to raise for sale. Sorn S. and her daughter are shown in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise for sale.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is a 33-year-old single mother of two.  For seven years, she has been operating a salon.  She also runs a grocery store for extra income.  In the past, she has operated a retail shop.  

Naomi has experienced a lot of change since she joined Faulu Kenya.  This is because she used her previous loans to boost her business.  Naomi has requested for 58,000 KES to buy more cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Elchin

texts.ru: Elchin I. 23 qoda. On ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. Elchin projivayet v qorode Baku vmeste so svoim bratom. Elchin uje 2 qoda kak imeyet svoy magazin "Baybi shop" qde prodayet vse chto otnositsya detyam (detskuyu odejdu, detskuyu mebel, detskiye igrushki i t.d). Seychas Elchin nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit detskuyu mebel dlya pereprodaji. On ranshe rabotal v magazine dyadi qde i nauchilsya etomu biznessu.
texts.en: Elchin I. is 23 years old. He is single without children. Elchin lives in the city of Baku together with his brother. For the pas two years, he has been keeping a store called “Baby shop,” where he sells all kinds of children’s items (children’s clothing, furniture, toys, etc). At present Elchin needs to 2000 AZN in order to buy children’s furniture for resale. He used to work in his uncle store, which was how he learned this business.

loans.use: to purchase children's furniture

loans.name: Liza's Group

texts.en:
Liza K. K. is a member of this group. She is a resident of Bokonbaevo, a small village on the south coast of Isykul lake. She is 41 years old and unfortunately is a widow. Liza has two sons, both of them are of pre-school age (under seven). 

In 2009 Liza started a business sewing Kyrgyz national clothing and selling dressmaking supplies. She started with an initial investment of 5000 soms and now earns 1500 soms per month. With money received from this loan, Liza will purchase materials and fabrics needed for sewing. In the future, she wants to give her children a good education and improve her family’s living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and materials

loans.name: Fatou B.

texts.fr:
FATOU B. B. est une femme de 46 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SINTH MALEME DENTAL depuis le 17 juin 2009. Elle a 03 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit et a toujours remboursé régulièrement. 

Elle fait un petit commerce de tissu "thioub" Elle vend également le petit déjeuné.

Avec son nouveau crédit elle va acheter des tissus "thioub" pour le petit commerce, et acheter un stock de lait, de beurre, d'œufs etc pour la vente de petit déjeuné.

Son objectif est de renforcer son activité et d'accroitre ses bénéfices afin de subvenir à ses besoins personnels et de participer à la prise charge familiale.
texts.en:
